sequence: There's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster, Sergeant Rutledge, and The Sun Shines Bright. It was these three films with no box office names in them that Ford didn't have to tailor the film around the persona of a star being it John Wayne, Henry Fonda, or any of the others he worked with. Not surprising that Ford considered all these as favorites of one kind or another. Ben Johnson and Harry Carey, Jr. a couple of likable cowpokes sign on to guide a Mormon wagon train to a valley in Arizona territory.

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer ( exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle ) being chased by the police in an expensive sedan. In the back seat is his son ( Robert Redford ), who is on the lam. He manages to sneak out a window and drive away. This is probably the worst film I've ever seen. After watching it I would have said that maybe I didn't watch the right films, but after watching this I have no idea. There's absolutely no suspense whatsoever.

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox's reluctance to release a full screen restored version in DVD. Yes, the history may be a bit inaccurate and it is certainly not as powerful as the book, BUT it was the 2nd film by Fox made in Real Cinemascope and the production values alone merit a restoration and distribution. I saw this film in second grade and it triggered my lifelong interest in all things Egyptian, culminating in my visiting Egypt 4 years ago! Amazing the power of film on a child's imagination, eh?

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world. The movie was directed by Edward Burns, who also wrote the screenplay. I love a good soap opera. One of the reasons I love them so much is that they are usually so entertaining, funny, and well researched. However, I hate when a soap opera fails at making me care about any of the characters involved. For years I've heard it said that M*A*S*H used to make me care what happened to those soldiers.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through . It has a great ensemble of characters , and an even greater story, and a very strong script. I only wish this movie had more money spent on directing, editing, and producing. The ending is a bit odd. What makes this movie so bad? First of all, it is full of ridiculous scenes that would never occur in real life. Like a man's head being crushed during a wrestling match, and then later, his body being cut off by a large knife, while still alive!

This movie is Wonderful ! I can watch it again and again . Robin hood is Perfectly cast , and he does an excellent job of being the bad guy . There is nothing good about this film.I could sit through the whole film, or I could watch it a second time. In both cases you'll find yourself asking "why? "I'm not saying to turn it off, but go ahead and turn it off for ten minutes so that you can try and understand why people like it.For one thing there is very little action at all.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are bound for a valley where they can settle and live in peace. The scenes of the corral in the town where Ward Bond and Ben Johnson negotiate prices, and Bond introduces the idea of them (Johnson and his partner played by Harry Carey Jr.) leading the train to this valley, are some of the best in the film, as Johnson, a real cowboy, whittles a piece of wood while he banters with Bond.

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for ``Casino Royale'' (which turned out not to be filmed) but never happened. Here's an explanation of why this scene was shot. Well, if you want to watch a movie that has almost every single plot point of the "Star Wars" prequels spoiled, then this film is for you.If you haven't already noticed, I find it very difficult to rate a film without giving any spoilers at all.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the year (it even got a 2 out of 5 rating on IMDb) and with good reason! This movie has nothing to do with real life. It is made by a producer who had never seen an action movie at the cinema, in his life, before. If he had, he would have known that movies don't start with a car chase and finish with a murder.The script is so incoherent that you can make out very little.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright, Wagon Master was one of Ford's favorite films. It is a western of exceptional beauty and narrative purity, well acted by members of Ford's 'stock company', including Jane Darwell, Alan Mowbray, Ward Bond,and Harry Carey, Jr.Like almost all of Ford's films,it is a meditation on freedom and community. It is also noteworthy for a much more positive portrayal of Indians than in most of Ford's movies. Ford, for all his faults, remains the supreme poet of American Democracy.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships , 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the director and writer are of Irish heritage, which is evident from the dialogue. The plot follows the lives of two brothers, Billy and Mark. Mark is an alcoholic, living with his mother, Sally. When Mark's father goes into a coma, he moves in with his brother Billy, who suffers from paranoid schizophrenia and has trouble sleeping.The writing is decent, but the characters lack any depth. I bought this movie to watch when I was 13.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's best to watch this one with the sound off but just concentrate on Meredith as she moves across the screen. Save your money until the TV network comes out with a DVD on "Beyond the Prairie". It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew , a narrative depth superior to most novels , wonderful music and, of course, one hell of a battle scene!The movie takes place in the period of 16th-19th century Japan where the Shinsengumi (an elite Japanese military fighting force) is facing off against the Shimabara (a group of outlaw samurai). The two armies are led by Gen. Katsura Oda (who had just returned to Japan after being defeated by Gen. Meiji at the Battle of Nagasaki), and his right-hand man Uchida Goshu (who he had sent to capture the Shimabara).

People need to give this show a chance . The people who write bad reviews ( there are very few of them ) are often the same people who liked the TV show when it started. They are usually trying to be clever but they're wrong . I remember watching this show when it first was on in 2001. I couldn't believe what I was watching. The cast was good-looking and had good acting ability. And yet, no one seemed to like it. I thought at the time that it might make for a great comedy.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant references made to it here in North America as a porn film. Our obsession with what is, or should be, regarded as pornographic remains a relic of the 'guidance' provided to film makers by the Hayes committee many, many years ago and it is now really time that we relegate it to the past. So far we have not progressed far beyond establishing a somewhat arbitrary division between what we now term 'soft' and 'hard' porn, with both carrying the same pornography label.

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome; more bloodshed and very graphic details (a bit too much for my taste). Great script and acting (I was especially impressed by Ken Stott and there were no weak points in te cast). Good cinematography and very realistic stereo-sound. One of the best thrillers I've seen since years. Although it was scheduled on BBC in three parts I watched Messiah on video in one take. One point of critic; the motivation of the villain was not very convincing.

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it ! It is so sweet and heartwarming , that you will want to cry. But sadly the film has a dark ending, but even then I wouldn't have minded if the ending was different. The main problem is not the film, because it is really well made, but how the director chose to end it. There are many parts that could have been more effective than what ended up being shot. Some very minor characters are given no background, and their sole purpose seems to be to be put out of the picture.

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I expected. Instead the director Jeff Lieberman conjures up a wonderfully evocative and disquieting atmosphere for great stretches of the movie, building the suspense constantly until I was really unsure about what was going to happen but wound up tight as a spring waiting for it. The lack of action in many parts gave it a very Deliverance mixed with The Texas Chainsaw Massacre kinda ambiance, and when the action really kicks in, its truly shocking and dramatic, without ever even really needing to be gory.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial . The films that featured their brood paved the way for many more to come. However , in this one it's just plain dumb. I don't know how they thought this one would be a success except with kids. I watched this movie last night, and after the first twenty minutes I realized it was so much worse than my other favorite horror flick, 'Scary Movie'. I couldn't even get through two hours of this thing, and if I had to do it all over again I would not waste any more time than necessary.

15 Park Avenue, well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in Kolkata. However as the story unfolds, one realize the thin line that director tries to walk between Relationships, Social Cause and of course the world of Schizophrenia. I would say Aparna Sen is one director who has so much more to say and has so less time at disposal. Well no doubt she has managed to make a good movie. In a way she makes us realize that probably each one of us is looking for our own '15 Park Avenue'.

Renee Zellweger is Betty , a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse , who is infatuated with a fellow employee. Betty is a good-looking, sweet-natured waitress in the small town of Pottawattamie. One day she is asked to help move a box from a delivery truck to another truck. When she pulls up at the front of the truck, the car's engine is nowhere to be found! She looks around to see where the engine may be, only to find that the truck it was towing is nowhere to be seen either!

The best of everything . Just what is the best of everything ? It is different for everyone but for a few, it's something special that they only get to experience once. I'm not saying this film is without faults as it has its good and bad points but it is still a nice little movie to sit and enjoy at a leisurely evening with your mates. A couple of laughs in an otherwise fairly tame film. I watched this movie because someone suggested I check it out from a friend who had already checked it out.

My kids loved this movie. we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie. we watched it as a family and everyone of us enjoyed it. it was a movie you could watch without any uncomfortable spots that you would have to explain to the younger ones. my boys loved this movie and they would love to be able to see it again. even after all these years they remember it. that Amy Jo Johnson was a very cute girl. all my boys had crushes on her. they loved her as the pink power ranger which is why we watched this movie to begin with.

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film : Who are the crazy people ? The answer become less clear and more complicated as the film progresses. It's a nice little romance, but there's just no point to the story - I mean, what is all the fuss about? There's nothing to be learned, nothing interesting about the characters, not even a thing that would interest anyone. I'm sure there were some good laughs, but I don't think so. This movie made me want to give up on love altogether.

As a European , the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980 's and it gives you a good laugh or two, but at the cost of giving up some of the important plot development. This movie was so boring. It had no substance, no real story whatsoever...I mean, I know that sounds like a stretch, but I would not consider this movie to be worthy enough of a 1 out of 10!The characters were flat (except for John Goodman who did a great job) while the action scenes were uninteresting.

honestly.. this show warms my heart, i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season has started i'm even more hooked than before.. the characters are so well-developed and their relationships are so real.. i would recommend this show for any woman or mother and daughter.. the Lorelei's are super fast talking witty girls that will, truly inspire you and the show is hysterical at times and never too too serious, but serious enough for it to be completely addicting.. it's an hour long which is a major PLUS because you can't ever get enough Gilmore!

I wanted to watch this , to get a inside look at the show . It told the story more or less straight from the book , and it did make some interesting plot points that are not explained too well.The only problem with the film is that the pacing is a little uneven. I was wondering who they would have chosen to cast for the roles . Some of the dialog seemed like it was lifted from the books . There is a whole scene where someone tries to tell his father he must leave in an attempt to prevent him from committing suicide .

I ca n't help but notice the negative reviews this movie has gotten . To be honest , I saw this movie because I needed some time off and was craving a comedy. So I went to my local big-box store, bought two crappy movies and rented them. This made me think "what the heck" and rent a few others that had been put out by the same company. This film is very well made, but in terms of content, it failed miserably in many ways. Firstly, it doesn't try to be anything other than a spoof on slasher films.

Don't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you? Growing up with Disney I always found myself being captivated by the characters. Every single one seemed truly talented and knew how to act their way through a movie. I remember Friday nights and running to turn on the TV just to watch their newest movies. Susie Q was one of my all time favorites. I never forgot this movie. Even till this day when one mentions the song "Susie Q" I always remember the movie.

Well, I'm a few days late but what the hell....! Anyways, the word that best describes my reaction to "See No Evil" was....SURPRISE. The film is actually pretty good. There is definitely an ample amount of blood, gore & action in the film with a modest amount of suspense. It hearkens back to the good ole' slasher days of the late 70's & early 80s. Think "Madman" meets Leatherface with a dash of Norman Bates and you'll get a good feel for this flick.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release . It is a delightfully cute movie. However, I can't for the life of me find it in my heart to recommend it (or anyone) to anyone who hasn't seen it already. I am a film buff! I love seeing movies at the cinema. I love watching them over and over until they run out of story, so that I don't have to pay another penny to watch them again later. And this movie was NOT one of my favourite films!

Great Movie ! The sound track is awesome ! Very relaxing sound . Elton was ahead of his own time in my opinion and this movie is just like one of his early movies. The story takes place in the 1940's, before World War II. Two women from different countries are on their way to see their daughter who has just been born. When they reach an isolated city, they are met by a man who wants them to marry. There are many twists and turns in the film. It starts out very romantic, with plenty of passion.

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment. This movie does an excellent job of revealing the complexity of the task and the incredible challenges facing South Africa. I believe every one should see this movie as I think few people outside of South Africa understand its past and what is being attempted in the Truth and Reconciliation process. Almost every country has some part of its own history which is still a source of continuing hatred and bitterness. We all need to understand ways of dealing with the past. What's happening in South Africa should guide us all.

There 's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster , Sergeant Rutledge , and The General to join the ranks. I think we could all learn a few things from them about what it feels like to be alive. I can't help but notice this movie has more bad effects than Good ones. Every time there is some kind of horrific accident, something terrible happens. In fact, one of the main plot lines was based on a real car accident. I also noticed that most of the dialog is recycled dialogue from other films.

The show is GREAT . No words to describe it . Wonderful music . Incredible dance . The editors could of done a much better job on this show and they would of had a winner . What can be said about this show? Well, you know when you walk in and see an empty theater and you are the only one in there? This was that. When I bought the DVD boxset (it was pretty much sold out) I felt so bad for all my friends who were not able to see this gem.

Yes, this is one of the better done television movies and I wouldn't expect less from Joe Sargent. One thing for this reviewer is that I was also a great fan of The Carpenters, I got to sing all of their material in elementary school and middle school choir and I got to do much of the solo material of which Karen sang lead. I thought she was one of the most wonderful pop singers of the 70's - and being a child/teen singing these songs and learning music - the one thing I was looking forward to was meeting this woman.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty , easily one of the most charming , off-beat , and lighthearted comedies to come out of the 70s. A group of high school seniors take an overnight trip to Cape Cod, and are visited by a man who claims to be a doctor who is looking for a young female patient named Betty. First of all there is no reason for me to even rate this movie or any film with this rating other than to warn others about it. I just don't know how anyone can go to sleep at night and enjoy this trash.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door, I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling. On the one hand, I'm happy. I'm watching something that has been well thought out, seamlessly executed and just daring enough to be interesting. On the other hand I find myself lamenting the level of comedy generally produced. TV and films are so consistently packed with easy, condescending crap that we find ourselves judging excellence within a scale of mediocrity. Then you see someone like Davis, who, without the "benefit" of studio notes or substantial budget; can create a really cool little comic gem.

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot , while still maintaining a semblance of a suspenseful plot . It is just plain boring and leaves you wondering why this film even exists . I was really excited to watch this movie because I heard it's a good remake of "Cabin Fever II: Jokers Wild", but it was so bad that it wasn't funny. There were no characters that I felt like I could identify with. They all acted like teenagers, in high school, talking about nothing much.

Unlike some of the former commentators, I was (and am) an avid fan of the Carpenters. Face it, Christmas would never be Christmas without The Carpenters. That said, I believe the movie did a good, not excellent, job at depicting Karen's life. The movie was enjoyable to see on primetime TV, but the content fell a little short. I suggest that you all look into getting some of the Carpenters specials that were shown in the 70's. You cannot believe how awesome a drummer Karen was. Cynthia did not capture the extent of Karen's talent.

Well , I 'm a few days late but what the hell .... ! Anyways , the word that best describes how I feel when I think about this movie is AWFUL. I'm sorry but I really don't have any other way to express it than this . This is an absolute piece of crap. I mean, come on....the opening sequence, which seems like a completely random dream sequence, and then you see the two young guys walking around in the desert...then the scene changes to them talking about how they're gonna steal the treasure for their boss...and so on and so on.

This movie used to be played constantly on the Disney Channel when I was a bit younger , and I watched it so much that I actually gave myself an eating disorder. When I'm feeling down, I will usually turn to this film and watch it alone for awhile, just to escape from all the people around me.There were two main reasons as to why I hate this film so much: (1) the actors are absolutely horrible, and (2) there was almost nothing of value whatsoever. The acting is terrible, especially from some of the minor supporting roles, and the storyline is completely unbelievable.

This show is really great. It's smart.It's funny.It's great acting and writing. This show is really the fastest show I've ever seen. The Dialogues are really funny and well acted. Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel have a great chemistry.You really do believe they are mother and daughter. This show really showed that mother daughter relationships really don't have to be just mother and daughter, they can be best friends but on the same time it shows that it's really hard sometimes being more than just mother and daughter especially with Lorelai and Emily.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released. The controversy that surrounded the original release (teen nudity, physical intimacy and unwed pregnancy) were subjects that never touched our view of the film. We were close to the same age as Paul and Michelle and were experiencing many of the same intense and confusing emotions. We were too young to get caught up in the simplistic (at times) acting and the corny (at times) emotional twists. This movie spoke to us in a way that an adult love story never could have.

I LOVE this movie. and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore. I think they should definitely put Susie Q back on the air at least one night so we can record it!!! but if not does anyone know where I can find it?? my email is cristin6891@aim.com please email me if you know where i can find this movie. Online, or anywhere. I told my kids about this movie and i think that they deserve to see it also. All these Disney movies that are coming out now are fake and boring.

I don't think I have ever seen a better movie parody. Mel Brooks is insane. EVERY time I watch it I find something new and it makes it even more funny than the time before. Cary Elwes is perfect for the role of Robin Hood. It has a great and unexpected ending that leaves you cracking up. Every character is great from Little John and Will to Maid Marian and Broomhilde. I laughed the whole way through and will never get tired of it. Watch it! !If you liked Cary Elwes in this Movie, you must definitely see The Princess Bride.

This is definitely an excellent show. I don't have cable, so I started renting them, because my friend recommended it. I thought it would be a teen soap, you know, who's dating who, that kind of thing. But it was not. It is surprisingly deep. It is also very witty. It moves at a very fast pace, and there are more and more jokes you catch every time you watch it. It is a comedy-drama, which is rare when well done. It is about Rory and Lorelai's relationship.

I went straight to the big screen to view this kicker . This is the only flick that I know of that can make a full moon shine like it did in the opening scenes.The movie begins with us in a motel room waiting for a strange man, who turns out to be a serial killer known only as Dr. Rufus (William Hurt). Dr. Rufus is a sadistic doctor who makes his living from killing. One day he kidnaps two little girls and threatens them with a hammer. He leaves them on the street and goes home to kill again.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through. It has a great ensemble of characters, an origional plot, and an ending I shoulda seen coming but didn't and pulls at your heart strings.If theres any one thing about this movie that got me the most it was Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock's interaction. These two are great and it warms my heart to see Rock isn't going to do crappy Big Hollywood fare like Lethal Weapon 4 for the rest of his life. Freeman is as always the man, really there shouldnt be any need to critique his work anymore.

I really like this show. It has drama, romance, and comedy all rolled into one. I am 28 and I am a married mother, so I can identify both with Lorelei's and Rory's experiences in the show. I have been watching mostly the repeats on the Family Channel lately, so I am not up-to-date on what is going on now. I think females would like this show more than males, but I know some men out there would enjoy it! I really like that is an hour long and not a half hour, as th hour seems to fly by when I am watching it!

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars! I really don't care what people can say badly about this movie...because it's a really well played parts from Samuel L. Jackson, and mainly by Christina Ricci!! I'm a big fan of hers, right since I saw her in Addams Family...been trying to watch all things she makes, and this is absolutely one of the best parts she played!! I love her looks (even though people say she's not pretty...I think she is...and I love her eyes)!!

Having just watched this with my mother (Who got it for Christmas) i was thrilled to find something different to the usual stuff i usually watch. All of the stories were detailed and you are able to feel strong emotion towards each character from the very beginning. Every storyline is followed through brilliantly, making you feel completely different things for every single character. The cast is amazing, my personal favourites being James Read and Lesley-Anne Down, as George Hazard and Madeline Fabray/LaMotte/Main. The whole thing is in depth and wonderful, making very compulsive viewing, i recommend it to almost everyone.

Recently I saw this movie again ( after 25 years ) . In the original there is a scene in which an old friend of mine had passed away , he was talking with his son about his father . The young lad said : "I don't think that my father will like me any more, we used to be so close when we were kids." This is one of the worst pieces of trash I've seen in a long time. I am embarrassed to have been part of the viewing party.

`` Jaded '' takes on the complex question of abuse : the perpetrators and the victims . In lesser hands, this could have been an amusing film ; it is actually quite disturbing. The main problem with "Dumb and Dumber" is that it's too easy. There's no real suspense about it, either. This is the sort of movie you'd see if your favorite sitcom was being retitled "The Adventures of Beavis & Butt-Head". The acting is flat and the characters are almost as insufferable as they are hilarious. The jokes aren't original or funny.

It came before `` the ten commandments '' `` land of the Pharaohs '' `` Ben Hur '' and it was not even a hit. I know, I know, how can one be in love with such a lousy film? Well, I have to say that I find it pretty darned good. I've seen this flick several times. I think most people will agree that this is one of the worst films I've ever seen. The entire plot seems to be a series of lame jokes that were intended to be funny.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent, unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters. In the same way I loathed Fargo on first viewing, then realized I was still thinking about it days later and enjoying it somehow, I liked Nurse Betty a lot more the day after I saw it. Hard to understand, harder to explain. As others have said, it's quite forced in many ways, but that seems to be part of what makes it so striking.Fair job by Greg Kinnear, great work from Morgan Freeman (although I worry that he's being stereotyped as the principled villain).

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen ( mostly in English ) she plays a mother in an Indian slum with her two daughters. The story revolves around their father who was working as a laborer in a foreign city and lost all his money to a local gambler. So he came back to India and got a job in a small town. I could not see the movie for some reason, but I am so glad that I saw it because I thought I would just watch it again.

If you repeat a lie enough number of times will it become the truth? 15 park avenue is the story of an alternative reality of a schizophrenic (Mithi). The movie is about her search for her home at a fictitious address where her imaginary husband and 5 children live. Aparna Sen delivers yet another masterpiece. Each and every actor of the movie was better than the other. Konkona Sen looks unbelievably convincing as a schizophrenic. She pulls off the role with such ease and maturity beyond her age. Shabana Azmi is incredible as usual.

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film. I had just seen the MOOG doc, which was alright, the only problem was Moog led a very content life, and the doc was well... content. Haack's story is filled with all the marketable tragedy people buy into these days, but it carries a great deal of heart with it. Though the film doesn't go into the tragic stuff so much, one can sense that Bruce accepted the price of making music his way. There are so many elements that make up his legacy IE.

One of the most entertaining of all silent comedies is Pudovkin 's short 'Chess Fever ' , a mad tale about chess and insanity. I've heard it compared to The Man with Two Brains , but its main idea is nothing like that film. There's not a lot of action, which is probably down to the short running time (12 minutes). I really didn't have much expectations going in to this one. After reading the description from IMDb, I figured this was just going to be an interesting piece of black comedy.

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off . The story moves back and forth from these two brothers' adventures, each with their own version of the events (one is in jail for murder and the other one is a war hero). After having read some reviews on here that said they couldn't stand this show, I just had to watch it. It did have its good points, but those are more than outweighed by the bad. First of all, there was NO suspense in the story.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a lot more concepts till now which has to be expressed and the film is a great media to do that. Well all great actors together hence nothing to say about acting or directing but the film gave us a great message through out. It has nicely predicted the conditioning of human minds with that of the patient. We all believe that what we believe is true with our own point of view and we want to solve all the problem accordingly.Hence from the professor to the maid servant all tried their own ways.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents , the filmmaker 's mother dies , but he continues making movies despite the fact that she has passed. One day, his film is shown at a school movie night. He meets a kid who says "I can do better than you"
I saw this one with my cousin and it wasn't very good. I think there were a lot of kids in the show, which I guess was why it didn't seem to have as much presence as it should have. My cousin liked it more than me.

Absolutely, I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting,fascinating and certainly beautiful film. It's not necessary to see all the episodes,since the first ones are the best,while the last ones are a-bit tiresome,but for any person who likes German's and their good-natured ways,all episodes are worth seeing.In typical german fashion, values are constantly questioned,even it's murderous Nazi past is confronted in the last episodes, the rich dialogues are particularly interesting. These episodes are recommended for anyone who is about to live or travel in Germany,preferably in original language!

I'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things. However, SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of work. The story, acting, filming, psychological themes, erotic quality and spiritual understanding are all really quite complex and compelling. Rose plays the complexities and shifts of a psychologically disturbed woman really quite accurately. My partner was particularly impressed with the sophisticated way the power exchange issues were handled. It was so intense for us to watch that we found ourselves leaving it three quarters through to "get tea" and I felt compelled to have a shower.

There are many film now on DVD , but producers had forgotten some tittles of importance to many moviegoers . It is time for these movies to have a new lease of life in HD format. What an absolute waste of money! I can't believe people paid $19.95 to see this abomination. The acting, the dialogue, the editing, everything else was horrible. The script was so bad it was almost funny. I laughed about half the film. There was no plot at all, there just wasn't anything going on. And what's wrong with the woman?

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film 's main achievements . When you hear a vague outline of the story  it's not exactly bad. The idea of an astronaut going back in time to save his younger self , and then having to deal with various obstacles before being able to get back, is pretty great. Sadly, it turns out to be just another cliché-ridden "time-travel flick", where the characters have to repeatedly go through the motions for no other reason than to keep things moving (and if that doesn't sound like a cliche, well, nothing does!

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me. I loved Orry and George's relationship so much. I was so enraptured in Orry and Madenline's love story. I am a hopeless romantic so it really got to me. I especially liked it when he first met her. I just wish he had more time with her and their baby. So you know in Book three I was so hurt that he died. I didn't really understand that because they had little time together. I just loved Patrick in this movie.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking. I'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and challenged. Great acting, directing - and it is Canadian to boot! It is a film that families can enjoy and serious movie lovers. The locations in Ontario evoked such a sense of nostalgia for the era. With so much garbage and superficial hype selling these days it is great to see that someone could back an independent flick. For any family that has risen to overcome a challenge or an obstacle - be it financial or illness - this film strikes a resounding chord!

`5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters, stories of war, drag queens, kangaroos and koalas, and Australians in general being represented as nitwits living off the land, saying words like cobber' and generally being the classic underdog.Luckily Australian film has evolved over the last couple years and is churning out modern day classics' such as Blackrock, Moulin Rouge, Chopper, Yolngu Boy and Sample People.In this evolution of film we also find Two Hands.Set in Sydney's Kings Cross, Two Hands is a black comedy about crime and survival in the rough end of town.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest. In many ways, it's like a 50s version of VALLEY OF THE DOLLS--with much of the excesses and sleaziness of VALLEY polished up a bit for the audiences of 1959. Like this later film, both are about three young ladies who are on the fast-track to success--though this time it's in the publishing world instead of the entertainment industry (though one of the ladies in THE BEST OF EVERYTHING does have aspirations of Broadway).The film begins with Hope Lange coming into the company for her first day of work.

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee, it is evident in his movie. Forget the Black guy on White Girl action. It happens, but it isn't Samuel L. Jackson on Christina Ricci. More importantly this movie is about the values and culture of the people in this Tennessee town. How they deal with divorce, abandonment, sexual abuse and psychological disorders. While shrinks make millions in the cities of the North, Midwest and West Coast, the town minister, who also grapples with his own problems, becomes the counselor and mediator.

I just started watching The Show around July . I found it by mistake , I was channel surfing during a movie , the name of the program was "This is Life" and there was a lot more that I could see on it, I decided to check it out and I was pleasantly surprised..The show seemed very good, it had some funny moments , even though they are a little overdone in many ways, I still think they are funny. The story line is not what one would expect at all but it's not bad either.

The first thing I wanted to do after watching this film was watch it again ( because I 'd missed a lot) and see how long it could possibly go on. Well, it only took about 5 minutes for me to realize something was off. There were no characters that you would want to care about. The whole movie just seemed to have no heart or any redeeming quality to it. It was just sorta there and not much more. In fact, it seemed like there was very little point in making the movie unless you were really into the subject matter.

Obsessed!!!!! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love it so much is because of how smart the script is, its not your average comedy show there isn't any pause after a joke it just keeps on, if you missed you missed it. And its not like a soap opera drama either because it doesn't use dramatic music and the actors never have those stupid cheesy surprise looks. I think Gilmore Girls is one of the bests shows on T.V. shows of its time.

Very good "Precoder" starring Dick Barthelmess, which in a way, kind of reminded me of Hawks' "Only Angels Have Wings" (1939), in which Barthelmess also acted. This film was directed by masterful William Wellman, who was responsible for the landmark aviation Silent picture "Wings".Barthelmess plays a devil-may-care airplane pilot, who is a blamed for an aviation accident. Afterwards he meets and falls for pretty Sally Eilers, who participates as part of an Act in an itinerant Air Circus; but when Barthelmess' brother appears in scene, a triangular relationship ensues.

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford's best in my opinion. No major stars, but Ben Johnson shines in most everything he appears, and here he gets a rare lead as the title character. Matching him is Ward Bond as the crusty Mormon elder leading his people west. John Ford's stock of character actors, including Harry Carey, Jr., Jane Darwell, Russell Simpson and Hank Worden, provide ample support, as does eerily silent James Arness, a member of the outlaw Clegg clan that joins up with the wagon train.

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films! It was a very special experience for me as I have never seen the actor, Robert Loggia before and I'm quite sure that he hadn't either! He is simply incredible! This movie had so much potential to be amazing. And yet, every time i go watch it, i always feel disappointed. The reason why i give this movie a "meh" rating is because i don't think that the director/writers/producer/screenwriters did their homework on this film.

I first saw this on the big screen with my girlfriend. It was a fun romp with some cool music. Kristine was on the Playboy cover, and the centerfold, as I recall. She's really cute and perky and has lots of charm. The movie made me want to see more of her and so I kept a look out for her in other stuff. She's in Steven Spielberg's "I Wanna Hold Your Hand" and Barbara Streisand's "The Main Event" and Bill Murray's "Meatballs", plus lots of TV shows like Night Court and TV movies.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes and beliefs of the characters in the movie, and those of their parents, and their grandparents.The movie begins with the family getting ready to move back to New York City after a few years apart. This was an interesting experience that didn't offer any surprises. I couldn't get into the story and my interest was largely limited to how well-made the film was. There were so many things that could have been improved if the director hadn't cut out key scenes which made it difficult to follow the story line.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one . I really ca n't come up with one. The only thing that I did remember is that they were filming a western about a group of Native Americans living in the Arizona desert . This could be considered the worst movie ever made. It is very poorly written and the dialog is horrendous. There isn't a single funny moment. This movie was not even filmed in the United States. This is why it doesn't hold a candle to "The Deer Hunter" (1980).

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter 's complex life . Though it fails in some ways, this film is still worth watching if you ever find yourself with time to spare.The most interesting point of the story is how much we learn about Karen herself. She had a troubled past that saw her fall in with gangsters and spend time in prison (and was once again sent away as a child for stealing). We also learn that she married a man who was far from the saintly types depicted on screen and that he suffered from severe mental illness.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons , Elmer Fudd is out hunting , and Daffy tries to help him catch some fish with a fishing pole, but fails at it. "That's right, Mr. Fudd," Daffy yells, "I'll show you how to cast a rod like a man ." This is just awful... I was really looking forward to this movie since I've heard they're good at CGI and all that. However, I was disappointed! The story isn't terrible but it certainly isn't even close to being good.

I loved this movie! OH MY GOSH! This movie rocked so hard! I found it amongst some old tapes and didn't know what it was and after having read the back of the cover to see what the summer had to say about it (Which btw, mentioned the fact that Elton John covered the soundtrack for the film more times than it mentioned what the film was actually about. ), I thought it sounded interesting, and I was even more interested in seeing it because it was an older film. "What controversy?"

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off. For the first solo adventure of the Kettles a new writing team and director is introduced. Leonard Goldstein, associate producer of The Egg and I, was producer of The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle. With many of the characters played by the same actors and actresses the focus from the MacDonalds to the Kettles works very well. There is a reference to Ma beating Birdie Hicks for first prize at the fair for her quilt, an import scene in The Egg and I.

I'm not the type of person to watch T.V. shows because the acting normally sucks or it's unrealistic or TOO dramatic! But this show is perfect. Everyone can act, and you can relate to the characters and their situations. Everyone has their own personality and Lorelai Gilmore is the best for her sarcastic comments that can make any bad situation seem a little funny. Rory Gilmore is a good role model for all girls. She takes pride in wanting to attend Harvard and boys/boyfriends always come second in her book. She's a loyal friend and always the peace maker.

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction . This is what today 's documentaries are all about . It's very interesting that most of them are still trying to be politically correct. This documentary is, in my opinion, terrible. I can't even call it a film, as the first 20 minutes were just boring footage of some tourists walking around London. Then, for no real reason, they decided to go to Egypt, and spent the rest of the film getting bored because people didn't talk or laugh at them.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films , In The Company of Men & Your Friends (2003) and The Long Kiss Goodnight (2002) . He returns with this film, which seems like it has the potential to be very interesting. Sadly, however, the story falls flat after what feels like three or four minutes. I had read that this movie will be based on the true story of a real life mobster who lived in the late 70's/early 80's called Joseph "The Fixer" Gambino who was responsible for over $10 million in organized crime activity.

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story, where both Carpenters are in a recording studio, and Richard makes an impromptu decision to have Karen sing for the owner of the studio.Richard picks the wrong key for Karen to sing in, so Karen is singing above her natural range. You can see a look of bemusement on the owner's face; he figures she really can't sing. Richard quickly realizes his mistake and tries again in a different key. The next thing you hear is Karen's amazing, beautiful voice, and the owner does a priceless double take.

Unfortunately, I've never seen the full version of this movie. I did see the 87-minute version twice, back in the 1950s. Even more floridly directed than is the norm with Julien Duvivier, this is a wonderfully out-of-the-ordinary piece, replete with sweeping tracking shots through, over and into Andrejew's magnificently atmospheric sets. Beautifully lit too by photographer André Thomas, Black Jack is nothing if not a connoisseur's delight. Reinforcing this imaginative visual style, is a script that allows a roster of our favorite actors, including Agnes Moorehead and Marcel Dalio, some brilliantly bizarre, full-blooded characterizations.

this is a really great series . i love the show and i am so glad it is n't canceled. i was going to see this movie with my mom and her friends tonight, but we had to cancel at 10. i have seen all three seasons and still watch them every week. i just finished watching the last episode and it made me cry. In the year 2027, society is split into two main factions: those who believe that robots are humanity's savior - known as 'Neo-Con' people; and those who view human beings as expendable - known as 'Truthers', 'conspiracy theorists'.

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch. She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role of Harry (Mike Wagner) girl friend. Harry a robber down on his luck trying to make one more heist. Harry goes to a funeral where he meets Vittorio De Sica and takes him for a ride. When things don't work out on the ride they put there mines together to figure out the fastest way to get money. Harry and his gang decide with the help of Vittorio De Sica to from there on mob.

Surprising , witty , funny and totally engaging , the film grabs a little-known reality : that of the student revolt of 1968, and what it has to say about the world we are living in today. I would have watched this movie again had I been able to find it on video or some other way. But as it was just an hour long film I can't imagine how anyone could have spent so much time looking at it. There wasn't even a decent script (it seemed like the director wrote the whole thing).The actors were very underwhelming.

Robert Altman , Nicolas Roeg , John-Luc Goddard -- you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy. This is what you get. The problem isn't that these three films aren't bad, but that they are all terrible. And I'm sorry, but if your only criterion for "good" is that it has more than 3 stars on IMDb, then this movie qualifies. It's like trying to have a meal without salt or pepper. It doesn't last long. As a horror fan, I will admit that there are a few films in my collection that I think are good.

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm , wit , and charm . At age 16 Lorelai Gilmore became one of the most popular TV characters of all time for her sharp sense of humor and deep love for her family. When she was only 19 years old she made her first appearance in the original run of Stars Hollow . It wasn't enough for the writers to bring Lorelai back because they wanted her to have grown up even more . The series went on for two more seasons but it didn't take long for people to realize that it was just too much .

Come on . Anyone who does n't understand the greatness of this here cartoon should be kicked off any critic site they're on right away. It's really that good. First, it was hard to get my jaw off of the screen when I first watched this movie because I could not quite put my finger on what the problem was at first. This movie is a mess and I had trouble making sense out of what was happening. The dialog was ridiculous, and the story line just did not make sense.

I love this film ( dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish , cheesy name), i would have liked it if some of the cast had stayed on to do another movie, but the script and direction were so bad that they all came off badly. One of the best things I can say about this film was how well shot it was. It was like watching a television show and not a film.There were many times when I forgot I was watching a film.The acting was also very poor.

Sure, it has its pretentious moments, it plays like art-house, live-action Fantasia, but it also has moments of deep beauty and humor. Omnibus films are always a problem, but I have always had a keen interest in them. I will now rate the segments individually.Nicolas Roeg - "Un ballo in maschera" - This segment may very well spoil the film for some people, because it is absolutely the worst of the whole bunch. It is difficult to follow, mostly because it tries to adhere to a clear plot (a hackneyed one, at that).

Pat Conroy 's autobiographical book `` The Water Is Wide '' proves to be something of a Southern `` Up, Down and All Around the World `'' story--and not in a good way. The only reason I gave this movie three stars is that I didn't see it all the way through. I wanted to, and could've, because I enjoyed the director's commentary throughout. But the film itself was so bad that I just couldn't take it seriously. There was no suspense, no sense of wonder, nothing at all.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone .The main reason why I'm glad that I made the mistake of purchasing this DVD (it cost me $1.00), was just so that I could watch an entire movie without thinking about what was actually going on. This, however, didn't happen. Forget all the bad reviews, there is good things to say about this show, and I don't mean for the acting, the writing, the direction or anything else.

Brilliant film! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats how it is with post pulp era. Many pictures get automatically likened to it for only being a gangster flick. But this one is well written, funny coincidences, ordinary gangsters who are family men, resemble something from Tarantino, which is a good similarity!Anyway the film's about a guy bloke in Australia which is getting mixed up with a hard- core crime gang, and ends up in a debt and deep s*it.

As Betty Sizemore ( Renee Zellweger ) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del ( Aaron Eckhart ) being murdered by the FBI, she becomes obsessed with discovering who is responsible. It seems to be a movie that takes a lot from the original "Batman" movies, but there is very little to this one and it doesn't add anything of value to the series. This movie isn't nearly as bad as the original "Batman" movie, which had some good action scenes and characters. This movie is a pretty good example of why they changed the comic book to the movie.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film . It is an excellent entry point into the history of the early Cosa Nostra and the creation of the modern mafia. I wish it was still made today . The characters were more interesting than the lead, Frank Sinatra
The most recent attempt to "revitalise" Borscht Belt crime movies, this one comes off like a poorly-produced TV miniseries. It starts well enough, with a gangster (Lance Henriksen) picking up some extra cash while he takes his family on a shopping trip.

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim , California in the summer of 1985. It was just like any other horror movie I've seen in the past few years, but there was something different about it that scared me more than usual. The film is based on an original book by R.L. Stine called Goosebumps . It tells the story of six teenage friends who all have supernatural powers which they use to frighten and intimidate their schoolmates. As the story progresses, things start to get really weird and some of the events feel very out of left field.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert, and its influence on them is obvious: in the dialogue, locations, photography, direction and political philosophy. The photography is notably confident. The direction is stylish and for the most part well done. If you liked the early Australian films by Bruce Beresford, Peter Weir and George Miller then you'll love "Oz". The direction also reminds this reviewer of Edgar Wright's contemporary work. That similarity suggests that "Oz" was far ahead of its time.

The show is GREAT. No words to describe it. Wonderful music. Incredible dance. The editors couldn't spoil it, not because they were not *that*bad*, but because the show is really *that*good*.The editors are compulsive cutters, you can't see a scene without a cut for more than 15 secs. It's OK to show various angles, but those guys were working with multiple cameras for the first time in their lives, and they will remind you of how many cameras they have every five seconds on average...

The philosophical , meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind . I 'd give it 10 stars if that were even possible. There's something for everybody to enjoy, whether you want to be depressed or just happy. My wife & I rented this movie on Christmas Eve after seeing it in a local theater. In hindsight, we would have liked to have seen the original. This version (with an all-female cast) tries to recreate the spirit of the original film without the charm of the original. The storyline is similar to the first but not quite as funny.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents, the filmmaker's mother dies, but he continues making the documentary, discovering a story he did not anticipate. The result is an absorbing drama that has the quality of fiction in the best sense of that word, where a likable but unknowing narrator unwittingly privileges the audience. The narrative thus has a double weave, the story of the documentary and the story of the documentary-maker.Our admiration is with the filmmaker, not only for doggedly pursuing his story though it risks his entire notion of his parents' relationship, but also for never giving in to sensationalism or melodrama.

I was expecting this movie to suck , but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film . Most people probably don't want to see gore films , but there is nothing wrong with it, they are not bad movies ! This movie is an absolute mess. The acting in this movie is terrible and the script is awful. The story is so nonsensical that you can't even understand what is going on. Even though I have never seen any horror movie before, when I saw the trailer of this movie I thought "Oh boy, let me try this one"!

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars ! I really do n't care what people can say badly about it. If the director had chosen to be a little more original and interesting, i would not have turned my nose up at this film. This is nothing more than a re-telling of classic fairy tale story. A friend sent me this movie after I complained on Facebook about how cheesy it was, and so I rented it, thinking it'd be a good way to start off my evening. The movie opens in a graveyard with a vampire attacking a young girl.

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and, as mysteries should, keeps you guessing until the end and has several suspects to choose from.Many films from the Golden Age are not for all tastes, especially younger viewers. They date themselves by clothing, cars, settings, etc. Who nowadays asks for a highball? Or wears a suit and tie everywhere? And the legal process was so much simpler - must have been a dearth of lawyers back then. Frankly, much of value is missing from those days.In any case, go with it and enjoy.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes . I just had to get back into it. I'm surprised how many people don't know how badly this series is written. This show started off ok, but that didn't last too long. From what I've been able to tell, the writers tried to make it feel more like an 80's show, but couldn't figure out how to do it right. To me, it seemed as if the writers didn't want to be original at all.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny (and fun) puns. The first shot we see in here is an island prison with the following written above its big gates: "Alka-Fizz Prison - No Noose Is Good Noose." Inside the prison, the first sign we see is "Welcome: have a seat." They then show an electric chair.Corny gives way to clever, however, as our favorite wolf is seen behind bars. With pen in hand, he literally draws a door next to him and then escapes through it!

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim ( Richard Barthelmess ) who has one bad flight in his career and gets grounded for the rest of the year. He spends the whole year trying to figure out the problem and what's causing it. I think this movie was intended to make a point about the effects of modernism on art and culture. However, it falls flat on most counts. There are several flaws which can be noticed right off the bat: 1) The production values seem amateurish and cheap. 2) The special effects look almost like they were made up on the fly.

THE CELL ( 2000 ) Rating : 8/10The Cell , like Antz , must be watched twice to be appreciated. First off, it's not much more than a cheap soap opera. I'll admit that the first 20 or so minutes were kind of enjoyable. However, there are no redeeming qualities except for an interesting storyline. I'm a big sci-fi fan, and I really want to like this film. It has all the great elements of classic science fiction, and is definitely well made. Unfortunately, I was disappointed with it.

Surprising, witty, funny and totally engaging, the film grabs a little-known reality: that of the student that goes studying in an Erasmus program. The beginning is great, as the story kicks off, of course it has a few lulls on the midsection, and the story drifts sometimes away from the main character, but the viewer won't bother - the movie is young, fresh, and light-hearted, even though I don't agree with the notion that when you do Erasmus and you come back you no longer make part of that universe. But that's just me.

Okay , where to begin . Did you know that the part of the lead robots were offered to famous actors like John Wayne, Frank Morgan, and even George Peppard? But no matter how high their value on the market they still turned it down. That is just one of many sad stories in the film.The plot is a simple one; a team of roboticists have created new kind of human-robot co-operation that can move freely and independently without any need to have a master. They try to find out if this technology can help people with neurological disorders.

I 'm seen this documentary in its feature-form , in a movie theatre . And ... wouah ! The pictures are pretty poor, and the voices are terrible! But it's fun to watch someone making a movie that has nothing going for it at all. The title was misleading because it made no mention of an actual film. This is more of a collection of photographs rather than a documentary. You will not find any factual information nor interviews with the people who were actually involved (although I suppose there could be some entertaining footage if you really look hard).

I've seen 'nurse betty' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea' in vlissingen, the netherlands. It impressed me so much that I kept on smiling the whole day after I watched it for the first time and almost all evening again when I took the movie as the final taste of the festival. What I knew about 'nurse betty' was in short that renée zellweger would play a girl in love with a soap-opera-star. But what I saw was much more than that! Splendid roles for morgan freeman, chris rock ànd renée zellweger.

Wagon Master (1950) Dir: John Ford Production: Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings the stock company out into the Utah desert to film a western and comes out with this minor classic. No John Wayne, no conflicted anti-heroes, no psychological exploration, no fireworks, just a gem of a picture.This ensemble piece nominally stars Ben Johnson (as Travis) and Harry Carey Jr. (Sandy). They're horse traders who come into town to do some business just as a group of Mormons, led by Ward Bond, are being shown the exit.

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of `` Rawhide '' Charles Marquis Warren . I have watched the film several times now, and while I haven't had the pleasure of watching it on DVD yet, I'm pretty sure I've read all of the book's 400 pages at some point, so I felt pretty qualified to write about the film. I don't usually comment on Hollywood movies, but I had to write my opinion on this movie simply because I think it was a total failure. It was poorly acted.

After searching for 6 months, I finally found this DVD. All I can say is it was damn well worth the wait! "Rush in Rio" may very well be the greatest rock DVD in existence. I'm not joking. It's incredible! All the fuss about the sound being crappy is true, however it doesn't make the concert unwatchable. I find it makes you feel like you're actually in Rio watching the concert from the audience. That's one of the reasons I love this DVD. It makes you feel like you're actually there.

For my money, probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford ever made. The dialog is swift, clipped, to the point.l The story starts at the very beginning and only ends with the final credits. Ford uses a relatively small cast, but directs them and photographs them with a verve and a sweep of epic proportions. Grimly realistic, warmly amusing, brilliantly acted (hard to believe Johnsonj couldn't become a leading man after this), with the best photography and editing in any American black-and-white film.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites . The unsung hero of his generation . Nobody in Hollywood can match him. I'm sure the studio executives laughed at the first screenplay he wrote , and turned it down. Well, they would have a hard time turning down this movie either . It's a true piece of art . I think the only thing that could have made this movie any worse is if it had been directed by another screenwriter. This is an unoriginal movie with a very lame plot - just like the classic movies it is based on.

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years, Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of cinema perhaps more so than any other commercial filmmaker. I've been acquainted with Herzog for a few decades now and I've never not been impressed by both the man and his work. Last year I went to see Rescue Dawn and was somewhat surprised at how relatively mainstream the film was, yet couldn't help but imagine Herzog taking his actors and crew into the actual jungle to not only make the film, but to live it.

The most beautiful film. If one is looking for serious depth, meaning and excellent performance then you have to get to watch this movie. excellent performances by the whole cast. Even more beautiful than A Beautiful Mind itself. Simply awesome!! I wish this movie entered the Oscars. I cried through the whole movie for the schizophrenic character. ..The most beautiful film. If one is looking for serious depth, meaning and excellent performance then you have to get to watch this movie. excellent performances by the whole cast. Even more beautiful than A Beautiful Mind itself.

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good : The camera work was absolutely phenomenal . It's like a silent movie . This film looks like one that could be good, but the script just doesn't work.I've seen worse. If the story was good, I would see it more than twice. But the characters are bland and not really developed. What is up with these people? I get the feeling that they came on set for the acting part and didn't know about the script or what to expect.

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer (exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle) being driven by a man hoping to sell him a story for an upcoming play. However, there is a bad storm and their car becomes stuck in the mud and so they are forced to look for some place to spend the night. Fortunately, there's a mansion nearby though it seems pretty odd that the people inside know the writer and he says he didn't realize this was the home of a man he knew (and despised).

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and , as mysteries should , leaves you asking questions. You won't find too many of them here, but that's not so bad. My rating for this movie has to be 1/10.I'll give it a score of 2/10 if I hadn't already seen it.The story takes place at a university in the early 60s. Two students are involved in an altercation, which results in one of them stabbing the other guy. This leads the cops to arrest both of their suspects.

Jimmy ( Heath Ledger ) is given a simple job by Pando ( Bryan Brown ) a underworld kingpin to get revenge on the gang that took out his son. Once he's at work he has no control over the people under his jurisdiction and it all goes horribly wrong. The first thing you have to remember about this film is that its actually two films stitched together from the same script. There is a scene early on in the film where several of the guys are running around shooting each other, but they stop because they realize that one of them is getting close to dying.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with "Valley of the Kings." These movies helped inspire a lifelong interest in Egyptology. (In 1975 I visited Egypt!) Seen today, "The Egyptian" suffers from flat dialog and a few gauche touches, but it's a glorious movie to look at -- the sort of thing Hollywood, alas, just doesn't do anymore -- and it has a great story... not just the usual boy-meets-girl or vengeance-is-mine affair. Too bad 20th won't re-issue restored prints of this to be seen on the Big Screen.

I just saw this wonderfully filmed movie that captures the essence ofhigh-brow NYC, or any big city of mid-century America. The colors, thecars, the clothes and the coming of the Womens Movement. It reflects thecomf-cozy attitudes of relationships between men and women in thecorporate world. In some ways, things gave changed and in others, theyhaven't changed at all. Women still want what men have today, but theynow have all sorts of laws and equality mandates to get it for them. Inmy opinion, beautiful women will still THROW themselves at men inpursuit of thier goals!

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . "I've seen the light!" This movie is not worth watching at any hour, but certainly at least from 10am on. The plot is very weak, the actors are horrible, and some of the dialogue is so bad that I had to watch it again to find out what it was saying. The director and cinematographer obviously have no idea how movies are made or how to do them right.This movie has something to do about a young boy who dies when he's hit by a train.

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter's complex life. Though it fails in giving accurate facts, and details.Cynthia Gibb (portrays Karen) was not a fine election. She is a good actress , but plays a very naive and sort of dumb Karen Carpenter. I think that the role needed a stronger character. Someone with a stronger personality.Louise Fletcher role as Agnes Carpenter is terrific, she does a great job as Karen's mother.It has great songs, which could have been included in a soundtrack album.

` Skenbart ' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the director, Michael Moore. I have to admit that it was funny when I watched it back then but after all those times I would say that it isn't funny anymore. This film is filled with pointless humor where nothing has any purpose whatsoever. It's just too stupid and lame to be funny. I saw this movie twice. First time at the Cinergi in Bologna and second time in the cinemaplex in Venice. What an absolute waste of time!

I 'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5 , but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5 that I got out of it, and boy, was that a mistake. This is a poor attempt at creating suspense, which is only made worse by some terrible special effects. The film actually has a number of moments that are truly shocking, especially during the first half. There are no other films in the last few years that I've seen that have so blatantly had the characters commit acts of extreme violence against each other without giving any hint as to their motives.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes. I saw it listed on the schedule at the Stanford Theatre in Palo Alto, and I vowed I would make the 40 minute drive. The Stanford is an old fashioned movie house that starts each movie with the curtains still shut Yes, they have curtains. They opened as the Fox logo fanfare began to play. When "The Best of Everything" appeared in huge pink letters spread against the New York City skyline, I knew I was right for waiting.I lapped this movie up.

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms, I thought I would get them all done now. Dads Army, is my all time favourite sitcom, It ain't half hot Mum is also a classic as is You Rang M'Lord. I don't regard Hi De Hi as a classic, but it is still funny.It's about a holiday camp, similar to Butlins, but instead of red coats, it's yellow coats. It is ran by Jeffery Fairbrother, a well meaning man, but has the personality of a sock.

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we 're in a bigger hole than ever . That 's not even mentioning all the trillions lost to waste and corruption of what is supposed to be America 's last 'great nation '. I think that this film was meant to be a satire on the Bush administration's approach to warfare. Unfortunately, there is so little truth in the movie that the satire fails. I would much rather see an independent filmmaker make a film like this and call it a "satirical" treatment of the War On Terror.

This was an excellent show. It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (From EnVogue) played the teen aged daughter. The show dealt with subjects such as sex, peer pressure and puberty. IT was about a middle class black family who had a teen aged daughter and son who moved to a middle class neighborhood from Oakland or somewhere (I can't remember). I remember several episodes but the one I remember most was when their cousin got her period for the first time. I was probably 7-8 when I first watched it and I was able to keep up with the program.

The Tempest has been interpreted in many different ways ranging from more or less traditional views as dealing with Art to more post-modern approaches that like to dissect the play along post-colonial, feminist, gender or deconstructionist lines. The reason why Jarman's version left me fairly cold is that I didn't have a clue what he was on about. What is the underlying vision/idea/concept behind this rendering of Shakespeare? The previous reviewers do not get much further than revenge tragedy, punk show, but surely there is more to it, isn't there?

The Killing Yard is a great film , although uneven at times . Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort and it shows. The actors are good for the most part but some scenes are hard to watch. I've never seen anything like it and I'm quite disappointed. This was one of the dumbest movies I ever saw. Its so bad that when I got it home, I just had to burn it.I mean really, how many people were actually going to go out of their way to spend $50 on a movie? You could get an 8 oz bottle of beer for 10 bucks!

When I was engaged , my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores . He would look for his favorite books to read on his vacation. He always wanted to see what had been done better in the other books that were available. One time I brought home a very well-made picture book with a sexy lady on the cover. I didn't know anything about sex at the time, but it made me uncomfortable. This was an awful movie. The acting was horrendous. The plot was so lame and contrived that one could not help wondering if the creators had ever actually read the book.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if they click with each other. Matt is pretty unlikeable: aloof, braggart, seemingly lazy, and a misogynist. He's been hurt badly by his dysfunctional mom and this makes him a little easier to take. I guess I liked the details of his dysfunction--he was believable. He overcompensates by bragging that he'l nail Amy. He acts so cool around Amy that he strikes out twice. When they do talk he can't show her who he really is.

This is a really great film ! It gets you thinking about your parents . How we all have fragile egos , some are stronger than others , some more sensitive than others or just the way they are . It's sad that a film such as this would see the light of day, especially after the excellent work of Steven Soderbergh (Taken), but I can hardly complain since I found it very entertaining.I don't think the film has a story at all, and I couldn't care less if it was or not.

Okay I marked this spoiler so do n't be upset when I wrap this up . Now I went into this show expecting to laugh at all the jokes but was actually quite saddened by my reaction. When I first saw this show in the episode guide it says that it is a parody of some of the most popular and successful shows on television, like the "Law & Order" franchise. How could you not be disappointed? There are only two or three things that really make this show worth watching. First, the costumes for the cops.

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction. This is what today's documentaries are all about. It's refreshing to watch something so personal, honest and real. Mr. Block's thoughts, opinions and disclosure are rarely seen these days and are incredibly well displayed here. It's a fine line to walk between personal truth and exploitation. This film treads very carefully and quite successfully.One would think that learning about how a seemingly normal couple falls short of society's expectations would give birth to pessimism...but it doesn't. Quite the opposite: it made me feel good.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time , it definitely is in the top five . I'm not sure there are any movies as boring as this one . Just don't get your hopes up about a happy ending . This film is like that little kid in elementary school who has his own special way of doing things . And he keeps on trying and trying to be better at it ! Let me tell you what I do not want to say: I did not like this movie. It was bad. Bad, bad, bad.

I finally received my DVD today, viewed it and I'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical version of the film. As you may have read in previous reviews of "Rich and Famous" that the edited for TV version of the film that somehow made it onto VHS sometime in the late 90's but, now WB has corrected the error and released it on DVD complete with the airplane restroom scene, Matt Lattanzi's bare butt, and the scene in the Hotel room where Liz (Jacqueline Bisset) calls Merry (Candice Bergen) a C**t!

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that . I got all the tapes , so when I went to go buy some I thought it would be a great way for me to watch them all again. Well they are terrible. In fact I'm still not sure if I saw a single laugh out loud. After having been with my Dad for about 25 years, I've finally had enough of him. He doesn't get along with anyone anymore. He's always calling everyone names on the phone. It's just annoying.

I had always heard about this great mini-series, but viewed it for the first time this week, July of 2007. I can see why it started the careers of so many young actors. The story is intriguing and gives wonderful insights into the period before and during the Civil War. I cared about the characters and how their lives evolved during this period. Some of them were stereotypes, but they still helped me see how people thought during the 1800's. Many historical facts were thrown into the story and it was interesting to see history books come to life.

I haven't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way; that I couldn't take my eyes off the screen. I was busting for the loo; and I didn't even want to pause it because I was drawn right in. Emotive; powerful; very moving; horrific and heart-breaking. It gives you an amazing insight to South Africa; their struggles and their lives. The acting by the leads were mind-blowing and the script was incredible. Despite the terrible events that unfold in this film and how horrific the story is; I was captivated.
