when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the year. It has a story line that's really not anything like the book and there are parts of it that are downright creepy. I have never read "Fahrenheit 451" and don't know why anyone would try to write an adaptation of it as a movie. If you haven't seen the book, then what the hell are you watching? Why did you buy a copy of the novel for $9.98? Did you think someone else was going to make a movie out of it?

I can't help but notice the negative reviews this movie has gotten. To be honest, I saw the preview for this movie, and the premise looked intrigued me. Yes, I rented it after reading others' comments. They are correct in that some of the acting leaves a lot to be desired. They are also correct that one of the best performances of this movie was that of Dr. Graves.Also interesting is Scott Clark, who plays Grant, the kid in the wheelchair. I identify with the character he played, perhaps because I am in a wheelchair.This movie is certainly worth your looking at.

I finally received my DVD today , viewed it and I 'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical version from 1978, with many additional scenes added. I have been looking for this film for over 30 years and so glad I finally got it. If anyone else out there knows where you can find it , please let me know. This movie is just a bunch of guys getting wasted on a ship in the middle of ocean. A very interesting idea that has been done only once before, but its not done right here.

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts, unlike many other great Ford films, like The Searchers, My Darling Clementine, The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, and The Grapes of Wrath among others, but it is likely to produce a feeling of awe and deep satisfaction. The story is very simple: two cowboys decide to help a wagon train of Mormons get to California. Along the way, they run into a medicine man whose mules ran away, a group of bank robbers, and some Navajos.

"The Honkers" is probably Slim Pickens best performance of all time. When we were shooting, everyone connected with the production figured that Slim was Academy Award material. Unfortunately, United Artists had a James Bond picture in release at the same time and did not devote much attention to "The Honkers". I personally feel this film was under-rated by most critics. Sam Peckinpaw's "Junior Bonner" was out at the same time and seemed to impress the critics more than our film. Also, Cliff Robertson had a rodeo film out a few months before our release and that might have hurt us, too.

Well , okay , maybe not perfect , but it was pretty close . This movie jumped from crime drama to a high school teen movie, and then back again in the last 30 minutes or so . I'm sure there is more to the story but I don't know what it is. When I watched this film, I wasn't that impressed. It didn't make my top 5 favorite horror films of all time list because it didn't get me to actually put on some gloves and run around the house throwing knives at people.

What can you possibly say ? This is the uncut hardcore , musical Alice ! It works too with a few minor changes here and there. If it had only been done by an adult , it might have been even better. "Alice" isn't just a terrible movie -- it's one of the worst films ever made, period. I've never been able to look at a single frame of this film with anything other than disgust. From the first moment I heard its title, I cringed. The acting was weak, the music was awful, and the plot was unfathomable.

I Love this movie! I know some people might say that it was not a great movie, but I really disagree. The comedy is classic Mel Brooks style and the actors were superbly chosen. This was my first exposure to Cary Elwes, and Dave Chappelle and what a first impression they made. Cary Elwes shines as Robin Hood, the only British Robin Hood mind you. He has great comedic timing and the right attitude for this type of film. Dave Chappelle is obviously much bigger now, but at the time this was his first movie and he did an outstanding job as Achoo.

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film . The backwoods slasher pretty much started in 1984 with the creation of Jason Voorhees, a character who was based on a real man who had been missing for more than a month. He was finally located by his friends but not before their bodies had been hacked to bits. I found this movie quite interesting. It's basically just a remake of "Jaws". I think that it has a great cast (Sarandon, DeNiro...), but unfortunately the special effects are quite poor.

I watched this film in a Singapore theatre yesterday (4 February, 2006)and came away with a better understanding of what schizophrenia patients and their loved ones go through.Ms Aparna Sen must be congratulated for not only taking on a difficult subject, but also treating the mentally challenged with a deep understanding of their predicament that is necessary to help them cope with the trauma of disorientation, hallucinations and the storm of turmoil raging in their minds.We have had Hollywood movies on this subject such as "One flew over the cuckoo's nest" where Jack Nicholson carried away the honours.

This is the best movie I have ever seen . It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate. My mom wanted to take me to see this when I was in high school but they took it out of our library. I finally saw it today and i can honestly say that i have never been so shocked in my entire life . I was just laughing while watching it because it looked like such a cheesy 80's horror flick. I knew there would be some action, gore, blood and lots of sex.

With all the dreck out there , this is a gentle movie about young love . Yes , it 's melodramatic (not exactly my thing), but not as bad as you would think it was. In fact, I found myself very moved by it , and quite happy to see two good looking men in their 20s having an affair that they can't seem to get out of. It's hard to judge a movie by its trailer , especially one that hasn't even aired yet. This film is nothing more than a piece of trash which tries to entertain with little regard for the art of cinema.

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that. I got all the tapes, DVD's and audiobooks and every time i watch/listen to them its brand new. The film. The film is a re run of certain episodes, Man and the hour, Enemy within the gates, Battle School and numerous others with a different edge. Introduction of a new General instead of Captain Square was a brilliant move - especially when he wouldn't cash the cheque (something that is rarely done now).It follows through the early years of getting equipment and uniforms, starting up and training.

I want to start my review by thanking the makers of this documentary, it is obviously a labor of love and I think they did a pretty good job of putting together an enjoyable documentary about a person who has had so such little info available about him. It definitely has a fan worship feel about it, which is a good thing.I had heard of Bruce Haack but didn't know much about him, and I found the start of this documentary frustrating because I could hear other musicians talk about him, but Bruce Haack himself was kept way too far off in the distance.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe . Notice how some of the Roman sets are actually modeled after those in Gladiator? In a world where there are two types of cinema: The first one is "Cinema Paradiso," i.e. a movie for the general public (i.e. an easy-to-understand, unstructured movie to be enjoyed by everybody), the other one is "Cinema Noir." In this rare case, Cinema Noir means "horror" film, but we're not talking about horror here, we're talking about gory, visceral, graphic violence.

`Skenbart' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the Swedish cinema industry itself. It is a movie made in black and white to get something of the atmosphere from the days before Christmas in December 1945, which it does very well. Almost the whole plot takes place on a train, non-stop to Berlin. On the train is a mix of homosexuals, nuns, deported refugees, murderers, alcoholics and the failure literature critic 'Gunnar' played by the, in Sweden, famous actor Gustav Hammarsten.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time, it definitely is in the top five. I love this. Everything about this is perfect--the clothes, the set, the lines--yes, they're not how normal people talk, but... Right down to the small scenes, especially at the beginning of the office girls changing their shoes, picking a wedgie, watering the office ivy plant, putting lunch in the fridge... Identical to what us office girls do today in the year 2005. I think all the minor characters are wonderful.

I wanted to watch this, to get a inside look at the show. It told the story more of Robin Williams, then Mork & Mindy. Still, thought it was great. We got to see, Robin always being 'on', no matter what. The performance of Diamontopolous was awesome.The introductions of the main players, seem so real to me. Roebuck as Garry Marshall was wonderful. He was so charming in this, which helped me get through all the Williams energy. The little behind the scenes pieces of his other shows (Happy Days, and Laverne & Shirley), was enlightening.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times , this is a hilarious and gleefully campy film, set on a space ship. As usual, the cast are excellent, with Roger Moore, Robert Carlyle and William Forsythe (who don't even appear in the movie, only in small supporting roles). This was my second time watching "The Andromeda Strain," so I knew I should know what to expect. First off, I will say that it is very hard to get an original script out of Steven Erikson because he really likes to recycle his story ideas.

In dramatising Wilde 's novel , John Osborne has condensed events , eliminated a number of characters , and generally made the story seem longer than it is. This is not to say that I agree with all of Osborne's points. In fact, I think there is more than a bit of inaccuracy in his portrayal of the book. That being said, this one film adaptation is better than what was originally put together . I really didn't like this movie at all. The director did an absolutely abysmal job. I have never seen a better excuse to hire a professional make up artist.

A classic late 50's film. The superannuated headliners (Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan) are not at their best, but the direction, cinematography, and acting of the younger cast are compelling. In a 50's sense (which I love).The look and feel of the artsy (over-artsy?) contemporary film "Far from heaven" reflects exactly this sort of film (and I suspect this film may be one of the models). A silly plot, of course (hey, it's 1959! ), but as a film-- glorious!

The movie is good and I think Tiffany Amber is very beautiful . I liked the movie . Can anyone tell me where she is ? Well this is a horror film, but why would you watch it in the first place? It's so bad that I am afraid to write anything on it, even though it is supposed to be scary. The story is about a couple who stay in the house for the weekend after getting evicted, they hear strange noises and come across several dead bodies. A man is also missing, and when they go out to look he seems to disappear.

Susie Q. is one of those rare, and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling. It's bittersweet, but wholesome, and it's characters are fun, and captivating. At first, I thought the movie would be the cliché cuddly movie that would bore me after five minutes, but was I wrong. It made me tear up at times, and it's plot was enticing, making me root for the good guys. I loved the movie, and still remember it today, 9 years later!!

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / didn't understand this wonderful film. What a sad life he must lead!This movie has more to say about life and relationships than most I've ever seen, yet it's not dark or preachy like the "ordinary people" type of film. It is mostly humorous, though not technically a comedy.The whole thing feels a little like a fantasy, perhaps Shakespear's "Midsummer Nights' Dream." Beautiful, intelligent women abound, with wonderful cinematography and a non-insulting screenplay that doesn't miss a beat.I look forward to seeing it every time this film is re-run on cable.

It happens often , while growing up , a Hollywood movie impresses a youth . It not only lasts a few years , but it becomes part of our cultural consciousness. I guess that this is the same thing happening to us today with movies like Independence Day. We see these movies and we know that in 10, 15, 20 years we can't believe how bad they are. In fact, when I watched "Independence Day", I was amazed at how wrong the movie was. To say something like that about a Hollywood movie would be blasphemy !

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

Surprisingly good made for T.V . Thriller . I was n't expecting too much from this one but I 'm glad I waited til now ! If the plot was a little more original than it was, if the acting was better, and if there wasn't a bunch of pointless "humor" scenes, this could have been a decent movie. However, even with all of that, the story just isn't interesting. The main character is never quite sure if he is going crazy or being manipulated by the evil doctors in the hospital.

When this show first came on the air, I saw it once or twice and thought it was another "fat guy, skinny wife" show that seemed to populate the networks at the time. It was just "okay" upon initial viewings and I didn't watch it again; however, once it went into syndication, I caught several episodes (simply because it was on twice a night), and I'm telling you, the more you watch this show, the funnier it is. Once you see how all of the great supporting characters are connected, this show makes you laugh out loud.

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years. Great production design, appealing stars, great lines ("Miss Bender, I don't care if you beat it out on a native drum! ", says Joan Crawford's Amanda Farrow to Hope Lange when Lange incredulously asks how she is expected to read a summarize a large amount of manuscripts in a very short time). If you've seen this movie panned and scanned on TV and not in the letterboxed version on pay-TV or AMC (American Movie Classics) you haven't really seen it.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I am so glad I bought this one!I'm not a fan of science fiction films but I found it very cool that they were based on books. Meredith Chase was born on October 7, 1940 in Minneapolis, Minnesota. She graduated high school at age 15, and moved to California where she became a member of the Delta Tau Chi fraternity. After graduation, she joined the United States Army as an air force pilot (1953-1957) before pursuing a career in acting.

People need to give this show a chance. The people who write bad reviews (there are very few of them) are clearly people who haven't seen many episodes. One needs to really sit down and pay attention to this show to appreciate it. All of the characters are realistic because they have so many flaws. They make mistakes, but they are REALISTIC mistakes, which is an uncommon thing to see on television today. Also, for the most part the acting is superb. Lauren Graham has been snubbed of an Emmy for six years now.

-it has Carla Gugino * yay * and a crappy ending * boo * - '' Jaded '' is a bad movie. It's supposed to be a comedy but I don't see how someone can make a film with such a dull plot and not have at least a little fun.I'm sure they didn't intend for it to be anything more than a stupid joke but there was just so much wrong about it. There was a scene in it where Bruce Willis' character sneaks into the girl's dorm room and tells her he finds her attractive.

I'll be brief: I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that just draws me in and won't let me go. Granted, there are some major flaws in it (some of the acting is below par at best and the dialogue is sometimes so poor it's funny) but there are enough redeeming features to make it watchable to the end.But what are they? Well, it's got a cool little plot - by no means is it original, but it is better presented than other films of its kind.

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch up. I guess I will have to rent it again because I'm sure I'll find the laughs are just not as great when they are replayed a second time, but it can't be that bad. The movie started off very fast and did not have a lot of twists and turns that kept me on my toes. It was all too quick and you could tell from the start that something bad might happen. Unfortunately, it did.

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years. As a boy, I enjoyed stories of mountain men and the wilderness. Books like "Call of the Wild", "White Fang", "The Frontiersman" and "My Side Of the Mountain", influenced me tremendously. I wanted so much to live like a mountain man, but nothing inspired me more to do so, than when I saw this movie on television in 1975. I wanted to be just like "Trapper".

Robin Hood ; Men in Tights is worth watching , I recently watched it because I 've just become a big fan of Robert Carlyle's work.The film follows a man who steals money from the poor by tricking them into giving up their valuables. He then kills them and sells their possessions to make a living. There are very few lines of dialogue in the whole film, but they serve to build the suspense.This is one of those rare films where the script is more important than the performances. I don't know what it was that kept me from finishing this movie.

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it. What a movie. I am in my 40s now and have 2 teenage kids and I would like them to see this movie. I would recommend it to anyone who loves a romance movie or older Elton John music.I have searched most of the stores that sell both new and old movies but have not come across any.I bought some old movies like " Melody" in Hong Kong, who had quite a collection of old movie, but they did not have this.

With Nurse Betty (2000), acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute (In the Company of Men, Your Friends & Neighbors) makes his breakthrough into the big-budgeted (Betty's $24 million as opposed to Company's measly $25,000), mainstream realm -- and yet remains true to his roots. While his cast is now composed of A-list Hollywood names (Renee Zellweger, Morgan Freeman, and stand-up comedian Chris Rock), his material remains just as bizarre and quirky as his first two features, proving that he just may be the next big thing.

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys , but providing a brilliant example of why no one should ever pay to watch this movie. It is simply an insult to our intelligence that people are so gullible and/or brainwashed, that they are willing to pay $5 to see a film such as this. If you still believe this is a "drama" then please watch this video clip (warning NSFW):
I can't even begin to put into words how poorly this film portrays the lives of both the original characters and the main actors.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $ 300,000 of gold , along with a banker Clayton , who 's about to take over the empire. A gang of armed robbers are after the gold, and have hired some local criminals to help them get at it.In this one, we're going to get a little more of a 'real life' feel to it than most. Let me start off by saying I'm not a film guy. My first exposure to the genre was Steven Soderbergh's "Brideshead Revisited"...and if you haven't seen it, don't even bother.

Sure , it has its pretentious moments , it plays like art-house , live-action Fantasia , but it also has its moments of darkness and violence . This film is worth seeing if for no other reason than to see what kind of movie they thought they were making . The worst moment in the entire movie is when the kids are being shot at. I read a review here that said this movie would have made a good B-movie. I guess I'm just not one for movies from the 90s (or any time period for that matter). The story is rather thin and the editing poor.

SPOILERS AHEAD------------------------- Mel has got it going on. From the opening credits to the ending credits this movie has straight laughs. Dave Chappel shows why he is a comedic force. Cary Eewes carries the movie most of the time, but the supporting cast fills in strong when the plot is drawn away from Robin Hood. Right from the beginning this movie proclaims it's self not to be taken seriously. If you took a time machine and gave the characters thoughts of modern day antics you would get this movie.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature doesn't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with enough rough and tumble action and moves along at a good clip. The Ranger looks into a series of mysterious murders which have a sinister pattern to them with peaceful Indians being the victims of a gang of hooded killers. There are more killings and violence usually associated with Lone Ranger adventures and the film has an undercurrent of racial insensitivity, the comments of which are sprinkled throughout the screenplay. The Ranger uses disguises as only he can to piece together clues and expose the outlaw band and bring them to justice.

I 'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of the novel I have put my time into writing. The main focus of the story was that of an angry middle-aged woman, trying to do something for herself but suffering from an incurable disease which has left her without much of a life or a sense of humour.There are several other characters, some with interesting lives, but one in particular is just absolutely horrible. This character is so completely uninteresting, he is barely even human. I can only say, "oh, God.

This movie used to be played constantly on the Disney Channel when I was a bit younger, and I really remember liking it. However, I didn't have great taste back then (not to say that I do now) so I can't vouch for my nine-year-old self too well. The movie was probably a 7/10 but it had some good music so I gave it an extra point. Yeah, worth watching. I know that some fans of this movie are wondering what a certain song is - the one that appears when she is in the car crash.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are living there. The two men get drunk, but when their boat gets stuck they decide to do the only thing left to them. I thought that this movie was good. A bunch of old timey guys riding out west looking for money and trouble. It's not too bad, but the film is made for the younger set. If you're an older viewer, I doubt you'll have a problem with the plot.

Ignore the bad reviews on here , this film is awesome ! `` Just Before Dawn '' is a great example of how to tell a horror story well.I love the acting in the film and it has some very scary moments. The movie seems to have been directed by someone who wanted to make a killer film that could be released without having to worry about it being too scary. It didn't succeed as I expected it to, but what it did achieve was really nice - you're left wondering at what point you'd get your head handed to you.

This movie is VERY LONG, but totally worth splitting up over several nights. It has an all-star cast, and if you are a Patrick Swayze fan, this will get your heart to throbbing! :-) My mother is a Civil War buff, and a history teacher, and every summer we would watch this movie (we had recorded it off TV), over several, several nights until we got through the whole thing. We had every line in the movie memorized, lol. Pop some popcorn, sit back, and enjoy the action and romance.

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter 's voice , there is that old familiar feeling of 70 's blues . That's the only reason I would want to see her in another movie . This film has a beautiful ending, and it looks like something out of the 60s or early 70s. However, as someone who was in high school at the time, I don't know if this makes for an enjoyable movie. I can't seem to figure out just how it could possibly be entertaining to anyone over the age of 12.

Nurse Betty was definitely one of the most creative movies that's been released lately. It was funny, but it also had many touching moments. Zellwegger, Freeman, Rock, Kinnear, & the rest of the cast made their incredibly weird characters seem real. The story took such twist & turns that made it incredibly enjoyable to watch. If you're sick of the recent formula movies, see Nurse Betty for something completely different. Go see this movie in the theater or at least rent it when it comes out!

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos's role as Williams for that entire show, was Emmy worthy. It was uncanny how well he did. And to be as rapid-fire and as random and as creative as Robin Williams really is....WOW. There were scenes where Diamantopoulos had to say probably 20 rapid fire lines and do 15 different characters while delivering those lines, all while sounds as much like ROBIN WILLIAMS doing those characters.....well, that my friends is impressive acting. Its one thing to do a Robin Williams impersonation for a couple of minutes.

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld,after ELR and after Friends. Those three sitcoms were the star shows of their time.KOQs came at the end of this special time in TV. But don't let that dissuade you.King of Queens is as good if not better than two of the three mentioned.Seinfeld started it all and was and is a timeless classic. I never laughed so hard than I did at Seinfeld. But KOQs comes real close.When it comes to laughing, I have to rate KOQs second only to Seinfeld.

Just see it ! It 's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time . See it again when you have the time for that. The main problem is the very poor script which tries to tell the story from an outsider's perspective, without giving us any clues as to the true state of affairs. We're given no real insight into the motivations and character of our protagonist (the man in the wheelchair). He doesn't really seem to care what happened to his father or what happened to his brother.

In Crystal City , a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis ( Ben Johnson ) and Sandy (Maurice Evans ) to take them through the state of Missouri in order to find a lost tribe of Indians. I don't know what this film is about, but it's not interesting. I really have nothing else to say about this film. The acting was good, but nothing really memorable. It just seems like a poorly written movie that didn't do much with any of the ideas or ideas it set up.

Don't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit, crisp dialog or clever social commentary. This time around, the premise of Northanger Abbey has been updated in a very sensual way! In this version,Catherine's erotic daydreams are not just silly fantasies, but a connection to the world of adult sexuality she is just peeking into with her daylight adventures. By day she is very prim and demure, and her swain Henry treats her with the utmost courtesy. But as her own sexual nature awakens, her daydreams shift every so subtly from mild to steamy to lurid!

This film blew me away . I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot . After watching this film I can say I was very mistaken. The Attica riot was an isolated incident . The movie portrays the whole thing as if it were some major event . This isn't even remotely possible . It seems like the filmmakers got the events they showed by accident . I am appalled at the writers/directors who made this film . There's nothing in the history of civilization that is more disgusting than human beings exploiting and torturing one another. "The Fall" is a masterpiece of exploitation.

A couple of cowpokes help a group of Mormons cross some rough country on their way to a new settlement. The whole film has an over the top feel to it, just like so many others that came out in the '50's and '60's. It was not terribly well known when it was made, and only re-emerged recently with the DVD release. So I'm sure this review will seem a little nit picky, but I just can't help myself. When I first saw this film, I was under the illusion that it was a "modern" western.

**SPOILERS AHEAD**It is really unfortunate that a movie so well produced turns out to besuch a disappointment. I thought this was full of (silly) clichés andthat it basically tried to hard. To the (American) guys out there: how many of you spend yourtime jumping on your girlfriend's bed and making monkeysounds? To the (married) girls: how many of you have suddenlygone from prudes to nymphos overnight--but not with yourhusband? To the French: would you really ask about someonebeing "à la fac" when you know they don't speak French?

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I thought it'd be, especially given the title. It's about a couple who have been separated for several years due to an accident. As the story unfolds, you learn more about them, and what their relationship was like while they were apart. What I really found amazing about the movie is how very little gore was shown. This made it seem much more realistic and less fake than some of its imitators out there.

How can anyone DARE say anything BAD about this film ? Pardon Mel Brooks for being a brilliant comedian and movie producer. He created such classics as "The Producers" , "Young Frankenstein" & "Blame It on Rio" (I'm sure some of you have seen it). But he has the nerve to make a movie like this ! I was not all that excited to watch this movie, because most of the time when I am watching a movie in my home theater, I don't care what the director/writer is trying to do, unless it falls into his or her particular category.

I 'm absolutely disgusted this movie is n't being sold . All who love this movie should email Disney and ask them to release it now . There are two great things about movies that are so bad, they make us laugh--and there's only one of them. I mean, if you want to see a film that makes you think "Wow, why did I ever think of making a movie like that", then you've been missing out the last forty years or so. You don't need to be a good director, actor, writer, cinematographer, editor, etc.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks. Marjorie Main (Ma) steals the show in anything she does. Funny to see Ida Moore as Emily, the daffy old lady on the train.. god she was ALWAYS old; she was in "Desk Set" and "Alfred Hitchcock Presents". Their new house is also a co-star here -- its the house of the future with some really cool inventions that Pa doesn't care for. LOVE the painting gag. Keep an eye out for TOM... he starred in "Nanny & the Professor".

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie . Amy Jo Johnson ( Susie Q ) is a great Actress , with the good looks of a movie actress, and the charisma of an actress in her twenties. The film is not bad, although it is not as interesting as the previous films on the list. I'll start by saying that I have seen all the movies in this list before, which makes it difficult for me to give this one any more than two stars. I've watched the original Susie Q and really liked it.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time week after week. The dialogs, or monologues rather, as everybody just rants on endlessly about nothing, are just becoming so tedious. For example, the episode I watched yesterday began with a seemingly unending rambling about how a particular dish (I forgot what it was, pasta with meatballs perhaps) always manages to turn the Gilmore family dinner into all-out war. And these were just the few seconds or so.So it seems every time, lots of lines, with absolutely zero content.

I shot this movie . I am very proud of the film . It was a great experience which shows how much more one can do with only $200 than is possible with thousands. I hope that you'll like the film - but it isn't for everybody. This is a horrible movie that has no redeeming qualities at all.There are many scenes where the camera pans around the characters and you have no idea what happens, or even if anyone is in the shot. Also, when you get to be the last person left in the movie, your character doesn't even talk to you.

I saw "The Reader" at a film festival in Manhattan this week. It touched my heart in a way that few short films have done. In ten or so minutes, it tells a poignant two-character story that resonated deeply with me. Duncan Rogers has done a superb job capturing very real, tender moments on film. What I really admire about this film is that the director has chosen a story appropriate to the short format. These are genuinely interesting characters, and their story is told in the perfect length of time. This is no small feat.

Gosh, I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again 20 years later you gain a different view -- primarily because in 20 years you learn more. For example, I had no idea who George Cukor was - how great of a director he was and how much of that made this film fly. All I can say is..I really liked this film for it touched on an area that paralleled my life: lifelong friendship between two women. Can that EVER exist?

What can you possibly say? This is the uncut hardcore, musical Alice! It works too with a large energetic cast seemingly enjoying themselves to the hilt and whilst one could wish for a re-mastered version, I guess we are lucky to even have this video transfer. Pretty much a delight throughout. There are a couple of slightly off moments but this could have been embarrassing all through and it certainly is not. It also could have been and today would have been too camp. No, a very fine effort that is amusing, tuneful and just sexy enough.

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment ! It is an energetic show and I can see how it would appeal to young kids like me who are still growing up. But I am older now, and my children are more aware of what is appropriate in our community for them. This was not exactly a good movie. It was supposed to be based on the life of Robert Montgomery (one of the great screen writers of all time), but he supposedly never even read the script before agreeing to do it.

I had no expectations when I started to watch this movie . How surprised I was ! This is a bad movie ! I can't believe that people actually make movies like this. After all, what could you have possibly achieved by making such a film ? Nothing, quite the opposite actually. First of all, the story doesn't get any deeper or any more interesting. It's just plain lame. A girl who has only been through one year (or maybe two) falls in love again with someone she doesn't even know from childhood.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . Well, I just couldn't wait until the movie came out. I was so looking forward to the film and then I saw what some of the other reviewers were saying about it! I don't want to be rude here, but really, I have a hard time believing that people actually bought this movie. The acting was terrible (I'm sorry, but everyone in the cast was terrible), most of the characters seemed to be stereotypes, and the plot didn't seem to progress very much.

... I saw this movie when it first came out in France , in my hometown , 54 years ago, i was about 14-15, and i remember seeing it on a French film channel. I thought it was good ! But now, i have seen it 20 years later. What a disappointment ! It is one of those movies that the director puts his own name on it . I saw this movie once as a child. A lot of people seem to like it so I decided to see it again a little while ago. There are a lot of things right with this movie.

Okay I marked this spoiler so don't be upset when I wrap this up. Now I went into the movie expecting to see a very predictable movie. And I was right, as almost every horror flick I have ever seen it was predictable but not as bad as most. What helped was the story, I did not expect there to be a "WHY" to Kane's madness. But there was and while somewhat foggy you still got the idea and understand the madness. Now of course if you like something that will scare you for nights to come this is not the movie your looking for.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one. I really can't come up with one. I think it's because most of the films that take on this topic (war, peace, violence) are in a fixed documentary style.There are some terrific ones out there, all of them better known than USA T.M., I'm sure, but they are intended to be informational and to bring your emotional response to the surface through intellectual means. This DVD, in some ways may seem more intellectual but it really isn't.

i love this movie. is it on air anymore? what can i do to get it on air again because i miss this movie when does this movie air again? i love this movie so much. does anyone know how long it has been since it was last on Disney?it has been a very very long time and i am so sick of waiting!i want to see Susie Q again. i swear, they take all the good movies off air and play new stupid gay ones that are fake and retarded.

On their way to a country house to hear a new play being read a theatrical producer , his secretary M.O., who works for her master, gets lost in London. This is not a good movie! I am not going to spoil the plot line because you will already know all of the bad things about it. The acting is very bad. No matter if you have been spoiled by other horror films you will hate this one as much as I did. There are scenes that just made me sick to my stomach, such as the guy throwing up while watching a scene with naked girls on the ground.

`` The Honkers '' is probably Slim Pickens best performance of all time . When we were shooting , everyone agreed that it was his best film ever. I think the only reason they cast him in this film instead of some other good actor is because he had such an amazingly great career as 'the Honker'. If you're a big fan of Tom Hanks (you might have seen him in 'The Deer Hunter', 'Air Force One' and 'Catch Me If You Can') watch this film first, then go out and see 'The Producers'.

After "Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman" with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as dangerous as men, there was obviously an open market for other movies to pick up and carry the torch and what more a lovely actress than Dorothy Provine from "It's A Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World" to play the role. The downsize is that cute and blonde Provine may just be too sweet and innocent looking to step into Allison Hayes' size 50 shoes. This role really needed someone with an amount of smoldering sex appeal; Provine is more the girl next door type.

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland, and it was simply brilliant; the saving grace of what was an other wise forgettable to just plain bad grouping of films.A perfect use of deep black and pure white, with excellent, yet simple animation, this is simply a story of a cat chasing the moon. Funny, charming, and touching. A small piece of heaven for cat lovers, romantics, and any one else who appreciates how beautiful simplicity can be. If it's in your town, see it.

Fata Morgana is, by far, one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen. I hesitate to call it a documentary because, while is does have elements of documentation of it's images, the images themselves are so unusual, so hallucinogenic, so unclear, that I wonder whether it was really worth telling this story just so that these images can exist. The film basically is the tale of the earth and the creation of the earth shot from the perspective of an outsider, be it alien or something otherwise indescribable, all taking place in the Sahara desert.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export ! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in colour, I was left with more questions that answers. I've seen this film three times now, the latest time having just been re-released on VHS for my birthday. I thought it was good, but not exceptional. It doesn't go into too many interesting details about the events, but there is enough information to give you a very good insight into what went on. The acting wasn't bad, and the cinematography was fine.

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of "Rawhide" Charles Marquis Warren. Direcxtor Gordon Douglas is its chief help in this regard. Its strong plot line can be told in a few sentences. A hard-nosed by-the- book, Cavalry officer, Captain Richard Lance, captures a leader of the Indian enemy after a massacre at a fort. He insists on bringing the man back for trial, to be sent toTucson; his commander sends another man to try to take the prisoner for trial and the patrol is wiped out.

I must say it was a let down . Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the acting , however I am disappointed in the storyline . The biggest disappointment is the lack of an antagonist who would give us some kind of motivation for the protagonists actions and motivations . I really wish they would have just stuck with their premise that there was a war going on between the two races and we were both fighting it out for power over the earth . The movie does not live up to the original. It's not bad by any means, but it isn't good either.

Renee Zellweger is Betty, a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse, who is infatuated with a soap opera actor (Greg Kinnear), and who is married to Del, a cheating, stupid male chauvinist who's trying to sell some stolen drugs. Unfortunately for him, he gets brutally, bloodily murdered instead, while Betty secretly watches. It leaves her unhinged, believing that Kinnear is really the character he plays, Dr. David Ravell, and that she is his RN ex-fiancée. She heads for LA to find her lost love, not knowing the stolen drugs are in her trunk.

wow! i just have to say this show is super cool! i fell in love with the show from the beginning! the idea of the show is very original and very soothing! it's also a pleasure to watch the performance the two lovely leading ladies give, Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel! they're simply wonderful! i'm especially a big admirer of Lauren Graham! she's not just a pretty face, she's a "monster" of an actress as well! i'm not saying that Alexis isn't a wonderful actress as well... i just happen to like Lauren better!

Robert Altman, Nicolas Roeg, John-Luc Goddard--you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy? These and other directors were obviously chosen because they have not followed the mainstream, but created it. For those that complain that they did not adhere to the original story of the opera--How often does the music in a film directly relate to what is going on in the film? It is the mood that counts. This is what I believe the directors of these movies were doing: creating a contemporary mood for old operas. For the most part they succeed wonderfully.

The Killing Yard is a great film, although uneven at times. Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort as a mentally wounded and judicially jilted prison inmate, and the presence of Alan Alda as his defense attorney is none other than genius. The emotion and raw reality portrayed in this film's "flashback" scenes have the ability of putting viewers directly into the midst of the events being pictured. I was not even born when the Attica riot took place, however, through extensive research, I find that "The Killing Yard" does the story all of it's fair justices.

Minor spoilers follow , but nothing you wo n't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by a common plot device (which I won't spoil here), all the main characters go off on some quest for an unknown object in the hopes that it might be powerful enough to defeat their old adversary. I have not read this book at all. I heard about it from my friends, so I went to the library and bought it. I never got around to starting it. I was really hoping that it will be great, but it turned out to be disappointing.

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story, Like someone you might have known. Just trying to make it, my big shot is right around the corner. Then Life's little temptations creep in, the spoiler, stumbled again. How much, can your love take, and give, to the guy who's really not so bad, after all, just Human. I liked it, I was also a paid extra in the movie. Played the drums in the bar shots, with the band, did several walking shots, my green 66' corvette was in the motel party shots.

I have watched this show from the beginning , and I am a 45 year old man . To me, it seemed that the main character was just a victim. He did not suffer at all. The way his wife treated him made me wonder if maybe he was mentally ill. How would he get on in the world if he could not even deal with his own family ? I've been waiting to see if this movie would be anywhere near as ridiculous as its poster suggested. Well, I wasn't very disappointed.

There's a brand new killer on the loose, and he's doing God's work. Yeah right! This killer makes Jason Voorhes look like a chump, and Freddy Krueger look like a rag doll against this dude. He is Jacob Goodnight(WWE's Glen "KANE" Jacobs), a 7' monster who wields a Axe, and a hook and chain. Those weapons are nothing to him his real finisher is ripping out eyeballs from the victims sockets. That is totally methodical! When the encounter happened 4 years earlier, Jacob killed a rookie cop and maimed the veteran after putting a bullet in his head.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare , but Fata Morgana is a good case . You can chalk up the oddness of the plot to the fact that it has been made by German producers, but the result is too much of a disappointment. I am not going to bother explaining in detail how the movie was made, but it is pretty easy to tell that the whole thing is an uninspired hack job. I've seen other people review this film and call it mindblowing. Let me tell you, I thought it was absolutely ridiculous.

That's a bad, raunchy, predictable, tacky, salacious soap opera? "The Best of Everything" is just such a guilty pleasure for me, something along the lines of "Valley of the Dolls". I mean, "Best" has everything. Somebody gets pregnant out of wedlock (when's the last time you heard THAT phrase? ), there are affairs everywhere, drinking, backstabbing, jealousy, and even a tragic but not altogether unexpected death.Caroline Bender (Hope Lange) and Mike Rice (the delicious Stephen Boyd) are the centerpieces of the goings-on.

Based on its current IMDb rating as well as several plot summaries, I didn't expect much from 'Two Hands'. But how wrong I was. From start to finish, you're kept deeply engrossed in a genre which has been continuously unoriginal for quite a while. Even in terms of mise-en-scene and cinematography, the director excels and creates a film consisting of great imagination. If you're looking for a film which is not only entertaining, but also provocative, compelling, and genuinely extraordinary, then make this the next film you watch.

In dramatising Wilde's novel, John Osborne has condensed events, eliminated a number of characters, and generally implied rather than shown Dorian's essential wickedness. If you want a more explicit rendering, see the 1945 film. Wilde and Robert Louis Stevenson lived in about the same time frame, but were certainly vastly different men and writers. This story really treats of a theme similar to Stevenson's "Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde", but note that Wilde chose to treat his story as fantasy, whereas RLS took the scientific route.

If there 's one cartoon that helped to put UPA on the map more than any other , It 's this little gem. Its so much better than its American counterpart, and in many aspects it was even better. The plot is simplistic and not very imaginative. The characters are pretty flat, and the dialogue is weak. But all of these flaws were balanced out by some brilliant art direction, a well-made score, and a wonderful animation style. A lot of people like to make fun of this movie for what it really is. What it really isn't is a comic book.

for a movie like this little hidden gem to come out in the 80s, its shocking how not a lot of people know about it.this movie is definitely worth a look. it has all the things you need for a horror movie. especially the good old chills.i remember watching this movie for the first time about 15 years ago, but i couldn't remember the name of it, so i came to IMDb a few years ago to ask for help on finding the title. i eventually got the name of the title, and bought the movie.

King of Queens is comic genius. Kevin James, whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny, Leah Remini who plays Doug's wife Carrie is incredibly hot ( # 19 on Stuff magazine's hottest 102 woman list ), and very funny. The true magic of the show However is the scenes with Jerry Stiller, they are the funniest in the show. Jerry, a comic genius, plays Carrie's father, Arthur Spooner, whom lives in Doug and Carrie's always cold basement. I must admit that I never watched this show until this year, 2006.

Forget about the plot of this movie. Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Vincend D'Onofrio. Forget about the fact that it is one of the few movies starring Jennifer Lopez that I can stomach. Although the story made be impossible to believe and much of the dialogue seems contrived, the one and only important thing to remember when contemplating watching this movie is that it contains some of the most amazing and disturbing imagery ever put on film. It is as if Salvador Dali decided to make a crime drama.

Being an avid Carpenter Fan, I really loved this film (although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired!) and agree with many of the comments, that certain areas of her life were absent or not touched on. Whatever - it leaves your curiosity well and truly unsatisfied, so off I went to discover more. I must recommend a book by Ray Coleman - Carpenters - The Untold Story. The book is an intelligent read and unlike the film, is 'real' and down to earth. I hope you enjoy it. I remember Cynthia Gibb from her days in Fame and Gypsy.

I liked this a lot. The camera angles are cool, it's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch. And I thought they did a great job with the Sound when we see things from Kane's point of view. Lots of fun. Plenty of people were shouting at the screen! Kane did a great job with his various psycho emotions. He's a lot less one-dimensional than most horror heroes.Kane is a lot less scary and more believable than most movie psychos. It was not clear to me how he would react to various situations.

North and South is a miniseries from the `` golden age '' of television miniseries in the 1980s , which is why it seems to be very well done. However, at times it can get a bit confusing for those who haven't seen much TV. The story begins with the return of a long-lost relative to an isolated town in North Carolina . It seemed like a good idea back in 2006, but now? It's just stupid. Why do we need to see kids dressed up as aliens? We don't know where they come from.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage. I saw "capturing the friedmans" a short while ago and have to admit I thought this was better.The story is not an incredibly shocking one, but it is a great examination of trapped personalities and relational cold war. Block deftly guides the viewer through diaries, family footage and after-the-fact interviews; his interview style is sensitive and probing, and his insights are clear and measured.51 Birch Street is a great examination of personalities and relationships over 40-50 years of social change, the social fallout, and potential for redemption.

There are a few things in life that we can't experience more than once and the college experience is one of them. Especially if we're living in a foreign country and in a apartment with 6 wackos from 6 different countries. Xavier the main character leaves his tidy life in Paris, his ex-hippy mother and his beautiful girlfriend and goes to Barcelona to study spanish in order to get a job at the embassy. He falls in love with the wife of a french doctor and he makes friends that make him look at things differently.

This film was made soon enough after Karen's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen were feeling a little guilty as to how they may have contributed to her health problems. As the years have passed (almost 25 to be exact) it must have gotten easier to deny any complicity. Richard has spent the years after Karen's death endlessly remixing and recompiling the recordings he made with her. He married his cousin, Mary, and from what I have read, it looks like he may be planning a next generation Carpenters with his children.

Well ..... I would n't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I would like to see change, and I believe they will if there is enough of a demand for it. I first saw this movie one summer night about eight or ten years ago. I couldn't believe that nobody had ever mentioned it to me before. My friend brought it to our house and I have watched it at least twice a week for the last four years. The story itself is not amazing. It is actually quite predictable.

I must say it was a let down. Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the issue of schizophrenia, I am not much knowledgeable on this and got whatever it was depicted in A Beautiful Mind, and here too its interesting portrayal.But the thing that caused the let down for me was the artificial dialogues and over use of English. Its true that a new class is being formed/ has been formed in India which talks in English even at home, but I am sure its not as formal as in the movie. Moreover, Waheeda Rehmaan did not seem very comfortable talking everything in English.

I had always heard about this great mini-series , but viewed it for the first time this week , July 19th, 2008. This was the first movie i have seen that brought back any fond memories of me growing up on the 70s. It has everything a kid loves to see in a movie. A young boy who can fly and fight. Well I don't watch many action movies these days. But I am glad I got to see this one.It was funny, exciting, realistic and violent at the same time.The story line was simple and not much different from the TV series.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am. My brother and I were channel surfing and who do we see but a young Russel Crowe. But not the telephone throwing Russel Crowe we had come to know and quasi-love back in the states. This movie, much to my surprise, was amazingly creative and hilarious. It stars a cast of awkward teens with hilarious stories of odd sexual experiences, including a slick salesman,prostitutes, and an unusual sexy mother. If you are lucky enough to come across this film I would strongly suggest picking it up.

This was on odd film. I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. (SPOILER AHEAD) Ironically, the main character murders a federal official. Then he's a fugitive on the run. They later blow up his house and then he finally commits suicide. Seems like they should have just made it a film for a more mature audience or made it more family friendly.This was on odd film. I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. (SPOILER AHEAD) Ironically, the main character murders a federal official.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little more. Firstly I must say that it is certainly not the best soap in history. It's certainly not even the worst. In fact there is nothing wrong with it! As mentioned before, its story is good but not great. I found myself thinking 'how did they get to that point anyway?' and wondering why they made it like that. I've been looking forward to watching this series ever since I first saw the trailer back in April.

I played Sam (the porter, Lou's sidekick) in the Film "Dead Rail" Which later aired as "Alien Express." And, I have to say that for my part I thoroughly enjoyed watching this film. As a struggling actor this was a chance for me to work with fantastic people, it gave me great scenes to include on my reel, and it allowed me to work on a dream job for a month and a half (no waiting tables!) Turi(the director) And Steve and Scott (the producers) Were very kind by giving me this opportunity to participate in the production.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title. It draws parallels between the attitudes of this country in the face of war and a kind of Hollywood-like falseness that glorifies things that shouldn't be glorified. I'm not sure I agree with the filmmaker's take on recent events (although, truthfully, I can't always tell exactly where he stands) but I admire the unusual and artistic way of getting the point across. Audio tracks of speeches, radio interviews, poetry etc. play as large a role here as visuals.

SPOILERS AHEAD -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - Mel has got it going on, so he decides to come out. He tells his best friend that if she loves him she should tell him or she'll die, and I have to say, that is a terrible way to start any relationship. This movie had the potential to be really good. In the beginning it was funny, then it was cute, then it grew on me, but there was not much more left. First off the actors did an awful job of playing young adults.

After a summer full of retreads and disappointments, Nurse Betty is a breath of fresh air. The film is like no other I have ever seen. Director Neil LaBute proves that he can direct more then disturbing pictures of men and women and how they approach sex (his previous two films were the brillant In the Company of Men, and the almost brillant Your Friends and Neighbors). Renee Zellweger gives the best performance of her career as Betty, a waitress who, when she witnessing the brutal death of her asshole husband (LaBute mainstay Aaron Eckhart), and gets lost in a fantasy world.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin. There aren't much left when it arrives. Not of the train and not of some passengers.This is a black comedy directed by Peter Dalle and acted like they used to act in the 40s and also photographed (in b/w) like they used to during that period. The actors must have had lots of fun making it. They aren't much of characters, like they weren't in the 40s, but the story is well narrated and everybody has timing.A deadly black and deadly funny film.

Strange enough, shorts like this get a 10. Why? They are hilarious. This is hilarious. Notice a lot of the quirky humor. Dated and childish to toon naysayers, but they don't know what they're talking about. They got to know that cartoons aren't just for kids. The art in this is probabley the best non-Road Runner art of the 1950's Looney Tunes shorts. It's hard to come across something better than the art in "The Great Piggy Bank Robbery", although nothing ever will. This probabley runs a close 3rd or 2nd.

America's next top model is a good show, it helps people with their careers, but lately i have become bored with it.cycle 1: yeah I'm happy Adrienne won, i wanted her to win from the beginning.cycle 2: its too bad, i think Mercedes deserved it.cycle 3: i did not like Eva, but i did not like most of the girls in this cycle.cycle 4: Kahlen should have won. i don't know what they saw in Naima, but i definitely know what they saw in Kahlen.cycle 5: like cycle 3, this was not a great cycle either.

I have been a `` huge '' rush fan ever since `` moving pictures '' and this concert is simply too good to miss. I was actually able to buy the tickets for $15 (before taxes & tip) at the box office in front of the theater. If you haven't seen this, or don't know it as well as me, go see it - it's one of the greats. First of all, i am very surprised that people still put this film on any sort of list of top 10 sixties movies.

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made, they lack the depth, and just not worth our time.The trailer of "Nasaan ka man" caught my attention, my daughter in law's and daughter's so we took time out to watch it this afternoon. The movie exceeded our expectations. The cinematography was very good, the story beautiful and the acting awesome. Jericho Rosales was really very good, so's Claudine Barretto. The fact that I despised Diether Ocampo proves he was effective at his role.

`` Jaded '' should not be considered as en erotic thriller because the sex scenes are not for viewing pleasure. The story is extremely contrived, and you never feel like you are being watched. I've never been a huge fan of American Horror Story. However, this season was quite good. I think Ryan Murphy and company have really pulled off an ambitious television series that isn't completely devoid of substance or entertainment value. In fact, one might argue that this season may have actually been the best season of any of the other AHS seasons.

In `` Black Snake Moan , '' writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me wonders if he's doing it for the heck of it. I've never been much of a fan of religious allegory, but this is getting beyond parody. It's not clear to me that these characters even have a god or higher power; their belief in the supernatural is just a projection of what they really are. The movie's premise also fails: why is a black snake talking? Is he an alien?

Susie Q. is one of those rare , and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling . It 's a very enjoyable movie but it does not really go anywhere . I think the reason why some people liked this movie was because it had good acting, music, direction, etc. This is such a disappointment. I watched all the previews and still felt cheated. My first reaction when I saw this film was: Why would anyone pay to see a movie that's supposed to be better than Star Wars? Well, I thought I was wrong.

My kids loved this movie . we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie . we all thought it was pretty funny. i think it may have had some merit but i don't know. the only thing that i would like to put on the record is the fact that the children's parents were NOT involved in the making of this picture . they gave us a lot of free time while they went to work and were out of town. There's a fine line between comedy and stupidity, and this movie falls squarely into the former category.

Finally a true horror movie . This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes and ears to make it through it because it was so scary. If you have never seen it before, you will most likely be in trouble.The film is about a couple that has a terrible night when they decide to kill a baby. When they enter the house they see what they think is just a child crawling around. But as the husband looks into the crib he realises it's something far more dreadful than he thought. I saw this movie at my local video store for 50 cents.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time. We loved it so much. It was the only show about Black middle class families on t.v. at the time. Please release this on DVD. I know many...many people who still talk about the show. If it its released i am certain that many black youth will find this enlightening as well as interesting. The show addressed many topics from racism, intra-race discrimination, teen pregnancy, sibling rivalry, single parenting, peer-pressure and much more.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college . As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to the hottest girl in town, I wondered why on earth anyone would make a film about such a subject? It was so boring and uninteresting. What's wrong with seeing a bunch of pretty people having sexual intercourse? If you haven't had that feeling yet, try it out for a couple of minutes. This isn't porn or an erotica novel - it's simply a chick flick. This movie has been re-released many times but it is still not any good.

this is a really great series. i love the show and i am so glad it isn't canceled yet. it has really good humor and shows the realistic bond between a young mother and her daughter. o yes for Gilmore girls! it is very awesome. they are such a sarcastic humorous bunch. they do everything together just like my mom and me. ya for Gilmore girls. um, i'm running out of lines. but i love how Luke and Lorelei's relationship is finally shaping up. they so needed to be together. and i absolutely just love Sookie St. James!

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound affect on me then. I saw in again about a year ago (I am now 29) and it still moved me in similar ways. This is a great movie that personifies the struggle of "principle vs. pragmistism". Voight's character is the idealist teacher that won't give in to any psuedo-racist leanings of the Superintendent, Mr. Skeffington. That story also personifies the struggle of how older people often resist change, and more specifically, cultural change.

This is how I interpreted the movie : First things first . There was not a single scene in the movie that was worth watching.The actors are not very believable and it all makes the movie more boring to watch ! They did not even tried to act like real people (i am not referring to their acting here) .I saw this movie at the same theater where I saw "Ghostbusters II" so I knew what I was doing ! A big disappointment for me. Not just because of the lame plot, but also because of the horrible performance by most of the cast.

***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** THE CELL / (2000) **** (out of four)"Do you believe there is a part of yourself, deep inside in your mind, with things you don't want other people to see? During a session when I'm inside, I get to see those things." --Catherine DeaneAnd so do we. One of the most visually stimulating films of the year, "The Cell" is a love/hate movie-either you love it or you hate it.

I just started watching The Show around July. I found it by mistake, I was channel surfing during a Vacation. It is a great show, I just wish it wasn't on so late at night. It's on at 12:30 AM. As a working person it makes it hard to watch all the time.I read some comments. I did not agree with the late one about not growing up in the 60's and not believing that this stuff can happen.I grew up in the 60's. I'm Hispanic and I had a "White" boyfriend plus we had black friends in High School.

This movie has a lot to recommend it . The paintings , the music , and David Hewlett 's naked body are all highly creative. A young couple moves into this house with their one year-old daughter. They get a job working in the yard and begin to find that the kids are coming to live with them. The baby gets sick and they decide to bring her to the doctor. Things get more bizarre when she looks like she's been drugged. The babysitter starts behaving badly, and the babysitter's behavior seems to be related to the events in the neighborhood.

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms , I thought I would get them all done now. I have seen most of them at least 4 times over the years. For the first 2 weeks after release I did not care one bit for this movie. After it had been out a week, I was finally sold. The acting is what it is. Some good actors are used but they do not hold your interest. There is nothing special to see here. The script is fine. I wish it were that good.

The film starts with promise because there is more interaction between Spanky and Buckwheat, but as the film progresses, the two boys have fewer scenes together. This slows the pace considerably. Billie "Buckwheat" Thomas gives a very strong performance in his early scenes. When he is left behind on the riverboat, his fear and abandonment are palpable and his tears are truly heartbreaking. When he goes from man to man asking for help and is repeatedly rejected the viewer really begins to wonder if this is a comedy or not. Watching a children's birthday party through a picket fence is another moving moment.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western , given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social comment into the script, with all that means in today's world. It has become commonplace to say "it's not just about the movies" but this truly is. I can't recall the last time I sat in a theater on a Friday night, turned on my VCR and decided to watch anything other than a Michael Bay film. So, let me try to set the record straight. One must admit there are a few decent action films being made these days.

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys, but providing a compelling story that was easy to follow.The plot, backdrop, music and talent were all top notch. It was great that you used so many African-American artists to tell the tale of the black cowboy. It was also good to see Billy Zane in this movie. Does he ever play a good guy?I would highly recommend this film to anyone who wants to broaden their way of thinking. This is an excellent movie and I feel privileged to have seen it.

I do n't think I have ever seen a better movie parody . Mel Brooks is insane . EVERY time something funny occurs, he goes into another character's shoes and gives us a new story about someone completely different from the person we were just laughing at. I really didn't care for this movie. It was hard to sit through, but I guess that's what you can expect after having seen so many comedies made by Jerry Lewis, John Belushi, Billy Crystal, Woody Allen, Tim Allen, Jack Black, Dan Aykroyd etc.

1981 's Just Before Dawn is one of the best tales of wilderness horror out there . It 's one that you will only really want to see once or twice before it wears out its welcome and you can't even remember where you saw it last.The problem with the movie is that it has too many sub plots. I'm not trying to rip on the movie's plot, but some of the subplots feel as though they should have been put together in a different movie. A young couple vacationing at a cabin in the woods find themselves faced with an unimaginable horror when their beloved cat mysteriously vanishes without a trace.

This small John Ford western with no 'stars' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces. It has a documentary-like feel to it as it traces the journey West of a party of Mormons and it may be the most authentic looking of all Ford's films, (it's on par with "The Sun Shines Bright" which he made a couple of years later).There is a plot of sorts, (a group of bank robbers join the wagon train at one point), but the film's dramatic highlights are almost incidental.

Style over substance. But what a style it is. "The Cell" is the internal version of most serial killer movies. Unfortunately, the story hardly supports the visuals.Psychotherapist Catherine Deane (J-Lo) goes into her patients' dreams via artificial means to discover and help them over come their phobias and obsessions. A new patient whose fallen into a coma, is brought to her attention by the FBI. He's a serial killer who drowns his female victims then poses their bodies in grotesque scenarios like mannequins. Deane must enter the killer's mind and navigate through his sick fantasies in order to find and save his latest victim.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released . The controversy that surrounded the original release is enough to kill a thousand flies. For me, it was still enjoyable even though it was a far cry from what the title would lead us to believe.It's pretty hard to write a review without mentioning how much I hated all of the characters in this movie. Even the most interesting characters were not developed properly. In my humble opinion, there were two reasons why I hated so many characters in this movie. 1. They don't act like teenagers.

This was a pretty good episode. Though no "Trapped in the Closet" or "Cartoon Wars," it had a lot of things going for it. The character of Al Gore and that bizarre-as-hell "super cereal" thing was pretty darn funny. But, the scene that made me adore this episode was one I'm sure everyone will agree was one of the greatest Cartman/Kyle moments ever. When Cartman is superstitious of Kyle that he'll be stealing his gold(which of course is fake! ), and he comes within inches of his face.

Maybe it's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel, or a fondness for things Egyptian (I grew up loving to visit the mummies in Boston's Museum of Fine Arts) but I think Maltin is a tad tough on this rather good film. The production values are great regarding color and cinematography, and it appears some effort went into historical authenticity (much of it from the novel, I'm sure). Purdom is admittedly a bit stiff in the lead role, but one can accept this as part of Sinuhe's character.

Blue Planet ... Wow ... Where do I begin ? The years of hard work paid off in what is a very well done and well shot film. It is probably the best piece of animation to come out of Hollywood for many years. It is interesting to me how this film went from an indie film to a feature film. A lot of the people involved are probably still working in the film or film business but it must have been a great feeling when the film was picked up by Warner Brothers who then released it as a feature.

Absolutely , I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting , fascinating and certainly beautiful film. I remember reading some great reviews of this film when I first started watching, and it wasn't until I tried to see the film for the first time that I came across some of the critical remarks (not all of them).The problem isn't with the film at all - I think it was a good film from the start - but with the marketing campaign that took place before the film was released.

Fuckland is an interesting film. I personally love the Dogma movement. I wish it had lasted longer. It seems to have already died. Many critics tried their damndest to shut it down. I don't know why. It's the most interesting movement to happen in the cinematic world since the French New Wave. Besides Fuckland, I've seen the first three in the series, Festen, Idioterne, and Mifune. They were all great, Festen being a masterpiece, in my opinion. Fuckland isn't up to those others. I was just fascinated with the filmmaking.

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world as secretaries. This follows the same idea as THREE COINS IN A FOUNTAIN a few years before. This takes place in New York while COINS takes place in Rome, Italy. Our three beauties are Hope Lange, in her first starring role, Suzy Parker and Diane Baker. Lange does well and holds her own opposite some strong veterans in the business, namely Joan Crawford. Suzy plays an obsessive woman who has a hard time losing her beau.

If you are a fan of early Duke movies , this Lone Star oldie is a good one . What made the movie bad was not the story line, which wasn't very interesting, nor the direction, since the characters were too static. This was more like 'The Man from Earth', another film from the same studio (who had also put out the other John Wayne Westerns that year) in which the main character was a lone cowboy with no friends who wanders around a desert looking for an old Indian girl to marry.

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight, he lives in this burned down old hotel, where eight teen convicts go to do some cleaning. Most of them die except for 3 of them. In my case it wasn't the best writing or the best ever. I still thought that the killing scenes were really well done. Like when the one girl go eaten by the hungry dogs. The best had to be when he shoved the cell phone down the Blonde Girl's mouth. Kane was a seriously great horror movie actor, he had this serious look the entire movie and it would never change.

`` The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends , '' says Marion Fairlie , who with her husband has been making movies in Los Angeles for more than 30 years. I would like to tell you how I saw this movie. Well, I saw it in the cinema as well. The film had a great cast and the director gave me a lot of heart. But the thing is, the plot was so wrong. The idea of a young girl turning into a man is not at all realistic. Especially when you have such a big difference from your birth gender.

On watching this film, I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity. Karen Carpenter was a carefree, but very unconfident young lady, whose wonderful voice helped her and her brother Richard to soar the charts with wonderful songs. As with all celebrities of today, they were often criticised about their music as well as their looks, styles, etc. THis had a huge effect on Karen who raged a battle against her eating and drastically lost weight, which eventually caused her death. This heart felt film was not initially something which I would have thought of watching.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years. I rate it one of the best ever. I've just returned to Ireland from Arizona on American Airlines from a biz trip and by chance they showed several episodes. I laughed my head off and later I asked the stewards to play again and they did. Thank you AA. The acting from all the team is first rate and especially from Kevin James, Leah Remini and Gerry Stiller, but from all of the cast in fact the acting is superb. I love all the cast, they are so funny.

I 'll be brief : I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that got under my skin. For example, it's a horror flick, and yet it starts off so innocuously.
