You don't really see the killer until halfway through the film, and it's only mentioned very briefly.And what was the point of bringing in an "original" actress to star in such a film? Yes, she does try her damnedest to pass herself off as a real person, but the rest of the cast are no better than average.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football league after he is booted from his old team. He faces many hardships including an abusive head coach who will do ANYTHING for a victory. His star player gets hurt and has to go on IR, making this even more complicated. What can be said about this piece of shit that hasn't been said? The acting wasn't very good, there weren't enough laughs out of the whole picture, and the ending was a little too abrupt.

Fata Morgana , the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog , filmed over several years in the Swiss Alps, features a beautiful female mountaineer named Lotte Lehmann (Brigitte Helm) suffering from "mountain sickness" and taking her life on a treacherous climb up the highest peak in Switzerland.It also features stunning photography by cinematographer Ernst Gmelin ( The Man Who Fell to Earth ). The plot is pretty simple: A woman suffers from a mysterious disease that can only be cured with the help of God, and so an angel flies her up Mount Everest, where she must face the wrath of the mountain gods.

Honestly , when I went to see this movie at the Rave theater in Plainfield Indiana , I did not expect it to be that bad.I was expecting a B-movie with some funny lines and decent acting . Instead what I got was two hours of torture. This isn't a really good film.The director is obviously trying to ape "The Matrix" but tries to improve on it, but falls short. The only thing I can think of as being good is that the action scenes are better than the ones from the original "Matrix". I've just seen this movie, and it's awful.

George Cuckor , known as a director of women , could n't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful women to star in her film, however, she probably knew it all along that she would only get one shot at making a good movie. This time around, she's not so lucky...I guess I'll start with the actors. Michelle Rodriguez is an extremely pretty and well-endowed Mexican-American babe with the face of a Barbie doll. She has a lot of acting talent but here she falls flat due to some very poor acting choices.

Ok, maybe Posse can't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies. But that's because it didn't have the FUNDING those movies had. Obviously, whenever you want to produce a story such as this one, focusing on African American historical involvement (and NO, servants and 'mammies' are not historical involvement), Hollywood isn't going to be too supportive. And believe me they weren't. The producers and actors sacrificed a lot of 'out of pocket' expenses to make "Posse", just so that the story could be told. I think that alone is commendable.

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south . The story follows a man and his younger sister as they move to the big city to live with her parents. The older brother is a gang leader but he soon comes into conflict with his violent family.The characters are all very likable and well acted. However, this movie could have been made much better if not for the awful script. This movie has potential. But it just falls apart around the halfway point. For starters, it lacks any kind of real plot line.

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

Very good `` Precoder '' starring Dick Barthelmess , which in a way , kind of reminded me of Hawks . I rented this show last night and found it pretty bad. What really sucked about this show was how lame the writers were for trying to make it something it was NOT. You can't have an hour long episode that has NO plot! They tried to cram two hours of nonsense into 30 minutes! There was not one joke that made no sense, not even one. The whole show seemed like they thought they were making a serious comedy but they were just doing a half-hearted parody.

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed . Very funny and the production quality is outstanding . It is worth a watch , I am really surprised this little movie has not been seen by more people . I would give this movie about a B minus or C. If you like campy movies of the 70s with all your favorites, then definitely check this one out. This movie had a lot of laughs but was very forgettable in my view. It was just OK for me. The story didn't have much to work with and the characters were bland and stereotypical.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way!! When I first tuned in to America's Next Top Model, I expected to be bored, and to find it very very stupid. I didn't. This show is actually serious fun. I read on one of the other reviews that it makes you wonder if you have what it takes to be America's Next top model. And it so does! Who doesn't love the glamour and excitement that come with being a model? On ANTM you get to see what it's REALLY like.

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of `` slasher '' movies in the early 1980 's , that some would try to create an authentic horror story. However, I don't think anyone could have really expected this movie to reach the success that it did. It is certainly one of the worst films ever made. This film was so bad it made my head hurt. As a horror fan I can safely say I haven't sat through a more inept effort to frighten viewers. The acting was awful and the gore effects were terrible.

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year. It was a truly moving experience. I had heard of the Truth and Reconcilliation process, but as others have written, did not know much about the details of the process. This film demonstrated the process and the growth that can occur when people are able to face up to their pasts, understand the events from the points of view of others involved, and grieve together. Archbishop Tutu and the others involved in developing the T & R process deserve recognition for their understanding of human emotions.

I first saw this on the big screen with my girlfriend . It was a fun romp with some cool acting, but it wasn't so much of a blast to watch that it left me thinking about it for days afterward. I watched this one with a group of friends (not the original cast), and we loved it. But there are two major flaws in this movie, both related to pacing. It is true that there are no really good horror/thriller films made nowadays. In fact, there are lots of them which don't even feature real vampires, werewolves or monsters.

The film starts with promise because there is more interaction between Spanky and Buckwheat , but as the film progresses, the relationship becomes more and more strained. You are in no position to give a real review of such a bad film. I am amazed that the movie was allowed to be shown theatrically. We saw it only at the Cinematheque for one night and left without ever having an intelligent discussion about the issues it raised. The movie did not deal with any aspect of the history or present situation in which we live so well.

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain ( of course , because it 's so sensational and makes me want to know more!) I thought it would be a fun read but it turned out to be more boring than any bad movie I can remember. There are only about 6 or 7 scenes that made me angry. I'm not one for reading horror books or seeing horror movies in theaters. But I was looking for something different to do while doing homework. I saw this at a used bookstore near my school and decided to pick it up before going home.

In a time of bad , if not plain awful , comedies , King of Queens is more than just good . It is excellent ! This was the worst movie I have ever seen. Not only did they screw up many characters, they killed off most of them. They didn't even bother trying to explain what happened to the main characters or why they were acting like they were being murdered out of revenge. There's nothing funny about being shot, stabbed, hit with a car, drowned, blown up, or having your head torn off and stuffed in a toilet.

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous mission, they blame him for his reasons. Feeling guilty, Peck goes on an almost impossible task of defending a fort, where they are outnumbered by the Indians. Peck chooses for this mission soldiers which he considers to be the scum of the earth and the actors that play these soldiers, Ward Bond, Lon Chaney Jr., Neville Brand among others, are excellent. The script is derived from a novel by Charles Marquis Warren who was a specialist in westerns, as a writer, director and producer.

This is the best movie I have ever seen. It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate. And a deep friendship that not even war can destroy.The most splendid casting I have ever seen. Patrick Swayze and James Read were top grade in this movie.If you see part 1 you will want to see it all. Some of my friends watched part of the movie at my home then went out and bought the movie.I am a civil war buff but this movie got my grandchildren interested in history. Any movie that can get children to learn history is great.

I 'm not gon na lie . To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is hot and makes your eyelids hurt. When I found out that this movie was going to be in my home town, I was ecstatic. I love cheesy horror comedies, and I really enjoy watching bad movies. This is definitely one of those terrible movies that's just plain bad. Well, it might not be bad, but it has its share of plot holes, stupid jokes, and annoying characters. Let me break down a few of the most obvious:1.

Michelle, Anicée Alvina, was so nice, and I really fall in love with her. She died a few months ago! Friends? Really the best movie of my youth. The "seasons reprise" of Elton and his arranger Paul Buckmaster sings in my head forever... Please, if you know where i could find a VHS of the film, mail me!! My husband of 26 years & I saw this as Juniors in HS. Yes, he was my boyfriend then and still continues to be. I think we both cried our eyes out.

"Jaded" takes on the complex question of abuse: the perpetrators and the victims. In lesser hands it would have degenerated into an erotic thriller made for direct-to-video. This director, however, has managed to pull off a textured multi-layered study with a decidedly different point of view.Given the fact that the director/writer is a woman and the main detective and D.A. are also women, this could have turned into a very anti-male film. It is not. To be a sexual predator IS gender neutral. The nudity of this film is not erotic. The rape is brutal not sexual.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V . and came across this. I immediately saw that there were two girls on it. The first one (the female model) looked just like me! It took a little while to realize that the other guy on the show had also been looking at her the whole time and he was pretty young too. One of the most disturbing movies I have ever seen, "Femme Fatale" features some of the most bizarre images ever put on screen.

I ca n't comment on the accuracy of this production , historical or literary , but I can say that there are some things that don't add up . This movie does not live up to its promise. The actors did not have a strong presence in this film.The plot was weak and it was all too predictable. The way they portrayed the characters were not accurate at all. A good script is one that makes you see the movie from different angles, so that you will feel more than just an emotional reaction. This movie has neither. I rented this movie with no real expectations.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I bought it and watched it once. The first 3 hours was a waste of my time but then something funny happened. Why does everyone keep talking about this horror movie, when it's an action thriller? I can't really say that I hate it, but I thought it was bad. This movie isn't very well acted, the script is cheesy, and the ending could have been a good one.The story follows a group of kids who are traveling to see a rock show.

When this show first came on the air , I saw it once or twice and thought it was another crappy soap opera. I didn't give a s*it. I used to have a few friends who hated soap operas. Soap, like any other entertainment medium, is subjective, so we all have our preferences. But one of them really got me hooked. One night, we were watching MASH and they brought up something that stuck with me: The Love Boat. "Oh man!" my pal said, "this must be good."

`` The Cell '' is a rather difficult film to classify . If you read the plot outline , `` The Cell '' would seem to have a lot of similarities with the book of the same name. The main characters (who in this case are three young women) are placed in a cell after being sentenced to two years for something that they did or didn't do. One can understand the fear and desperation that goes through the prisoners, but not the absurdity of the plot. I was pretty shocked when I first saw this film.

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford 's best in my opinion . No major stars , but a fine script. I'm sorry to say I can't rate this more than 2 stars due to the fact that if you've got no sense of adventure, drama or suspense then this is probably just for you. The premise of the story was good but the production values were appalling.The film was based on the true story of how a group of soldiers (the Texas Rangers) came across the bodies of Mexican men who had been beheaded and buried along the Rio Grande.

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good:The camera work was absolutely phenomenal. Every shot is done beautifully.It was interesting seeing all the different animals that I could have never even imagined.David Attenborough has the perfect narrator's voice. No one could have done any better.The Bad:There were one or two different times where there was a reference to the Earth being 1 million years old ( I hold a different belief). Overall a TV series anyone can enjoy. I highly recommend buying it. 10/10 stars.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross, Sydney. The plot focuses on the plight of a young would-be crim who's life is in danger after botching a job for his future boss. Very well acted by Heath Ledger and Bryan Brown. The plot is fairly believable with some very humorous moments in one scene which revolves around a bank heist. The setting-up of various themes central to the story is quite well done. Eg. When one crim is searching for bullets for his gun.

George Cuckor, known as a director of women, couldn't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful women for his last film. Itself a remake of Bette Davis' campy "Old Acquaintance" written by John Van Druten, this film is definitely dated, but still delightful.Bergen and Bisset sparkle as best friends who compete at everything, but manage to remain friends. Liz Hamilton (Bisset) is a "serious" writer, intellectual, and elegant. She meets her lifelong best friend Merry Noel at an exclusive girls school and they begin a lifetime of not always friendly competition.

This is a really great film! It gets you thinking about your parents. How we all have fragile relationships we all have with them, unless we really make an effort to know who they are as people. And just as important, we should remember to open up and show them our real selves, not just who we think they want us to be. Definitely see this documentary! IMDb is making me write more text before they will post my comment, how odd. Usually online comments need to be short short, and here I am being asked to write more!

In Crystal City, a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis (Ben Johnson) and Sandy (Harry Carey Jr.) as wagon masters to lead their caravan to San Juan River. Along the journey, they meet first the broken wagon without water of the quack Dr. A. Locksley Hall (Alan Mowbray) and the prostitutes Denver (Joanne Dru) and Fleuretty Phyffe (Ruth Clifford). Then the sadistic outlaws Clegg boys decide to join the Mormon caravan to disguise the patrol leaded by the Sheriff of Crystal City that is chasing them.

Along with virtually every Republic Picture ever made, "Murder in the Music Hall" seems to have undeservably faded into oblivion. A shame, because this lusciously produced, expertly directed and written, and crafty mystery-suspense item spins an enticing whodunnit thriller against the setting of Radio City Music Hall. A murder in one of the building's posh penthouse apartments casts suspicion on the luscious Rockettes--among them, Vera Ralston (who besides giving an appealing performance of subtlety and vulnerablity, provides a few dazzling ice-skating production numbers), Helen Walker, Ann Rutherford, Julie Bishop, and several other delectable B-movie starlets of the '40s.

spoiler--In 1993, African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with "Posse". The film was co-written and directed by Van Peebles, who also stars as the main character, Jessie Lee.Plot: The film begins at the turn of the 20th century, when the United States was embroiled in the Spanish-American war. Apparently a time when the U.S. justice system could send convicts into military service, Jessie Lee finds himself an unwilling enlisted man, serving with an all-black cavalry troop in Cuba.

At first I could n't tell if it was an art film or a documentary . The day after I saw the opening I had to come back and watch the whole thing again. I kept thinking about how you can tell the difference between an art film and a documentary just from the look of it . In the early seventies, French filmmaker Jean-Luc Godard became a household name with his influential films such as "Nostromo", "Citizen Kane", "L'Age de Chez Panisse" and "Au hasard Balthazar". One of those movies was "La Cage aux Folles" (1986).

This if the first movie I've given a 10 to in years. If there was ever a movie that needed word-of-mouth to promote, this is it. A $4 Mil box is a disgrace. People don't know what it's about. If you have any appreciation for the Blues, or just a good use of excellent music, that alone is reason to go see it. How many people knew Jackson could sing, and damn fine too. You hear books and movies taunting that they're about salvation. After seeing this, you'll never be able to forgive such trivial use of the word.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn and become comfortable with the political realities.The main character is an English exchange student who moves to Belgium to study, only to find himself drawn into the internal politics of his small nation. One of the most enjoyable movies I've watched in some time. If you're looking for a good film on the Euro, this should be up there with "Zoolander". The story is about two brothers from England who have gone to Brussels to attend university.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values , but very surface level ideas . When I heard there would be a TV mini-series based on Harry Potter, I had high hopes. But alas, they have fallen to pieces. First off, one of the series main plot elements is missing - that of Neville Longbottom's sexuality. The writers have made it painfully obvious that they did not write this subplot out of their script as they should've. It is easy to see how someone might find this show attractive and enjoyable.

Fuckland is an interesting film . I personally love the Dogma movement . I wish it had lasted longer . Its a shame to see such a great movie get lost in time . The only saving grace is the superb performance of Robert Englund which really brought the character to life . At times, this movie could have worked better. This is mainly because of how badly the special effects were handled.The plot is basically as follows: A young boy has no idea that he is different than everyone else. He meets another boy and his parents become worried for their safety so they send him off to live with his new friends.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission , I can only look at this as a political statement from the Government. As an Aboriginal woman, who grew up in remote areas where most people speak no English, it's sad that I'm compelled to sit through another documentary like this one. There has never been a greater need for better education about indigenous affairs and human rights than now, yet the ABC is continuing to ignore this important work. This film seems to serve primarily to try and make the government look good, rather than educating people about what really happened during these years.

* spoiler * * spoilers * * spoilers * I found the film amusing.It was weird and I enjoy it. But there's so little of it, and it's so unevenly shot that it feels more like a cheap joke than a real film.The actors seemed to know it was bad, however, and didn't hesitate to let us in on how bad it is: "This one's pretty bad. We got some really great stuff in this one." First of all, the title of this film does not make it any better.

I'm seen this documentary in its feature-form, in a movie theatre. And... wouah! The pictures are astonishing, one really wonder how by Jove did they manage to film those waves, those animals, those... is that a plant ? a predator ? a creature from the movie Abbyss ? Anyway, it's remarkable. Sure we've seen a lot of such documentary on TV, with weird animals and so on, but none with such a beauty, a precision, a deep emotion. The only downside is the commentary.

Wagon Master is a very unique film amongst John Ford's work. Mainly because it's the only one that is based on a story written by John Ford himself, the story that was elaborated by Frank Nugent and director's son  Patrick Ford and turned into a screenplay, and because of director's personal opinion regarding it, Wagon Master is the film John Ford called the one which `came closest to being what I had wanted to achieve', to say so is not to say a little, but as Ford confessed once to Lindsay Anderson, his favourite was nonetheless My Darling Clementine and not any other.

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old . I knew nothing of the book other than that it included a boy who falls into a deep, mysterious lake and becomes an islander for some unknown reason.The film was not very good. The actors looked great in costumes but did they have any idea what they were doing? I can't think of a worse way to waste an actor's time. I wish they hadn't tried to recreate the feel of the book.The storyline was confusing. There was no point to the film.

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch the bits I missed whilst bending over holding my stomach! The critic who reviewed this film for this site challenged anyone with an IQ over their shoe size to find this film funny, well my IQ is approx:135...I challenge this person to question me and then eat his own words! This film is brilliant and if the critic above wasn't such a boring idiot, he might smile for once in his life and take things as lightly as they're meant!!

I did n't personally know Karen Carpenter , nor , Richard for that matter , so I must go by what other members have to say about them. I've seen this movie at least five times and still find it to be of poor quality and the acting extremely amateurish. What are they trying to convey? Why do all the characters act so strangely in unison? The plot is thin, uninspired, and lacks depth. To me it just doesn't make any sense. At the start of the movie a man has his head stuck in a freezer for several hours.

This movie makes you think . It shows how a woman 's weaknesses can result in nightmares for others . I don't want to spoil it for everyone (especially those who will be seeing it after I have finished writing this review), so I'll just go ahead and say that the film has one of the worst opening sequences I've ever seen. The idea is interesting but the execution is bad. We see two old women walking down an empty street, talking about how they are going to retire. As they walk along they suddenly start hearing strange noises which sound like someone being murdered.

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this. I have been searching for it for a long time to show my daughter to show her and i can not find it anywhere. probably because it was only on video and they never made the DVD or VHS or idk.i saw this right off Disney back in 1996 and i think it would be the best video to show her. such a good movie that has every type of emotion displayed throughout the whole movie. also has a lot of actors that started their careers with this movie.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare, but Fata Morgana is a good case. You can chalk up the large subject to the ambitions of youth, but Herzog does an amazingly good job. The movie's point is to show human beings, and even the world, from a non-human point of view.The movie is in three parts: Creation, Paradise, and The Golden Age. The imagery of each is in counterpoint to the voice-over. Although the text of `The Creation' (from the Popol Vuh, a Mayan myth) refers to the primordial wasteland, the scene goes no further in illustrating the myth.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight (Midnight Cowboy, Coming Home) has ever done, but a real tribute to teachers.Despite incredible odds, Pat Conroy (Voight) managed to reach a group of students and bring them from nowhere to a basic literacy and awareness of the world. His methods made be criticized by bureaucratic dinosaurs like Mr. Skeffington (Hume Cronyn), but teachers like Conroy will always be winners.Voight really showed that he had a love for teaching and that it was a natural high for him.

there's only so much that i can take of Filipino films, especially nowadays where the trend is sex, action and slapstick comedy(which i hate). the fact that Nasaan Ka Man made me think and made me gape during the movie was a big plus. It's got good cinematic scenes and editing was great, especially the cinematography. i think that Claudine deserves the best actress here rather than getting one in the movie Milan. the fact that there's only so few Filipino movies that i really like. i think Cholo Laurel did such a great job in this movie.

During the War for Southern Independence, GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against a Yankee invasion.In 1936, Hal Roach decided it was time for his popular OUR GANG kids to branch out into occasional feature-length films. With the big success of Shirley Temple in two Civil War period movies in 1935 (THE LITTLE COLONEL, THE LITTLEST REBEL), it was only natural that Roach would look in that same direction for his GANG. Although given a rather lavish production and distributed by MGM, GENERAL SPANKY was not a critical or box-office success.

* * * SPOILERS * * * * * * SPOILERS * * * THE CELL / ( 2000 ) The Cell is the biggest disappointment of all time. This is one of those movies you want to see and then realize that it's more like a bad joke. I'm not sure what the point was in this film but it seems to have nothing to do with the actual movie at all. I've heard some good things about this movie on the internet. And even though I saw it on TV, I was disappointed by the film for the first half hour.

After I've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie. I'm not saying it belongs in the top 250 of all times, but in it's genre it is a great movie. I know, not many people find it amusing to see how a legendary story like 'Robin Hood' is turned into a comedy. Many people still seem to believe that some things shouldn't be laughed with ... they are wrong. Mel Brooks has done an excellent job with Robin Hood: Men in Tights.

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits about whether it's rabbit season or duck season. Love Bugs and Daffy stirring up "pronoun trouble" with Daffy always the victim of Elmer's shotgun resulting with his beak always getting dismembered. Then there's the rabbit's cross-dressing that always gets Elmer in his love struck mode. Chuck Jones and Michael Maltese are always favorites of mine in the writer-director team category because of these hilarious hunting trilogy cartoons I've laughed at since I was a kid.

i love this show! it is amazing...i can never miss an episode even if i've already seen it. the actors are perfect for the parts......i love Gilmore girls! i've gotten all my friends to watch it. even their parents watch it now. i watch it daily and i usually watch it more than once a day. i wish my mom was like Lorelei. my friends say that i talk and act like Lorelei. Lorelei and Rory have a wonderful mother-daughter relationship. it is a great teen show because they actually kind of learn from watching it.

Robin Hood: Men in Tights (1993) was a much needed parody from Mel Brooks. He has the assignment of spoofing the Robin Hood legacy and the couple of movie dealing with the mythical honorable thief of English folklore. Cary Elwes stars as Robin Hood. He's looking for a few good men who'll join him in his quest to topple the evil sheriff of Nottingham (Roger Rees) and win the fair hand of Maid Marian. Robin also has to deal with Prince John (Richard Lewis).as well.

I went straight to the big screen to view this kicker. This is the only flick that I know of that Tarsem Singh has directed but boy was it intense. This movie was a total mind stimulant and one of the best special effects flick of this kind.The characters were vibrant and and nothing short of beings created in your own mind or nightmare. This movie is scary and interesting and totally bombs the senses with fear and exhilaration. This movie compares to no other I have seen except for the level of being beautifully odd. In that respect it is a fairly large step above `A Clockwork Orange.'

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I've ever seen! I was not a big fan of Robin Hood, or Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, but this movie was a lot different! It made fun of Robin Hood, and was HILARIOUS! I was extremely pleased with how well it was put together, and how well acted it was! Besides Home Alone, Mrs. Doubtfire, and Houseguest, this was the funniest move I've ever seen! I especially love the song; "We're Men in tights!"

Although dated , this film is definitely worth a watch . I saw it about eight times as a teenager and it still makes me laugh . This film has so many interesting scenes and dialogs that it keeps on surprising me . A must see for any fans of science fiction or the sci-fi movies of the 1970's ! I have to say, I never really cared for T2: Tribes (and there are plenty of reasons why I don't think it's an excellent film). It had some good moments, but overall felt like a step down in quality from the original.

This show is my absolute favorite . This show is intelligent , entertaining and always full of surprises . Lauren Graham is simply stunning as a mother , wife , daughter and sister . The acting is top notch too . I really can't get enough of this show.The best part about this show is it is funny and very much true to the original source material . This show is a must see by everyone interested in movie making . I love this show. I don't know why. It seems that every episode has a surprise that will leave you slack-jawed. The writing is smart.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster ( a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV 's `` Land of the Lost '' fame ) sets out to find his missing dog. In the early sixties, a film is released that depicts an alternate and much more dangerous version of our world. An underground organization has set up a series of tunnels under Los Angeles in order to create a city of pure darkness where they will live forever. One of the members of this secret group is a man named Frank West ( Robert Mitchum) who is sent to investigate.

Even for sci-fi this movie is movie is a little out there . Alright , more than a little ... I can't really say whether it's good or not. But the premise and execution are so off on both parts that it makes one wonder what the point of making the film was in the first place.The problem with this movie is two-fold.One, the main characters all have such terrible voices that they make you question if they had any other lines at all ! The other problem is the fact that the movie is set in an alternate universe where the dinosaurs are still alive and killing people.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address `` Mithi/Mithali '' ( Konkona ) is in search for from the movies beginning to end. First, the story is poor and boring, but the characters are not good. It is all about Krishna who has been dead for 30 years or so, now reincarnated into a woman. The movie does not explain any of these facts. WOW! I was looking forward to watching this movie on a rainy night because i wanted to catch a good action movie with lots of gun shots. Boy oh boy, i was wrong! !

This is one of those movies that was never publicized and therefore was missed when it originally played in the theaters. As a result, few people actually saw this movie before it disappeared from the schedule. In addition, I've never seen any other movie like it. I had to watch it just to find out what the heck it was about. I know it's been a while but I can't get rid of this film! The plot is as bad as you would think and the acting was awful. There are two things that really kill this movie though: 1.

I viewed The Reader at Sugar, which is not an optimal venue for viewing anything, and the movie was by far the highlight of the evening. The technical elements were well meshed and it was obvious that Duncan Rogers had chosen his designers and crew well. But it was the story and it's delivery that truly made this short shine. Duncan Rogers' tight script was just what this evening of "shorts" needed. It neither meandered, as several offerings did, or preached to us. The Reader was simple story telling in it's best form, well cast by Rogers and beautifully acted.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons, Elmer Fudd is out hunting, and Daffy tries to get him to shoot Bugs. Needless to say, Bugs has his own agenda. Moreover, "Rabbit Seasoning" makes interesting use of word order and pronouns (warning: it just might hilariously and royally mess up your speech).I think that probably my favorite aspect of this cartoon is the costumes worn by Bugs and Daffy. One of them seems like it would have been risqué for 1952 (especially in a cartoon), but they pull it off perfectly, as they always did.

I liked this a lot . The camera angles are cool , it 's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch Project. However, the story itself is totally unbelievable . I can't believe there's so many people that would actually do this to themselves . When I first stumbled upon this documentary I was completely floored because I was a fan of the show. I didn't even watch it, as I thought it was just a silly little piece of entertainment, but I watched it again tonight, and I couldn't believe how much of what I'd heard was accurate.

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris . We 're all here on an exchange so I wanted to rent it. I thought it had good reviews and was fairly well known in France (the only French person that I knew had seen it was one of my friends). Well... It was a total disaster. The acting was really awful, the plot seemed very weak, the pacing was bad and the dialog was not understandable. For a film that is supposed to be funny it was pretty stupid too.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot . Bugs of Daffy . He 's unsure whether or not to go through with it, but as he starts walking towards the house he realizes that he must either kill or let the killer come in.This is probably the worst film ever made where the director has attempted to make a suspenseful thriller. In spite of being an old time horror movie, I can't see how anyone could have been shocked by this "discovery". It's just so predictable and stupid.

1981's Just Before Dawn is one of the best tales of wilderness horror out there. It's one of the finest-made slashers of the 80's and it easily blows movies like The Final Terror, Don't Go in the Woods, or The Prey out of the water.A group of young adults come to check out the mountain property that one of the group has just bought. However they are not alone in the wild. A hulking in-bred murderer, who seems to be in two places at once, is lurking and apparently hates trespassers.

During the War for Southern Independence , GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against the invading Union troops. When he's unable to stop the rebels, he uses his "superior force" to capture them and hold them captive. Well, this is about as entertaining as you'll ever find in the world of action/adventure movies.It's a pretty sad way to spend a Saturday afternoon.The film starts out with one of the more typical "hero rescues" I've seen over the years - a woman gets caught in some traffic and must rely on her motorcycle to get home safely.

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore . I 'm sure it pisses a few liberals off . But in all fairness, that is the point of this show. The first thing you will notice upon viewing this episode is the horrible acting. This is the most terrible acting I have ever seen! It is very obvious they didn't spend hours and hours on each scene. For example, in the beginning, there's a scene where Tom Hanks is sitting in a chair and he says something like, "We're just getting started" but then he starts to speak.

This is a great concert which featured the best songs of the band's 30 year career. Lee, Lifeson, and Peart were animated and fun on stage and delivered a great show. That being said, I think the audio recording was botched at the mixing console and/or through the miking process. This is not the fault of the boys however. They even mentioned that the show was setup last-minute, so the band and their crew obviously did their best. They just shouldn't have put the show out for public consumption.

Being an avid Carpenter Fan , I really loved this film ( although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired, in my humble opinion). There were several parts of this movie that made me laugh out loud. The acting is quite good overall and all the characters are well-developed. This is what happens when people who write books about the occult give you a script to make a TV movie based on them. You get a very bad piece of crap that attempts to blend the paranormal with a horror/thriller/drama plot. I am a fan of the book series so I wanted to see how it turned out.

This is a simple episode ad so far after watching all of the Season 11 episodes ( with the exception of the final episode which I didn't find interesting). We learn about two women who work together in an art gallery; one of them goes to prison while she gets a new boyfriend. She decides to take him back to her place and they have sex on her living room couch. So, my friends and I went to see this movie last week and honestly...it's just not as bad as we thought it might be!

"Two Hands" is an entertaining, funny story about Australian lowlifes. The screenplay contrasts the world of fast money and deadly acts with the inexplicability of fate and circumstance. In a subtle way we are asked to ponder the concept that major events in our lives are sometimes generated without our being fully aware of the root causes. The forces of fate and circumstance take Jimmy, the main character, into situations that bring about the realization of his shallow dreams and, ultimately, an understanding of a more personally promising world.The clueless Jimmy, portrayed with acumen by Heath Ledger, is a kid who grew up without opportunity.

One of the best ! As being a fan of the civil war , I was very pleased with the movie. It had good action scenes and the storyline was quite interesting . The music was good , though not exactly what I would want to listen to while watching a film, but well it was entertaining all the same . The only things that bugged me were the actors , i couldnt really understand their accent , and the dialogues . I'm going to warn you...this is a bad movie. Not necessarily in "good" or "wish it weren't" type of bad.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot. Bugs of Daffy. He's unsure of what season it is and Bunny and Duck arguing help matters not. Though Bugs proves he's the smartest once more by repeatedly using reverse psychology on Daffy in increasingly subtle ways. And when that runs out he does his trademark cross-dressing thingy. Daffy freaks out and demands the bunny be shot. Though Elmer is too stupid he is hopelessly in love with the girl bunny thing. Elmer really is to blame for all this.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really don't approve of pornography all that much. pornography has a useful purpose in society(can't say i can always think of one)but it probably does.personal viewpoints set aside, i really thought this film was pretty funny. i didn't buy this movie because it was pornography, i bought it because i am one of those 'Alice' obsessives who will watch anything about 'Alice in Wonderland'. i own just about every version there is on DVD so it was an obvious choice to complete my DVD collection with this.

I 'm a fan of independent film . Dialogue driven , character study pieces are where it 's at for me and this one did not disappoint.The lead is good as usual, so is the supporting cast, who were all just as likable as the lead. A very interesting movie with lots of action scenes and suspense. The story revolves around a couple who fall in love and have a kid that gets stolen by a group of kidnappers. What happens next is fascinating. I know it sounds silly, but what really got my attention was how realistic some of these scenes were.

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew, a narrative depth superior to most novels, wonderful music, philosophy and a connection to LIFE that I find difficult to explain. To immerse oneself in Die Zweite Heimat is for me akin to a spiritual experience, similar to the awe one gets when looking at the stars in a clear night sky. The language, and use of both colour and monochrome segments adds to the dramatic impact. The film inspired me to go to Munich and visit some of the locations, including the Edgar Reitz office.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen . To explain my experience , let me start by saying that for quite a few years I have been watching American Horror Story on the Sci Fi channel, so when this came on, I was intrigued. I've never watched The Box before but it seemed strange enough that I decided to give it a shot.This is one of those rare movies that make you want to scream in disbelief at how wrong and evil it all is ! The only way I could describe the movie would be horror-comedy with a twist.

After searching for 6 months , I finally found this DVD . All I can say is it was damn worth the wait and effort . I read a review that stated this show was not very good. Well, I watched it and...it kind of was. However, if I wasn't as familiar with the series, I'd probably have had a negative opinion about it. Let's start at the beginning.... There are two types of bad movies: those that are made to entertain and those that are made to offend. This one is the latter.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to live together in an apartment in Barcelona, where they are all studying on international fellowships. Central to the story is Xavier ( Romain Duris),who may have lived a rather conventional life with his mother in France, but who quickly becomes a leader in the group, helping them deal with landlords and other problems. He learns about life and love rapidly. Duris has a wholesome appearance and gives a fine performance. The rest of the cast also play well.

This film had me spellbound this evening . Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted . John Voight is still a wonderful actor even at his advanced age ( 70 ), but there are times when you want him to move on . I have to say that the performances here were all very nice , except maybe for one or two who should have been left out of the credits. My friend brought this DVD to our house for X-mas. At first, she was excited about it because it looked like a good movie.

I saw MESSIAH 2 a few months ago and didn`t get to see the original teleplay untill a few days ago and this is far superior to the sequel . Okay it`s not a million miles away from the plot of SEVEN but it`s still compelling . Much of my praise has to do with Ken Stott`s performance as DCI Red Metcalfe a policeman who seems to have led a very unlucky life and someone who has a terrible secret . It`d be easy for Stott to go over the top but he plays the role in a fairly subtle way .

The above summary really isn't meant as a slam against this film, as the series followed a very similar format. As usual, Simon Templar ("The Saint") meets a lady in distress and comes to her aid. He also comes to the aid of a police detective who was framed of accepting a bribe. Along the way, he meets some interesting supporting characters (this time, Paul Guilfoyle as "Pearly" Gates) and during his unraveling of this not especially compelling mystery (none of them really are), Templar is extremely erudite and just plain cool!

After I 've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this thing. It was an okay movie, but not great. The story line is just plain stupid (even if the ending seemed to be foreshadowing a future event)and the acting by the main two actors was not what I expected from them. This film has no redeeming features whatsoever. If you are looking for mindless action, this is the movie for you. In fact, most of the scenes in this film are boring.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am . My brother and I were channel surfing on free time and we decided to give it a whirl. I thought the movie would have something to do with pirates but after watching it, i was confused as to why the pirates were attacking the giant sea beast , the ocean. This film has all the potential to be a great horror flick, or if it was done right, a great "mystery thriller".The plot line is somewhat interesting (the characters are all different) but the writing is just plain poor.

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story , where both Carpenters are in a recording studio, when the song "I've Grown Up" suddenly cuts in on their performance. This film is so ridiculous I can't believe some people think it's good to be honest. One of the best movies I have ever seen. It is about two guys from Brooklyn trying to make money by working as a hit man for a group of Mexican assassins. Their first assignment is to get revenge on the police officers who killed someone close to one of them years before.

If I'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty, I probably wouldn't have touched it with a ten-foot pole. But after I heard some positive buzz, and knowing it made some noise at Cannes, I decided to give it a try. What I got is a truly enjoyable movie, based on a very entertaining plot. Rene Zelleweger is impressive in her role as nurse' Betty, a woman who is sent into a delusional psychotic episode following a traumatic experience. I also liked Morgan Freeman (no surprise) and was pleasantly surprised by foul-mouthed comedian Chris Rock.

Hallelujah ! ! ! ! Finally , a true Colombian film crosses the border ( s ) to shows how much worse it is over here. Very bad, VERY bad ! The only good thing about this movie was the sound mixing, which is decent. If you are on the lookout for "bad" films with a lot of nudity or sex, give this one a try. So, I've just seen this film, at least I assume that's what they called it. A friend sent me a link to it, and I said I'd watch it, but didn't expect too much.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool . I watched it with my friends and after a couple of minutes we were all hooked on it and wanted to see it. Well, its been 2 years since it came out and I still haven't seen it. What's the deal with these sequels? What's the purpose? Why do people seem to get so excited about them anyway? It makes no sense. First of all, they're not sequel to movies or TV shows they're sequels to movies and TV shows that have already been made.

Surprisingly good made for T.V. Thriller. I wasn't expecting too much from this one but I'm glad to say that this is one of the best of it's kind. It's fast paced and features solid acting and interesting events. The story gets you hooked on since the beginning and with many hits, you can't help but find the movie very interesting.The background story of Thiessen's character is hard but it turns into a nightmare when her husband is something much worse than her childhood friend's step father.The "stranger" concept and his actions are disturbing if you consider that it is a common disease in society.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it. That's because not only is the plot simple, but this film also has so much violence that you will want to scream at the screen.The movie starts with three young teens hanging out in a dark basement. Then, a woman appears on the second floor, dressed in a nightgown. She turns out to be a witch who uses an electric drill to transform her husband into a dog. The boys try to fight back, but they are easily subdued and turned into dogs along with their friends.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright , Wagon Master was one of Ford 's favorite movies. While it wasn't overly bad, it was not an A-grade picture either. That's a bit of a problem in a film like this, since we all knew what we were getting into. First of all, I thought it was a very good movie until I finished it. The acting is top notch, there is no filler whatsoever. However, the story itself is rather disappointing. There are many aspects of the story to be considered and I'm willing to see where they end up.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time . We loved it so much . It was the perfect blend of black crime, cop drama and good acting . I just wish I could have watched it when I was younger because I think my mind would've been blown as a result . I had heard a lot of hype about this show, but after reading some of the comments, I was surprised that this show actually got a second season. Well, first off, I don't even like detective fiction. I usually enjoy shows with a mystery or cops and robbers story.

This is definitely an excellent show . I do n't have cable , so I started renting them , because they were on the Disney Channel . I watched it during the middle of the month , when I had extra time to kill . The acting and writing are just perfect . This show has no redeeming value for me, it's not that bad if you're looking for something to get you into a good mood, but once you watch it, you find yourself wondering "what happened here?". This show is terrible. And there is really nothing else like it in this day and age.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as "the murder mystery", as the addition of sound to films helped to make a more faithful translation to film of what the audiences experienced in the original plays. And since horror films were very popular in those years, by enhancing the horror elements of the plots the murder mystery films experienced a popularity almost equal to what it enjoyed in the previous decade (in which the first movies of the genre were produced).

This film, released in 1951, has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50's; the cavalry needing to protect the territory from a murderous band of Indians, an officer determined to see that task through, and the men with him with various character flaws that he has to merge together into a cohesive unit. This small band must hold on to a fort located close to the Indian village until reinforcements arrive. The Indians know, all to well, that the small band is undermanned, and could be wiped out before the help comes.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings . In Europe , where the director of this movie lived , they do not speak such language . The story is simple, but the characters are so interesting . I found myself watching this movie with tears in my eyes. It's a good movie to watch with young kids , because it does not have any adult content ! This movie has been rated 7/10 by European Film Institute and 8/10 by Italian Academy of Cinema
What a disappointment - there's no suspense at all.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie . My teen-agers enjoyed it over the summer and my son even commented on how funny it seemed. As usual, the movie's plot is not that exciting and the characters are pretty predictable (but they are likable, anyway.) But what makes the movie interesting is the cast of characters, especially the kids. There really is something about having them around that causes you to question everything you see. My friends and I rented this because we weren't into the films we were given at the local multiplex.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe. Notice how some of the Roman sets are redressed to pass for Egyptian sets. The film is produced with all first class elements, beautiful photography, stirring soundtrack (Alfred Newman and Bernard Herrmann - see if you can tell which composer scored specific scenes). However, the principal acting is a bit weak. Edmund Purdom seems to have a limited range of emotions and is uninteresting to watch. The best performances come from Peter Ustinov as the one-eyed slave and Polish actress Bella Darvi as the Babylonian temptress "Nefer".

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight , he lives in this burned down old hotel , where eight teenaged girls and two of their male friends hang out to get laid. I'm really disappointed in this one. I mean, I've seen pretty much every horror movie made, so it's no biggie that they all suck - but this just seemed like it wasn't funny at all. The main character was kind of annoying and his relationship with the local cop didn't seem very strong. In general, it just wasn't as good as the movies I saw last night.

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out of me. I loved it so much and I was dying to get my hands on it.In 2002, I remembered that this movie existed but I had no idea what it was called, so, I went to the I Need To Know section on IMDb and explained what the movie was about and tried to get the name of it. Anyway, eventually someone on IMDb told me, so I researched and tried to buy the movie.

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations, discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional dramas and over-the-top acting.Once in a while, movies like 15 Park Avenue come by and sweep you off your feet.The movie grasps your attention pretty early on and there is no moment to rest after that. Aparna Sen has done a wonderful job of gluing the audience to every line of the movie. The impeccable character development, "just right" amount of emotions and an enigmatic end to match it all...I have a renewed respect for Konkana Sen Sharma, who convincingly plays the schizophrenic Mithi.

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie. They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to shine. In particular, the way Candice pronounces the words "Puerto Rican" is very funny, as she is being kind as she can be but condescending at the same time. I had seen the original of this movie, called "Old Acquaintance", starring Bette Davis and Miriam Hopkins. They allegedly did not get along, so because the movie is about female friendship, that might have been a problem. Here, the actresses clearly admire and respect each other.

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film: Who are the crazy people?The answer become less clear as the film goes on.Renee Zellweger loses the whiney note in her voice and, while her voice is still high, she is incredibly effective as the shell-shocked Betty. In fact, she is so effective I almost wanted her to be just a little more crazy because her created reality was so believable.This is the first time Ms Zellweger has been called upon to carry a film and she is more than equal to the task.Chris Rock  though as foul-mouthed as usual  is fairly subdued as Wesley.

Wagon Master is a very unique film amongst John Ford 's work . Mainly because it 's the only one of his films where Ford is credited as writer/director. I've seen many others with him credited as co-writer, editor, etc. In fact, he did not even write the script. After seeing this movie today for the first time I had to tell myself that I shouldn't have wasted so much time on it. After all, it has no redeeming features and almost no redeeming quality in terms of acting, writing or direction.

After `` Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman '' with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as bad or worse as men on TV, and this movie did not disappoint! Let me preface by saying: I have never watched a television show where so many things were wrong. The acting is horrible. The dialogue is terrible. The plot doesn't make any sense. There are too many scenes that happen in slow motion (which makes no sense at all). And don't let anyone tell you that this is an action flick.

America 's next top model is a good show , it helps people with their careers , but lately i have not been able to get my head above water even watching the episodes
One of those shows that I don't know why anyone would want to watch. There isn't a lot of plot, there is not a lot of comedy, and some of the actors are pretty bad. The characters are basically flat and they seem to be written for no reason. The only redeeming feature about this show is that the jokes are funny and the acting is solid.

...I saw this movie when it first came out in France, in my hometown, 54 years ago, I was nine, and today I still remember each black and white frame, especially the black ones, because it was so tense, scary, those sneaking attacks through that dark pass in the mountain, the two soldiers, prisoners forced to fight each other by their captors, the last battle with the uncovering of the wagon with the Gatling in it firing away, the last fight between Peck and the chief, and the Happy End which let me take back my breath.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much . The theme was well handled by the Director with great production values. It is good that the family and friends could share in this movie together.I would not recommend this film to any one who does not wish to be entertained. What a joke this movie is... I can't believe that anyone thought that this movie would be successful because it's supposed to be about "family". I have never seen such a pathetic attempt at entertainment, comedy, romance, friendship, etc. This is an absolute waste of time, effort and money.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much. The theme was well handled by the Director with great performances from Shabana Azmi, Konkana Sen and well supported by good performances from the other cast. The climax was built well but for the ending which was a far from being called "Good". We are still trying to understand what was the Director trying to convey? Were they short of ideas or was the ending beyond the understanding of common movie lovers? A better ending would have created a lasting impression on the audience and increased the viewer-ship.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites. The unsung hero of his generation. Nobody mentions Cukor in the same breath as John Ford, Howard Hawks, William Wyler or Billy Wilder and yet, look at his filmography. From sparkling comedies "The Philadelphia Story" "Adam's Rib" "Holiday" Psycho melodramas "Gaslight" "A Double Life" a great semi western "Heller in Pink Tights" not to mention "My Fair Lady" or "Travels with my Aunt" He was at the service of his actors, he never put himself in front of the camera.

I couldn't believe the eye candy from start to finish. Being a fan of movies directed by music video masterminds. I am happy to report that the photography in this motion picture is a splendor for the eye to behold. There are so many rich, full images that are put before me, that each and every time that I see this movie, I find something new that I had not seen before. As with previous movies that I have seen, such as Blade and Mystery Men, also by former music video directors, the use of color to capture one's attention is utilized extremely well.

I get really fed up with sitcoms; you feel you always know what is coming so it ceases to be funny. On the other hand, Hi De Hi, you rarely know what is coming and it's laugh out loud funny. I have just purchased the second set of the series, (series 3 -4)and I am surprised at just how much I am enjoying it all - again. I have nothing but praise for the writers or the actors (or the many unseen crew members) because the entertainment they provide is well worth the wait.

Robin Hood; Men in Tights is worth watching, I recently watched it because I've just become a Cary Elwes fan, and this is one of of his lead-roles. Some moments really made me crack up so hard! I didn't expect them you know, it was so funny, Even the 2nd time around you'd still fall off your chair The cast is great, of course especially Robin of Locksley himself,Cary, but Blinkin and the Sheriff and Little John (Don't let the name fool you, it's veryy big!

This is how I interpreted the movie: First things first. There was not a single scene in the movie where u see the bad guy (Taylor) torturing or nailing Ben's hands to the wall. However the same cannot be told of the gals. In the end too, u see Taylor disappear as he walks. Looks like the message there was "There was no Taylor". And the whole movie was a figment of imagination of Ben. Also, there was no scene during the torturing moments wherein any of the gals confront or are in the same frame as Ben.

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen(mostly in English). In the earlier film she treated a contemporary political environment and its effect on individuals. In this film it is the impact of mentally disabled member of the family and its impact on the family. As a parallel sub theme she treats a philosophical concept on "reality". It is a film which leads to thinking after seeing the film.Mithee the younger sister (Konkana Sen Sharma, the daughter of Aparna Sen) is suffering from Schizophrenia being taken care of by the dominant elder sister Anjali (Shabana Azmi) .

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies, along with Spaceballs(although I will openly admit to not having watched many others, at least yet). It's very silly and thoroughly funny, there are hardly more than a few minutes throughout the entire two hour run-time, where you aren't entertained. Almost all of the gags have a great comical effect, few of them fall flat. I saw this movie right after seeing and reviewing Spy Hard, and comparing these two spoof movies, I realize exactly of how high quality this movie really is.

This was a pretty good episode . Though no `` Trapped in the Closet '' or `` Cartoon Wars ,`` this has a nice twist. This is not your typical cop-show setup, but it works well enough. As far as my experience with `Law & Order` goes, I like that it tries different things and gets good results from them. It's a shame that when the producers are looking at casting for an episode, they only consider black people for roles. That is the saddest thing about Law & Order: SVU.

I just saw this wonderfully filmed movie that captures the essence ofhigh-brow NYC , or any big city of mid-century America.This is a great depiction of NYC 's culture. I have seen lots of documentaries on Brooklyn, but never one with this kind of authenticity. The whole thing has a feel of New York as you are seeing it in real life.There are interesting interviews with the characters, and there's a great sequence where we see the Statue of Liberty up close. First off, I hate to say it, but the show is terrible. From start to finish, this show was unbearable.

Having just watched this with my mother ( Who got it for Christmas ) i was thrilled to find something from the 80's that has been re-imagined. The movie is about a young girl who falls for a man she barely knows. She decides to break up with him and moves to a small mountain town where she runs into old men. One day they decide to kill each other. After this happens, the woman wakes up in the body of her dead lover. What a stupid movie!! I mean really stupid.

This comment discusses `` North and South Book I '' dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA is a fascinating one to study. It was a time when a man from New York had more chances of becoming President than any other in American History. When he did win, it was almost universally accepted that it was because of something his ancestors had done during the Revolutionary War. (And we are talking about an America which had no income tax or sales taxes at that time.) I've always liked the movies set in the 1800's, especially the old silent pictures.

A classic late 50 's film . The superannuated headliners ( Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan ) are not at their peak , but they don't play a part of this one. It's about the life of a young man in America trying to make his way through the hard life of the urban ghetto . I saw it with an old high school friend on our last week out in Los Angeles, and it was quite an experience . My first reaction to this piece is: why? This movie does nothing but remind me that I have never seen any of the other "horror classics" produced by Columbia Pictures.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies, and this is actually the second time in my life I watch a Swedish movie on cinema! Therefor, I believe it's one of the best Swedish movies ever! The combination of thrill and humour is OUTSTANDING, and sometimes you don't even know if you should be terrified or just laugh! The plot is about this man, a writer who wants to go to Germany after World War II and help the Germans to start over. On the way to Germany, he is trying to help his friends on the train, which is however a bad idea.

GREAT, Chris Diamantopoulos has got to be the best Robim Williams that I have every seen.. He acts it up, perfectly. This was like watching Robim Williams as he really was and is.. It almost made me cry watching him.I had no idea that Robin was as close a friend to John Belushi as he was. The portrayal of this relationship was very good and could almost stand on it's own merits.. Very sad, what both of them went through.I really felt for both Val and Robin during his rough times.

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails. Because it was a little picture, John Ford was not harassed by the studio big wigs. He was happier with this film than any other because he was able to do it his way. He was also able to use his repertoire of gifted character actors that had played such an important role in his past successes. Some of them such as Ben Johnson had been discovered by Ford and given opportunity to show their talents. Johnson was recruited by Ford because he was an authentic cowboy from Oklahoma who usually did his own stunt work.

I actually went to see this movie with low expectations since it was the only one that fit my schedule. And amazingly I found it really original. I have commented on other Colombian films before, and I agree that Colombian movies tend to have a similar scheme, and always try to make reference to the average vulgar people,especially trying to make jokes out of the continuous cursing. But let's face it, the language used in this film is not especially exaggerated. Unfortunately, this is how real people speak.

The entire series, not just The Blue Planet, is nothing short of amazing. The best nature series we have ever seen. The episode on the deep is like traveling to outer space! We have watched this with our 10 and 7 year old boys and all four of us have not been able to pull away. We read a negative comment on this and could not believe it. There is so much new information that we never learned in school. Its also the best view we have seen from any television or movie into the delicate balance of our earth's eco-system.

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound effect on me. I couldn't sleep for a week afterward, and I didn't really understand how something so awful could be made. In fact, I just kept thinking about it, until my friend told me he'd seen it, and I decided to give it a whirl.The film is about a 14 year old high school kid (who goes by the name "Jules" at school) who moves to Florida with his family for a summer job.

Most of these reviews are dead on, so I'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of questions I've seen on here.While the characters seem and look young (hence the controversy), the actor/actress themselves were 17 and 18 at the time and so obviously over the 16 barrier. Here in the USA, that's still somewhat controversial but the simplicity and innocence of the film does much to offset it.I'm sorry not to have seen more by Sean; in this movie at least his expressions are demonstrative and obvious; you know exactly what the character is feeling whether he's angry, afraid, or confused.

I get really fed up with sitcoms ; you feel you always know what is coming so it ceases to be funny and becomes just irritating.This show is no exception. I am a huge fan of the original 'Full House'. The first few episodes were pretty great. In fact for about half of the first season, they were some of the best shows on tv! I have nothing against these comedies. I've had a couple of good ones in my time. I do however, find myself wishing that "Full House" wasn't such a one-note sitcom.

What can I say? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception to the rule.MESSIAH is a great thriller, a truly shocking and creepy tale about a serial killer who cuts out victims' tongues and replaces them with silver spoons. Police Officer Red Metcalfe (Ken Stott) and his team have the task of trying to solve the mystery of the seemingly random events, before more lives are lost.But be warned - despite it's '15' rating (in the UK), MESSIAH is a bit of a gruesome film.

`` The Cell '' is an exotic masterpiece , a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a great writer but also, more importantly, into our culture. I saw this movie twice in theatres (once on DVD and once at another theater). I could not believe that this was a movie made by people who have any kind of training in film, because it was so ineptly written and directed.The plot consists of four kids (three boys and one girl) going into a basement to play chess. One of their opponents, a blind guy, sees them leaving and comes after them.

Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have seen this year. Neil Labute's terrific casting and cynical direction keeps this film from becoming too sentimental while Renée Zellweger and Morgan Freeman's authentic performances give it a soul. Violent, provocative and humorous at the same time with a truly wonderful ending. Chris Rock, Greg Kinnear Aaron Eckhart, Crispin Glover and Allison Janney all give uproarious, tongue in cheek performances. The greatest spoof of soap operas since the movie Soap, but better and smarter. 9 out of 10.

The "Hunting Trilogy" of Rabbit Fire (1951), Rabbit Seasoning (1952), and Duck! Rabbit! Duck! (1953) should be considered the comedic high water mark of the Chuck Jones-Michael Maltese collaboration. While they are seldom mentioned in lists of the "greatest" or "most important" cartoons in the history of animation, they are certainly THE FUNNIEST cartoons I've ever seen. Michael Maltese never got the credit that directors like Jones, Freleng or Avery got, but it's his dialogue and situations that make Warner Bros. cartoons, and these three in particular, some of the FUNNIEST ever made.

I was drawn to "Friends" by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous Elton John whom I had see in a club in nearby Houston. I had no idea of the emotions and impact the movie would make. Recently I was brought back to the movie by a song that Heart did called "Seasons", then I found the Elton John song "Friends" thinking it was the same song...it's been 35 years of so. Anyway, the flood of the emotions of "Friends" came back like seeing an old photograph of your first real love.

I have watched this show from the beginning, and I am a 45 year old man. To me, this is so much more that a show that appeals to women. This is the story of a family, possibly an unusual one, but a family none the less. It centers around a mother and daughter, Lorelei and Rory Gilmore, two bright, attractive, and in their own ways successful women. Lorelei makes her home in fictional Stars Hollow, CT, a small New England town with a sense of history, and a population of people that may be unusual, but acts as a dysfunctional family.

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80 's inbred/backwood slash-fest, but there are some aspects of this movie which I feel are worthy of attention. Let me start by giving you a brief background as to why I believe this film has some interesting elements about it. For one thing, I've always felt there is a certain amount of "greediness" in American movies these days. We live in an age where everyone seems to think they're entitled to have their needs met no matter what, from food to sex to shelter.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross. But what I didn't realize at the time was this is actually pretty good trash. It starts off strong but then slows down. I'm sure you can guess where this goes. The most boring movie ever... The plot is predictable and the whole thing takes way to long to do anything. And while it has some good special effects, it still isn't very convincing. This is about as far as I have gone into my dislike of B-movies.

Minor spoilers follow, but nothing you won't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by a wonderful central performance from Renée Zellweger, Nurse Betty is a dark yet deceptively good-natured comedy.Suffering from an emotional and mental breakdown after witnessing her sleazy husband's murder, already-troubled and desperately unhappy waitress Betty becomes convinced a character on her favourite daytime soap is her long-lost fiancé and sets off from Kansas to Hollywood to find him.Instead of making jokes at the expense of Betty's mental state, writer John C. Richards is very sympathetic, with Zellweger portraying her as a lost innocent, not entirely helpless but tragically vulnerable nonetheless.

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim (Richard Barthelmess) who has one bad flight in over 4000 hours and is forced to give up commercial flying. He meets a beautiful girl named Jill (Sally Eilers) and the two start up an act involving flying and stunts. The two start a relationship, but when Jim is hurt, his brother (Tom Brown) takes over the act for a while and falls for his brother's girlfriend. From there, things get exciting and terribly terribly sad.This film is a pre-code because of several reasons.

`` Side Show '' is one of the weirdest Horror movies ever made from Full Moon Pictures . Very gory, full of gore, blood and sex. It is very slow-paced and the ending makes you wonder how much longer they will let this movie to run on. My problem with this film is not just its lack of suspense but also its blatant attempt at humor. If it weren't for the awful voice overs (I've been through a lot since I'm 19 years old) or the acting, it might be acceptable. But as it stands, it's plain awful.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film's lead actor Fabian Stratas' deliberate mispronunciation of Falkland, a reference to the film's setting and a rather less than subtle allusion to the secret agenda of its protagonist.Fabian is an Argentine national, an amateur magician passing himself off as a tourist visiting the Falklands soon after it is reopened to its people. His master plan is to win the ultimate struggle by seducing and impregnating the local females, commencing with the delicious Camilla,thus siring an entire generation of half Argentinians.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways. It is a non stop plethora of emotion and taboo subjects. Sex and love. Women's emotional abuse of men, Men's physical abuse of women, Sexual child abuse, Fresh approach to religion in real life, and all tied together with very raw and powerful blues music.I promise you that if you sit through the first 20 minutes you will find the tie in and bettering of all the characters. And the ending will be more pleasant than you can expect.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V. and came across this film. I don't ever remember seeing this or hearing of it. What a fun and interesting one to watch. Well, my meeting was pushed back, because I couldn't get out of this film. It had some real interesting things in it that marked it's time in history, and some fun things that they don't have people do in today's film because it's not pretty. Well, there was a lot of realism in it.
