I found this film so irritating that I thought I was going mad when I watched it. After being thoroughly bored with all the films I've been forced to sit through this one I did what I think most people do at times when they get their mind set on something; I turned it off and wrote a comment on my screen saying 'This is the worst film I've ever seen'.

Fata Morgana is , by far , one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen.The movie starts out looking like any other film from the 60's, a beautiful woman in an extremely sexy dress enters a man's house and then he falls asleep. She wakes him up and after a long conversation she reveals that she can see ghosts in her sleep. If you are thinking "this is not that sort of thing" then you are correct. The film starts off with an attractive woman waking her man up from a nap.

This is a `` revised '' Riverdance presentation , staged at Radio City Music hall in New York City . The film was intended to be broadcast, but they decided to cancel the event because of bad publicity about the sexual content . I saw this movie when it came out and I can safely say that it does not deliver on any of the hype or promises given. Let's see, where do I start? I've been watching "The Riverdance Project" for the past couple of years. And now I must say...this movie wasn't so bad!

Do n't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you ? I've watched this for years and I'm always confused. The story is not that great, but the actors are alright. But then there is the plot. There's nothing much to tell about the plot. You get an idea from one of the characters in the film, but it doesn't matter. It's hard to figure out what's going to happen.The acting is horrible as well. I can't believe how bad they are.

"The Cell" is a rather difficult film to classify. If you read the plot outline, "a psychotherapist journeys inside a comatose serial killer in the hopes of saving his latest victim", you might think it's a thriller with a touch of science fiction. But that doesn't really do this movie justice. There is a fantasy aspect within the sub-conscious minds that is stunning, with lavish visuals and incredible mind-tripping scenarios. There is drama as the aforementioned psychotherapist (played by Lopez prior to her becoming a solely romantic comedy component) makes contact with the child within and witnesses his terrifying upbringing.

Fata Morgana, the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog, filmed over several years in the late 1960s, is one of those rare DVDs that should be listened to with the commentary turned on. It is a visual feast of North African (mostly Saharan) imagery that is timeless. You simply could not tell that it was made over thirty-five years ago. The soundtrack to the film, including German classical music (Mozart and Handel), and rock music by Blind Faith and Leonard Cohen, also lends its timeless quality.

See No Evil With Kane . The Movie Has a great storyline But it just was n't a Hide my Kids. If there is anything in this movie that makes the viewer cringe it must be the lack of believability on the part of the film-makers. It is hard not to feel for the characters, since we can easily empathize with their emotional state when faced with real world problems like losing one's job, dealing with a broken marriage and having to start a new life all on their own. Yet, once again, they never seem to have the ability to come up with a solution.

Believe it or not, the Mona Lisa actually got stolen once, and was missing for nearly two years. In 1911, Leonardo da Vinci's 'La Gioconda' (better known as the Mona Lisa) was taken from the Louvre by a petty thief (and former Louvre employee) who allegedly sought to return the world's most famous piece of art to its native Italy. His actions after the theft make it seem more likely that he intended to sell the painting for his personal profit. (Of course, he had no hope of finding a buyer.)

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film . It was when I was a teenager ,and I don't think many people really know it.It seems like a silly movie that had a lot of potential, but sadly went down the drain in the 90's and has been almost forgotten in the 20+ years since.This is just such a dumb piece of shit that I can't wait to see it all again on DVD. You've seen movies with bad special effects, bad scripts, and bad acting. You've also seen movies with good special effects, good scripts, and good acting.

If you want to see a movie with nudity , sex , drugs , alcohol , brutal beating of a woman & murder of an old man this is a good choice, but its not the worst movie i have ever seen. It is more like a horror movie than a thriller. The acting is so bad they were making jokes about it instead of having fun on the screen. I'm no big fan of horror movies. They tend to fall into a lot of clichés that really don't leave me much to be scared by.

Although dated, this film is definitely worth a watch. I saw it about eight times as a teenager when it opened and it changed my life...I just HAD to live in New York. It has great opening shots of the Manhattan skyline with Johnny Mathis crooning "Romance is still...the best of everything..." that rival those of West Side Story. There is a rather stilted performance by the world's REAL first Supermodel, Suzy Parker (sorry about that, Janice D.), but it's great eye-candy!

Despite all it's trappings of style and cinematic invention, this is basically another serial killer thriller, following the same sort of plotline favoured by such old favourites as Silence of the Lambs ? team of cops follows the trail of (particularly nasty) murders, someone else gets taken and they somehow have to find out where they are before it's too late. Only in this case, the only person who knows, the killer himself (powerfully played by Vincent D'Onofrio) is in a coma and we need psychologist Jennifer Lopez' sci-fi mind-meld machine to get into his head and force him to tell all.

then you will be a big fan of this movie. Its almost the same basic concept, a nice mixture of music, soul, and drama. I'll admit, i was a little aprehensive about seeing this movie, I had only seen previews of a white trash girl chained to a radiator, but I am a big fan of Samuel L. Jackson and I enjoyed Hustle & Flow so i thought I would give it a chance.I'm very glad that I did. It turned out to be more than just the surface story of a nymphomaniac southern girl being imprisoned by a 60 year old black man.

Tex Avery's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the brightest moments in cartoon history. His cartoons were exceptionally inventive and surreal with MANY weird touches that were later celebrated in the movie THE MASK. Eyes popping out when a guy sees a girl, impossible stunts and non-stop action were the trademarks of these films.This is one of several Droopy cartoons that Avery was responsible for and it's among his best. Droopy is a Mountie and he is determined to get his man,...though in this case it's a wolf who has escaped from prison.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships, 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the spotlight on his own family, Block covers terrain that is off-limits for most filmmakers. He explores a common but often unspoken family dynamic and does so without resorting to hyperbole or sensationalism. In fact, the film is deceptively low key at the outset. In addition to providing a probing look at one family - and, by extension, every family - Block has also chronicled a very specific period in recent history. I don't know if this was intentional, but unavoidable due to archival content.Highly recommended.

This movie just might make you cooooo . The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town . Betty's character was a total bimbo ( and this is a good thing ) . I didn't like much of the plot line but at least they gave it their best shot . There are several films out there that are similar to this one. They all start with some girl getting raped by a mysterious guy. She gets scared, runs from the guy, and has to escape in order to get to safety. When she wakes up, she finds herself at a very important place.

I too saw this movie when it first came out . I was a teenager at the time , and it got me all excited to see what other movies there might be. And then about 5 hours later, another film came along that caught my interest more . That movie was called "The Last Starfighter" and it was the best movie I had ever seen . This movie is not as bad as the title suggests. The story lines are somewhat interesting, the performances are very average, the special effects are OK, and the acting is fairly good (though nothing amazing).

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall! As an archivist re: the Music Hall..I know what is and what is not associated with the New York venue. The film's Theodore is just the "Music Hall." No Rockettes are in the film. Only wonderful ice skaters plus superb actors and fun. Just thought you would like to know. Truly a wonderful film. You will never guess who the 'murderer' is while watching this film....till the very end. What a superb plot and beautiful ice skating.

Brilliant film ! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats only because I don't like this type of films, even if I know nothing about the subject. "This Is 40" takes a page out of "In the Loop" and "Thelma and Louise" as it revolves around two people whose relationship has hit rock bottom. They're living on their own with no money (with the aid of family) and are trying to make ends meet while still looking for a place in society.

This is what porn used to be , this is a true classic . I mean , it is an amazing film and I have no doubt in my mind that all the people involved with the making of this film felt they had really done their best . It doesn't look as if it was edited for any obvious reason apart from sheer boredom .It is one of those movies where you go, 'what on earth did they do here' ? I don't understand what the point of this film is. It's just a bad movie.

Strange enough , shorts like this get a 10 . Why ? They are hilarious . This is hilarious . The jokes are so crude and cringey . It is sad to see such bad comedies coming out in the 90's but they were funny then as well.This film was pretty awful . Too many plot holes, too many inconsistencies . Well here's an interesting idea, if you're bored of your regular TV channels, give it a try. I started watching it around the 6 hour mark, and I couldn't have been more than 50 minutes in at that point.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas, Phoenix, Fresno, etc., just single buildings with the name in block letters on the roof. And the tri-motors, and the well-dressed passengers. Fast-forward 75 years....But what really got to me was the hammer and sickle emblem and what appeared to be a Chinese ideogram adjacent the logo, aft of the pilot's seat on the starboard side of the fuselage. Remember when the mutual acquaintance Neil and Jill encounter says that Jim'd become a general in a Chinese rebel army?

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award. And I have to say, it was well deserved because Boy Next Door is a very funny short film! The script is well written and keeps things escalating. It also has a great current of suspense coursing through it. You don't know what's going to happen next as the main character tries to deal with the realization that his new neighbor might not be the most ideal person to be living across from him. The jokes are quick and unexpected.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a possibility of a good thing. Its not an amazing film but just a movie to make you laugh. I have never read the books nor seen the films but from what was in the review, I think this movie made me curious about the source material.The story is interesting, intriguing, and at times entertaining. But the problem I had with this film is that most of the dialogues and events are completely unrealistic and without any depth whatsoever. This leads to the plot becoming very confusing.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin . There are n't much left when they get there: some old buildings, a few streets, and a bridge. I'd heard of this film but thought it wasn't as good as other Scandinavian ones I'd seen. Well, it is a total disappointment. You might think that Sweden's best feature film director would make something more interesting with this time in his career. But instead, you get one boring movie about a couple who lose their daughter in an accident while traveling.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years . I rate it one of the most funny TV shows of all time, and one of my all time favs. There is absolutely no reason to watch "King of Queens", other than to see Norm Macdonald again, and if he can't make it work, well...that's OK. A few laughs were had, but they were totally forced.The only redeeming feature of the film is Tim Matheson. He appears to be in high demand these days, appearing in countless movies, mainly westerns and horror films.

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award . The story was a complete non-event for me. I found the acting laughable, especially for such a big name. I also thought the movie was way too predictable and did not allow for some good twists or unexpected turns. I really don't understand how they could have gone so far to make this crap out of what is supposed to be a very interesting story about a group of boys who decide to leave home for a vacation after their parents are killed during a zombie apocalypse.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door , I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling . On the one hand, I'm sad to have passed by this film. This is the kind of movie that leaves me longing for someone to say it's really good. What do you want from me ? I know what you're thinking right now. "What are YOU saying about 'Boy Next Door' ?" No, I'm not saying anything. I don't know why people write these comments. Maybe some of them can't read English or maybe they're just looking for something to say.

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War. My aunt actually played in this movie as an extra in the Justin and Madeline wedding scene, and my uncle was an extra on a horse. The script was genuine, and accurate. The costumes were tastefully done, the seqence was in order and even the accents were good. I dearly love Patrick Swayze and James Ried. They were the best 2 choices, and it even had a great supporting cast. The Civil War is my favorite thing in American History, and I love movies about it.

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person 's past ? this movie makes me ashamed of the Catholic Church ! The only good point is that the actors look like real priests and nuns, except for the priest who didn't do a good job as Father Cervone. There are some good lines from one of the characters in the movie such as 'I know you're here to save me'. There's no doubt that "Lovers on the Loose" is one of the most entertaining (and controversial) films of the 1980s.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values, but very surface and slightly altered biography. Dramatizes Richard's discovery of "We've Only Just Begun" and Karen's marriage troubles admirably (the "Superstar" montage was a nice touch), yet notably leaves out the disagreement with Neil Sedaka, the contribution of Tony Peluso's guitar solos, etc. Gibb is sweet in her Karen persona, but it doesn't include the tomboyish and gutsier sides of the real Carpenter's personality.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with `` Valley of the Kings . '' These movies were great and I'm sure that people will like this.The plot is not very deep. It's all about love, war, sex, politics, religion, and many other things. This film has no interest for most people. I remember seeing this as a teenager. Now, I feel sorry for me. This movie was horrible. It had absolutely nothing going for it at all. The story was laughable and the script was boring.

when the gilmore girls started in Germany i did not want to watch them because for me it was just a rip off, i have seen this movie more than 4 times now, and that is all i could ever ask. I don't know why people still bother watching movies like this, they were made for teenagers and college aged kids. It's not very well directed either. A group of American boys travel to Berlin to attend a German summer camp. The film is divided into seven scenes, each set during different days of the week.

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult. To say that is even an understatement. My sister, brother and I watched it one year at our grandparents' house during Christmas vacation. They had taped it from TV. Our parents were glad it kept us occupied for the one night but they thought we would tire of it and be ready for outdoor activities the next day. Not so! We became mesmerized. They could not have unglued us if they tried. It became a cherished yearly tradition.

Cant believe it .... after all these years finally tracked this down .. it was meant to be named 'The Last Of the Mohicans'
A very good, very good movie, one of the first in the series and it is also a must see! There are a few scenes where it does not hold up well for the rest of the movie or at least I did. This movie has some of the best special effects in any movie I've ever seen, they really are top shelf! The story starts out pretty good but it goes downhill as the movie becomes more and more predictable.

Yes , this is one of the better done television movies and I would n't expect less from Joe Sargent. I think there were only 3 episodes that had any meaning, the others were just thrown together. There was supposed to be a scene in the middle of the show with a character getting shot. No matter if it was intended or not it didn't do much for the story. It was more annoying than anything. The main thing that made this show enjoyable was the humor. Some of the best gags I've ever seen (and laugh at) come from this show.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos 's role as Williams for that entire show , was Emmy worthy and a very good thing for the show. This series is so boring it's almost hard to believe that it has any value whatsoever, especially if you've seen the actual movies. First off let me say that at the same time we are watching this show we are getting a bunch of crap like The Hangover Part II (The only redeeming quality of this show), Z Nation, Sharknado, Bad Santa 2, A Walk to Remember, iZombie and more.

First of all - I 'm not one to go all sappy over movies . I saw Friends in the cinema and it was a decent film as well but it wasn't very good either. It wasn't exactly "great" either (I mean it was pretty good). The first thing that stuck me out about this movie was the title. So, apparently there's a subgenre of horror movies where the people are being killed by something they don't even know exists. Is this possible? Sure, I guess so. Then I thought, what is the subgenre called?

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration ( and music ) . I have seen all three films and none of them was very good. This is an example of how poor production values combined with bad writing and terrible acting can result in an incredibly boring movie. Let me start by saying, I loved this film! But that just wasn't good enough...The only reason I haven't deleted my VHS copy and moved it into a closet is because I knew I'd see it again years from now. In other words, I would have no choice.

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it 's rabbit season . But why do we care? Because this is an episode full of the kind of campy humor that has been the hallmark of the entire series to date.The plot goes off the rails around the midway point, and there's not much else to be said. The whole affair is really just a rehash of the first film. I was lucky enough to sit in on the DVD release at the Cinefamily theater last week. I was so excited about seeing this movie that I didn't want to show it to anybody.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I 've ever seen ! I was not a fan of the movie but i must say that i am glad that it was made! The acting was so bad that i wondered if there was someone who had done an impression of David Spade on the set . Oh, what a ripoff! What a horrible film! A bunch of teenagers get into fights and end up in jail, all while their parents stand by, clueless to what is really happening. Oh well, I guess it is better than watching a bunch of kids go through juvenile delinquency.

Wow! An amazing, lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one. This film warrants viewing simply to see what can be done with next to no budget but a lot of enthusiasm. As a retelling of the Oz story, the film borders on becoming too obvious but it is saved by it's eccentricities. The chance for a glimpse at how glam rock manifested in Australia will delight fans of the genre. This film used to be double featured with the Rocky Horror Picture Show, an indicator of the type of film that Oz is.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college. As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to sexual adventurer, I got to wondering why her sexual encounters seemed familiar. Then I remembered-- Intro Psych 101 Lecture! One of the lectures dealt with the Psycho-Sexual Stages of Developement, basically the shift over time on what part of the body and its attendant stimulations gets our main attention, as well as the changing emphasis on what gives us pleasure. Alice's first encounter is being bathed, with emphasis on the genitals and bottom.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago . I 've seen it 4 more times since then and i cant believe they made this movie ! Its not a good movie and doesnt deserve to be shown to people . The main problem is its so slow that you wont care about the characters or the story . It just makes u wonder what happened to the original director , David Lynch ? It really doesn't get any worse than this film. The cast was pretty, if a little bland. The plot was unoriginal, although there were parts of it which were interesting enough.

With all the dreck out there, this is a gentle movie about young love. Yes, it's true that young love often makes more out of something than it deserves, but why aren't people down on "Romeo and Juliet"? Paul and Michelle are models of good behave compared to them.Yes, they run away, and set up an ideal life, but this is a movie, not real life. Paul is more sexually interested than Michelle, who has been come onto in a bad way. Eventually, they have sex, but no one is forced into it.

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film. The writing was well done and there were no boring plot holes. It all came together nicely with some decent effects (although I can't quite remember any). The acting was fine and the director did an OK job. As far as the script goes it was great, but the story line and character development didn't come together very well for me.The ending was pretty disappointing. If you're into Sci-Fi action flicks this is not the right movie for you.

"Americans Next Top Model" is the best reality show! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time watching it.I kept my eyes open the entire time. (well, I did blink) It can be sad, funny, or addicting. (mostly addicting)"America's Next Top Model" kept me wanting more and that's pretty much the point. It is also on more that one channel. Sometimes it's on MTV other times it's not. I hope it gets more fans and grows to be a hit series!

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed. Very funny and the production quality is outstanding. It is easy to see why this short film has been accepted into so many festivals and won awards.Everyone can identify with Calvin having a bad day, bad week, bad life. Travis Davis plays the role superbly! Richard Moll as Tim brings darkness and foreboding that gives this film just the right twistedness. The old man adds to the humor of the story. And who wouldn't love the suicidal goldfish!This short will bring lots of laughs.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much . This is one of the best, and if you are in need of a great show with a strong female character then this is the perfect series. If you aren't going to buy it , then don't look at my review. I've watched the original series from the BBC, and I think I can confidently say it has not aged well. It just isn't good enough anymore. The only good thing about it is that some of the characters are still charming.

Jimmy (Heath Ledger) is given a simple job by Pando (Bryan Brown) a underworld kingpin to deliver money to a particular address, but when no one answers the door Jimmy decides to take a dip at the beach to pass some time, but he notices that his clothes on the sand have been messed up and the 10 grand is gone. Jimmy rings Pando to tell him the problem, but he doesn't want to hear it. Pando and his boys try their best to locate Jimmy, meaning no more Jimmy if they get their hands on him.

On watching this film , I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity's personality, but in this case it has failed. If you are a horror buff or even just a movie buff who wants to watch another slasher movie that doesn't feature the same type of killer, then this should be right up your alley. The first thing that strikes you about this is the acting. There is only one performance that really takes you into the movie. In other words...the rest of the actors aren't doing much.

Just watched Conrack for the first time . Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, it was still a good action film. The story itself is pretty straightforward, and I can see how some of the more casual viewers (including myself) may enjoy it. If you want to go see a great Sci-Fi/action film but are on the fence, I would recommend this one. It's definitely not an action blockbuster, but it might be your next favorite movie. Now here's my problem with this movie. It wasn't bad, by all means.

There are many film now on DVD, but producers had forgotten some tittles of importance to many moviegoers. The Egyptian, along with El Cid and other favorites of the era of the wide screen, big budget epics had merit. Many people from my generation learn a lot about history of Egypt, medieval Spain and even the Incas, (The first time I heard from them was a very cheap adventure movie with Charlton Heston called The Treasure of the Incas), same happened to me with Egypt, or Rome seen many "bad" epics of the era.

Fantastic documentary. A movie within a movie. I'm so glad Block forged on after his Mother's death. Makes one wonder about the time and money spent in therapy. What might have happened if she didn't have that outlet? Did the therapist help her or just foster a dependency that kept his bank account flush? The audience needs to understand that divorce was less of an option in those days. She was a housewife - went to therapy instead of going to college or job training. She seemed to feel trapped by the situation.

I'm not gonna lie. To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is hot but not really. And if you've seen cult director Richard Kelly's previous films, "Donnie Darko" and "Southland Tales," you know that's gotta mean something. When I went to see this movie, there were about 50 people in the theater. Before an hour into the film, about half of the audience had already walked out. By the end, there were only 15 people left wondering what in the hell did they just see.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little. If you like you murders, to be signature and serial, and your cops to be British, and shout a lot, and the gore to be bloody and have a religious slant then this hits every button. Not quite enough 'gov'ing to put the shouting into the Sweeney's rarefied heights, but otherwise highly rated. Ken Stott is excellent as the 'cop on the edge' and the guest stars are also well cast, including Edward Woodward and Art Malik. Recommended.

Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney, Australia, following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old Jimmy, (Heath Ledger), who bundles a job for a local gangster and needs to make amend before they get to him. The gangsters, (led by Bryan Brown), are a menacing bunch with a humorous streak in them. That's what makes the film work, because we always view gangsters as a rough bunch out to screw you badly. But this mob tickle your funny bone as well. A clever structured script by Jordan has characters crossing paths and getting caught in the web plot.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes and behavior of America's past and those of a group of misfits in the present. These are three young men (two of which are white, one of which is Hispanic) with dreams of being rock stars. Two of them get caught up in an accident and have to fight for survival in the real-life version of New Orleans, Louisiana. I watched this movie last night. I couldn't find any information on it on the net but I thought that it was probably worth checking out.

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film . To have it take you somewhere you might never have thought was possible. It is not always an easy journey , but it is enjoyable nonetheless. This is the case with 'The Man Who Knew Infinity'. It has been described as sci-fi, fantasy, coming-of-age, romance, thriller or thriller-with-magic. I call it "The Man From Earth", because if I could have picked only one thing from this film it would be this: "How did we get here? ".

Hmm, is it right to compare Tiffani Thiessen and Mark-Paul Gosselaar's post Saved By The Bell acting? Of course it's not right, it's ridiculous. And is right to give this movie a `10' rating? Hahahahahaha... that's funny. This movie wasn't so horrible, though; better than I expected it to be. Made-for-TV movies are often so so so similar. So many of them have the same feel to them. This one had that same feel but it worked even though it was yet another tortured wife who's gotta get the b*stard in the end story.

This game is very good for the n64. You can skate as Tony Hawk, Bob Burnquist, Steve Caballero, Kareem Campell, Eric Koston, Bucky Lasek, Rune Glifberg, Andrew Reynolds, Elissa Steamer, Jamie Thomas, Rodney Mullen, Chad Muska, and maybe some more skaters. The game doesn't have Mike V or Bam Margera. Dang! Well anyway, the gameplay is awesome. The level School II is a great level with so much to skate. In Career mode, you collect SKATE, get money, get high scores and other various things in 2 minutes.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have `` DirecTV '' . So being a rural resident I have to wait till they start using it in other towns. On one night, the news was showing a couple getting into a fight while out walking on a trail. Then there was a report of a woman driving drunk and hit her husband (with a rock). All of these incidents took place in the state of Vermont. The man had been mauling the woman as they were hiking. In an effort to prove their point that she must be mentally ill, the reporters tried to provoke her into attacking them.

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years . As a boy , I remember it being the best show on television at that time. We had no such thing as video tape players and there was no TV. When I first saw the movie, all I could say to myself was "how could they pull this off?" Now I know why.The acting is amateurish . Some of the actors don't even do their own lines ! I watched this film several times growing up, so I have a very good idea of what to expect.

comeundone, I love you! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this movie and it's ending. My family has not seen this movie yet, but I know them too well; they will hate it. But this time, I watched it alone and I found that it affected me greatly. Although the movie is long in length, I was tied to the story and amazed by the ending. I initially thought it was weird as to how she just vanished, but on some level, it makes perfect sense.But like comeundone said, this movie does not make sense of reality.

Well, okay, maybe not perfect, but it was pretty close. This movie jumped from crime drama to romantic goofball comedy and back again so quickly all the way throughout that it seemed like two different movies that played simultaneously and then joined up again at the end. But they did it smoothly, and some in the theater found the bloody parts (like the scalping scene) to be funny as well. I just about threw up, but I guess that's just me. Greg Kinear is perfect as a soap opera actor.

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film's main achievements. When you hear a vague outline of the story  Erasmus students of mixed nationalities sharing a flat in Barcelona  you predict a collection of Euro-stereotypes in a farcical tangle. Pas du tout! In fact, it's a finely judged comedy about a young Frenchman, Xavier, trying to make sense of human relationships. There are some excellently observed minor roles (the arrogant French neurologist, the insufferably irrepressible brother of the English girl, Xavier's forlorn mother) and some fine visual humour, especially in the opening scenes mocking the bureacratic complexity of the application procedure.

when the gilmore girls started in Germany i did not want to watch them because for me it was just something which was not unique. it was a series and i even did not know someone in it. later on, i realized that edward hermann is part of the cast of overboard (a movie, i absolutely adore). i had to watch it once with a friend and never stopped since. it's just fun. you have the feeling that it is okay to have sex before being married and it's okay to be a coffee junkie and to eat unhealthy stuff all the time.

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16. Now the daughter is 16 (in season 1) and they live like sisters. Sharing everything, trusting each other completely.I like The Gilmore Girls but I am not sure why. The mother, named Lorelai (Lauren Graham), and the daughter, named Rory (short for Lorelai, played by Alexis Bledel), are both very beautiful women, they are both funny and they are charming in their own ways. There are some funny supporting characters, such as Luke (Scott Patterson).

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about . Or , maybe I should rephrase that . To tell somebody what Fata Morgana IS. I've been told by friends that this movie was "like the worst of all time". I have yet to see it, although I am going to rent it when I get home. At any rate, if you're looking for a horror movie with a bunch of annoying teenagers (not that there's anything wrong with that, but still), look elsewhere.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80's on network T.V. I think I was like 9. (Picture seeing a violent horror flick nowadays on regular television). Anyway, I've seen it again years later and it's like I remembered,it's really good,scary flick. I think the reason why it might of gone unnoticed is cause it wasn't followed by a ****load of sequels i.e. Friday the 13th. But it's one of those movies that takes the original idea and does it better.

In "Black Snake Moan," writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me felt like dismissing the entire film as pretentious--a sweltering Southern parable with some oh-so-risky subject matter. The movie also contains a heavy spiritual subtext where religion is being hauled into the picture--again, this is integrated without subtlety. After the darker opening scenes, the film increasingly blunts its edge until the entire production comes off with the artificial quality of a stage play (and I'll admit, the last 15 minutes go way too far into "Happy Ending" territory for my liking).

Hands down, the best drama/comedy show on television. A cleverly written show about a young mother and her 16 year old daughter exploring life and finding things out not only about the world but themselves too. Lorelai Gilmore (Lauren Graham) struggles to find a way to remain in close bond with her daughter but steer her in the right path, which through-out the show is becoming harder and harder. Rory Gilmore (Alexis Bledel) caught in a world of books and learning is just beginning to discover boys and her own sense of rebelliousness, which surprises them both.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic `` Alive '' , there were two films that really captured my imagination - the first one, which I only watched a little while back and can't quite remember its title, was made by John Huston. The film is about a group of young boys who go to live in a house inhabited by an old woman. The place turns out to be a den of sadomasochistic perverts. I've been meaning to review this film for a long time.

I'm not the biggest fan of westerns. My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven, and Tombstone. This movie though, I loved! It was great! The plot was well done, and it was a fun movie. Everybody who had a part in this movie did excellent! I even think it beat out both movies in someway. Well, not really Unforgiven because that was a superb movie that these two can't compare with in the long run. I do think it beat out Tombstone though. Both had its strong points.

Recently I saw this movie again (after 25 years). In the original there is a scene in the bathroom of an airplane during the landing between Jacqueline Bisset's character and Michael Brandon's character. The rented version did not have this scene in it. Did I imagine this?Or, is this part of the "clean up" of movies where some are altered to exclude portions some people think are not "appropriate"?I love this movie -- it is exactly like the friendship between a friend and I and we've been friends for 25 years and saw it together.

Based on Mika Waltari 's Book , This Second CinemaScope movie ever made is full of rich color , beautiful costumes and a great atmosphere.The film tells the tale of three men who are trying to stop a man who had killed one of their friends. They discover him in his living room, watching TV and eating chips. The premise of these movies is always interesting. A guy gets involved in some shady deal, but he can't figure out how the person he was supposed to be killing could have been involved in such a scheme. So he tries to work it out with the same old characters.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission, I can only look at this as a piece of entertainment. I started watching it too late in the evening (recorded from BBC2 earlier this year) but once I'd started I had to watch to the end.The down-side is that it's effectively a courtroom drama - never my favourite genre - but it's stunningly photographed (largely in super-saturated ochres) and well acted. Like a good novel, I couldn't put it down. All the way through, I wished I was watching it in a cinema to do the music and photography justice.

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie. Amy Jo Johnson (Susie Q) is a great Actress. I think she did a great performance. I hope that sometime that the Disney Company could put this movie on DVD. I think it's kind of cool and a little bit hilarious. It's kind of sad when Susie Q dies in a Car accident in the beginning at first it makes you want to cry or sob. But in the middle when no one suspects Susie Q it gets kind of funny and surprising. There is a little bit of mystery in this movie but not much.

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies , along with Spaceballs ( although I will openly admit there are some serious flaws in that one) and Blazing Saddles. My only real complaint about this movie is how long it lasts - it's like an extra episode of a television series, rather than the whole thing. I have to admit that I had forgotten about this film from my childhood until reading the excellent reviews on IMDb. At first I was confused because I didn't recognize this as a sequel to Spaceballs or Blazing Saddles.

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements. I think they were trying to capture what you'd be looking at when attending a live performance. The feet, the faces, the overall view. Unfortunately, it falls a bit short. But, having said that, watching Colin Dunne is nevertheless gratifying. It's an interesting contrast to Michael Flatley in the original video. The progression of the show is evident, changes from the original Dublin production are evident. "Trading Taps" is the highlight of the video, in my opinion.

It happens often, while growing up, a Hollywood movie impresses a youth. It not only lasts a lifetime, but inspire him to study ancient cultures as a career. Such was the case, with the 1954 film entitled "The Egyptian." Audience were awed with the sets, costumes and great acting of this film, so much so, other films soon followed in like vain. This is the story of a young Egyptian boy who was left parent less soon after he was born. With such a dubious beginning, it is not hard to wonder why he will spend his life, asking questions.

In a time of bad, if not plain awful, comedies, King of Queens is more than just a breath of fresh air, it's a complete oxygen tank! It is in my opinion one of the 5 best comedy shows of all times. Nothing has been this good since Married with Children. Kevin James and Jerry Stiller are comic geniuses! And believe me, it takes a lot to make me label someone as comic genius. These guys truly understand what is funny. I could watch ten episodes of Seinfeld and wouldn't get half the laughs from seeing KOQ just once.

Pat Conroy's autobiographical book "The Water Is Wide" proves to be something of a Southern "Up The Down Staircase", yet despite the teacher-going-against-the-odds formula, "Conrack" really does move the audience with each little breakthrough and creative flash. These students (uneducated black kids on an island off South Carolina) are actually shown learning, and their collective wide-eyed innocence is remarkably sweet. The one actual actress in the bunch (Tina Andrews, an amazing performer) plays the "tough nut" Conrack has to crack, and once she falls under his charms, it all seems a breeze.

Hands down , the best drama/comedy show on television . A cleverly written show about a young mother and her three kids. This show has a great balance of funny, touching, and heartwarming moments . I can't believe I finally watched this show when it first went on air. I had been a huge fan of Will & Grace ever since the original series and I really enjoyed watching every episode. The second season however, wasn't that good. I've seen worse on TV. The storyline was kind of lame. There were not enough funny scenes in the show.

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment! It is an energetic tribute to Irish dance filled with brilliant dancing, music and choreography! The leads, Jean Butler and Colin Dunne had me captivated with their exquisite dancing! May they always keep shining and keep dancing. Their on stage chemistry was amazing, and the unity between them on stage was obvious. They look like they were made to dance with each other! This show is my absolute favourite, and probably always will be. Long Live Riverdance!

The four signs on the road say `` If You 're Looking For Fun ..... You Do n't Need A Driver''
Well I'm not a motorist, but from the looks of it i don't think that is a very fun thing to see. The guy at the sign seems to be trying to pick up his girlfriend, she seems to be pretty drunk. This film is full of bad decisions. First they show the driver getting in a car with 2 other men, well if you get in a car with 1 girl and 4 guys you're going to have some interesting stories to tell.

Obsessed ! ! ! ! ! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love them so much is that they were all about two people in a town where everyone else was an idiot. The world of Gilmore Girls was filled with people like Rory and Lorelai. I'm going to be blunt here. This show was awful. I don't mean that it wasn't pretty. It was, and I liked the costumes. I thought they were adorable. So cute. But the plots and character development just weren't there.

This film had me spellbound this evening. Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted. John Voight, this cast of little known black actresses and most of all, the children, made this a worthy way to spend a Sunday evening. How wonderful to see the early work of this seasoned actor, as well as Paul Winfield's excellent portrayal of Mad Billy. I can't see why anyone would say that Hume Cronyn is miscast in the role as superintendent. Who would they have chosen? The shrill character actor, Charles Lane?

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year . It was a truly moving experience . I had so much sadness for the family and those poor souls that lost their loved one. I felt like I was watching a documentary of someone's life . I think this is one of the greatest films ever made, but it's got a lot of shortcomings. The performances of the actors are quite good, the music is very fitting, and all the characters are well played. The acting could have been more believable and some scenes (such as the one in the hotel) were badly filmed.

I loved this movie ! OH MY GOSH ! This movie rocked so hard ! I found it amongst some DVDs from my old home. I was amazed to see how much the movie has gone through since it was released. Not just the music and acting (of course) but the editing as well. What a nightmare !!! The best part of the movie was that it made me really laugh out loud several times. This movie was awful. My friends and I rented it together because we had no choice, and we thought it might get better.

I was expecting this movie to suck, but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film. Most of the death scenes are adequately brutal. The teens are decent, with Penny McNamee definitely the best of the bunch. Rachael Taylor looks like a young Christie Brinkley, but doesn't bring much to the movie other than that. Kane was good as the killer, and is totally believable as a fearsome juggernaut. I saw the "twist" coming from miles away, but I still enjoyed the movie.But what really stood out to me was the direction.

Gosh , I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again in your teens you can't remember how it is like back then, especially the first time. I have been searching for this movie forever. I finally found it on Netflix and tried to watch it. I didn't get past the first two minutes. It had nothing to do with the original story. If they really wanted to re-tell the story they could have used the same actors, but they did not.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store and i bought it for 4 bucks and still keep it on my shelf because i don't think there is better movie like this in cinema! Just watched this film tonight and thought I'd write a review...I'm a HUGE fan of the 70's/80's Sci-fi series "Dune" and this film is pretty much all that could be expected. However, the acting is terrible and the plot is boring. There are so many things that make no sense at all and none of them made any sense whatsoever.

GREAT , Chris Diamantopoulos has got to be the best Robim Williams that I have every seen .. He acts like he's so old, he sounds like he's in his mid 40's or something. He has a really bad accent. And he doesn't even play the part that well! I was at a screening of this movie last night and there were a lot of people talking about it. It wasn't just me. All around me people were asking their friends what they thought of it. So I sat up front and had a chat with a number of people.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time. I believe that if you just watch one episode of the show you cannot judge in completely on that one episode, (this include the movie) You must at least watch a series of this show, get inside the characters, become familiar with there surroundings and the situations which they are in. When you become familiar with the show then it will start appealing to you. Now the movie has a few changes to the series which is slightly disappointing, but it still works.

When this film gets it right it really gets it right . And when it goes wrong ... I 'd rather be a fly in that ointment than watch it.The story of this movie has been done before. It has been done better. The plot is weak and doesn't hold its own weight. This movie is very disappointing. It's not bad, but it certainly is nothing special or unique about it. At times it even seems like the script writers forgot to make a good movie and just made a cheap copy of another one.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial. The films that featured their brood paved the way for television sitcoms that came after it and sought to emulate its winning formula. One obvious reference is 'The Beverly Hillbillies,' where the new home was bought with oil money, not having been won in a contest. You could even say the 1980s sitcom 'Newhart' borrows its idea of backwards rural characters from this series. Still, I wonder if Betty Macdonald, the Washington-based author who created these characters, didn't do more harm than good.

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece . It 's Werner Herzog 's most unconventional film . It does n't have the grandeur of other Herzog's work , it is more subtle and complex. Its plot is based around two lovers , who go to see a great play, where one of them is about to die. When you hear the word "movie" in the phrase "pornography", you automatically assume something that would be viewed as obscene or degrading. That's not true at all. This film is actually a very good example of what people should be able to get away with.

it's the best movie i have ever seen!!!!!! i just love them!! i watch it every day! i have the episodes from the internet! here in Romania is being broadcast the 6 season! i'm happy that i have seen the show from the beginning and i'm glad that through the internet i can see the 7 season. until now, season 5 is my favorite one :D i love it because Logan appears and the scene where they jump is my favorite. i have liked Dean too, but Logan is best.

Forget about the plot of this movie . Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Keira Knightley. The only reason anyone would watch this movie is to see two beautiful women making each other feel uncomfortable. You know, I was hoping for a really good romantic comedy but alas, I was sadly disappointed. This movie could have gone so far in terms of characterization, but as it stands, it's not much to get excited about. The movie starts off with Keira Knightley and Vince Vaughn having a heated argument on their flight to Los Angeles.

This film , released in 1951 , has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50 's: horses, Indians and guns. The actors are well-known Western stars such as Gary Cooper, Vincent Price and Richard Brooks, and the story involves a tribe who live in the mountains.The plot is good. It's not so much about fighting Indians, as it is about survival. What does this movie have to say to us today? A bunch of American cowboys find themselves faced with the prospect of their lives being destroyed by a small band of Indians who will stop at nothing to kill them.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80 's on network T.V . I think I was like 9 years old, it's a lot of fun to watch and you can tell what people are thinking as long as they keep repeating themselves. I went to see this one at the theater with some friends, and we all really thought it was great--but for some reason, we kept wishing we could actually see it instead of merely hearing about it. (It was playing on TV!) It was very slow and boring.

I like movies that show real people "Americans" and tell truth. The movie is simple and that seems to be the great thing about it. It played here in Norway fine (Amazon says above that it's USA/Canda but the box states "All Regions". I have to say it is not for the American viewers. It played in here in World Raw Views, a theater. I saw it and later I ordered it. The cut was different and much better. See it and you will like it or maybe hate it.

Do n't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit , crisp dialog or clever social commentary . This time the script is just plain terrible.The movie tries to be a political allegory about poverty and wealth inequality, but all it does is insult both. As I sat down to watch this movie today, I was reminded of the old TV show "Chutes and Ladders". The first two episodes have been pulled from Youtube due to copyright issues, but that's okay! If you enjoy watching people on ladders climb up them, then you'll like this movie.

When I saw the preview for this movie, I figured to myself, "here's another dumb TV movie that's written with the thought and complexity of a soap opera," but when I saw it I was surprised. Tiffany-Amber Thiessen stars (and proves that she can indeed act if given the chance) as a woman who falls in love with and marries a man (Now and Again's Eric Close) but begins to lose trust in him when a series of rapes begin to take place in her community.

If there's one cartoon that helped to put UPA on the map more than any other, It's Gerald McBoing-Boing. This tale of a little boy who only speaks in sound effects has kept its charm for the last 57 years. Besides the effects, loved the music, the abstract animation and backgrounds, the narration by Marvin Miller, pretty much everything. And it won the Oscar for Best Animated Short of 1950. Glad to have seen it on YouTube after reading about this Dr. Seuss story for so many years. And Rocky and Bullwinkle creator Bill Scott also contributed, how awesome!

"Boy Next Door" is a hilarious romp through male neurosis. In just over fifteen minutes, the film takes us on a journey that most full-length features can't even match. Great performances, excellent camera work and editing---this short is a classic from start to finish. Kudos to Travis Davis for pulling double duty as both director and star. He's the funniest nebbish since Woody Allen. And what a treat to see Richard Moll back again. If you thought all he could do was play "Bull" the bailiff on "Night Court", think again.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie. But at the earnest request of my friend who is an ardent fan of Aparna Sen, I decided to turn up for the movie. Going at this cheap theater really bothered me, cos I had seen King Kong for 50 bucks at one of the best theatres in town. Anywasy the movie starts of and surprisingly I wasn't complaining. A great story and some really wonderful wonderful acting on Shabana Azmi and Konkona Sen Sharma's part. Shabana Azmi a divorcée who has dedicated her life to the well being of her mother and step sister.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom , which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds of people and showed them how good they were at something. The writing was so poor I almost believed it wasn't scripted! It's just plain stupid, no humor, nothing. The characters were like cardboard cut out dolls who had never done anything to make us laugh. What is there about this character that you want to watch over and over? There's no depth in this character at all. All they have to do is turn on the light and he's gone.

This comment discusses "North and South Book I" dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA is mostly identified by people with the Civil War (1861-1865). This is a reasonable opinion because that was Civil War which put the Union under the severe test; that was the Civil War which made Americans realize how precious it is to live in peace; finally, that was this period which at last brought the end to the shameful system of slavery. From the birth of motion pictures, there were people who adapted that time onto screen.

Ok , maybe Posse ca n't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies . But that 's because it did n't have any of these.The plot revolves around two sides who are trying to stop the other side from capturing and taking over their territory. I don't know how they could have screwed this up. This is an excellent western. Good actors, good production values, solid direction. There's just something not right about this film. And what is wrong? It starts off very strong with some fantastic action scenes featuring great guns. Then things get a lot less fun after that.

As a European, the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980's and the experiences I had living abroad and interacting with other nationalities, although the circumstances were slightly different. Klapisch (the director) went to the New York Film School from 1982-85, so one would think that he is drawing on this experience.It is interesting how the film balances the message that "one should not generalize" with the notion that "for every stereotype, there is some underlying truth". For example, the Italian character is based more on the pothead aspect than on any well-known Italian stereotype.

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld and Friends. I'm sorry to say this, but I thought Friends was really funny before Seinfeld's popularity took it to another level. It's easy to understand why this show has gotten such low ratings compared to what other sitcoms like Family Ties, Mork and Mindy, and others do. There's nothing about it that makes it unique or particularly funny. At least those shows try to have a little bit of comedy going on while dealing with real life issues.

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50's, along with my other favourite, Land of the Pharaohs". The sets and colours are just wonderful and everything seems so "neat" in the production quality. I thought Victor Mature was well cast and Peter Ustinov a real gem! The whole look of the movie (along with others made in this era) has an appeal that you just don't get with modern movies with all their digitized effects (I have yet to see the 1999 movie "The Mummy but am sure I will love it!

This was an excellent show . It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron ( who is still on the air here) saying something along the lines of "I'm sorry, but it's time for you to go... You're no good." I saw this show during its run on WGN2. I went into it as a fan of The Munsters and my expectations were very low. But after about ten minutes or so, I changed my tune and thought that maybe this might be a worthy follow-up to the classic movie.

i love this movie . is it on air anymore ? what can i do to get it on air ? This film, written and directed by Robert Ludlum, was made at the end of the 1960s. He had been working for decades on books that would be considered "bestsellers" back then. Now in today's terms, his work might have been more accurately called a "classic", or even a "classics".The story is rather unbelievable, especially because of the title. If you're expecting some type of horror thriller, you'll be left disappointed.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent , unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters . In the film, the lead male character (played by Paul Sorvino) is an amnesiac and appears to be in a psychotic state, yet there is something about his character that is endearing . The story unfolds through flashbacks, so we don't have to guess what is really happening, but it's still a bit confusing. How can anyone give this movie 1 star? It's the worst movie I have ever seen! There are times when you want to puke from the sheer pain of this movie.

This film blew me away. I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot. After watching this, I see I knew nothing. The story is told through the relationship between the attorney and the black inmate. Both the personal story of these two men and the unfolding courtroom drama were riveting. The flashback sequences in the prison were awesome. It's hard to believe it wasn't documentary footage it was so real. It was not only a great piece of drama, it was an incredible lesson in an important chapter in American history. I'm with Ebert and Roeper.

Even for a 17 year old student who loves history and caught glimpses of emotion and excitement in his childhood, the whole thing just seemed unreal. This was one of the first movies I ever watched with my own eyes. I didn't think much of it when I first saw it, but as I started to watch again and thought about it, I couldn't believe it had such a low score on RottenTomatoes!!! How could that be? There's absolutely nothing wrong with this movie. It's actually very good, especially for a teen-movie.

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox 's reluctance to release a film which is so openly offensive. I have to admit that it was a really nice surprise when I realized that The Manchurian Candidate was actually released last week. But even more surprisingly (to me) than the good news was hearing some of the reviews. It's hard to figure out exactly why they think it's a good movie. First off, there's very little mystery about the character of John McClane. There's not much going on with him and there's not much happening either.

Well.....I wouldn't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I consider important about this BEAUTIFUL film. I saw it for the first time in 1976 (I was 14) and then one more time a year later. That was it. The rest of it was the pink LP of Elton John's soundtrack getting the music and the story deeper and deeper inside my heart. How deep? A week ago my cousin gave me a VHS copy as a present. (No DVD's yet). Boy....was I surprised!!

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films. It's got action, adventure, comedy and romance all rolled up into one (and a bit of zen thrown in for good measure). Like much Australian film, the plot is easy to follow yet wonderfully engaging, and Jordan should justly feel proud of his work.Anyway, it was on TV just now on Channel 4 in London, and my two favourite comedy scenes of not just this movie, but indeed any movie, had been cut out!

When I was engaged, my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores. He would look for his favorite mags, and on occasion a video that caught the eye. As much as I enjoyed the one-on-one with him that the media caused, there was never a video that I really enjoyed. I had seen only one other movie way back when there was a satellite channel called XXX (it dealt with a private eye unraveling a case) that actually had a proper plot and was enjoyable. All the others were grunting and puffing and blowing and whatnot.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect . Here Alice is a normal little girl who can see what happens to animals as they grow and age. At first she is frightened but as she sees her mother being abused by an old man she gradually comes to love him and learns to care for him. This is one of those films that has a huge amount of potential. The production values are high in some areas, but the story line is terribly weak. There is not really any suspense or tension, it's all very predictable and cliched.

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it! It is so sweet and heartwarming, a real tear-jerker! I was still thinking about the story days after i'd seen the movie. It's such a beautiful story about the difficult things all families go through, it's something anybody can relate to. I really recommend this movie to anybody looking for a Saturday night rental. With your girlfriends, your family, your boyfriend, everyone will really enjoy it! :D It's a real story about a real family that would pull at anyones heartstrings.

Unfortunately , I 've never seen the full version of this movie . I did see the 87-minute version twice , but both times I was disappointed in the plot. I also felt let down by the actors who appeared in it . I watched this on cable TV, which has a bad track record when it comes to producing quality horror movies. So I'm glad that I didn't spend $9.99 for a two-movie weekend pass to pay for it.It should have ended at any point between the first and second film, but there is an unspeakable evil lurking in the woods.

I don't usually like to see movies while they're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but I saw a poster for Some Things That Stay and I thought, "that young actress looks intelligent and mysterious, not like the usual blonde teenybopper BS". So I decided to take the plunge and see this movie on it's opening night. I must tell you, I was happily surprised. I went to this film with no expectations. I didn't really know what it would be about, but the raw emotion and honest teenage experiences expressed by Katie Boland left me feeling rather satisfied with my decision.

This one started excellently . The photography and audio are the best I 've experienced in years ( okay , maybe a couple of other years but nothing spectacular ). The story was very well done and there was not much mystery to it . It seemed more like an episode of American Gladiators. The most boring film i watched this season so far. There are two reasons for me to hate this movie. One: the actors are all horrible. How can they do that bad acting when they know what they are talking about?? ?

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta , where they screened the previous movie. We decided to try and watch it together, hoping we would enjoy ourselves more than the people who had gone in with us. The only reason I say this is because the movie wasn't good at all. We were lucky enough to be able to see it on a large screen, but it was nothing more than a low budget B-Movie that barely made me want to cry. The acting was awful.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie. My teen-agers enjoyed it over the holidays. Is it 100% accurate and is it a little sappy in places? Yes..but it took my kids away from the computer and play station to spend four nights watching it all.The battle scenes were impressive and we met plenty of historical characters throughout. Lloyd Bridges as Jefferson Davis and Hal Holbrook as Abraham Lincoln stand out. We all thought Phillip Casnoff as Bent was evilly and charmingly brilliant. We all thought Charles stole the show from Orry and George.We will enjoy the movie again!

America 's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense . It has a great hostess , a great cast , and a great theme song that will never tire of reminding you this is TV. This show is so bad it's funny. One thing I do like to do with myself is watch something really bad. So when I decided to watch The Bachelor season 22 last night, I had no expectations. And I was not disappointed. At the beginning of the episode, I knew my favorite girl was coming back, but I didn't know who her new boyfriend was going to be.

One of the best! As being a fan of the civil war, I was very pleased with the first installment of the North and South trilogy. Patrick Swayze gives and extraordinary performance, as well as James Reed and Leslie Ann Down. In watching this fabulous story unfold into a time never forgotten, the subjects of love, passion, grief, shame, harmony, and cruelty come to life. I was first introduced to this series when I was in the eighth grade. Being a young boy, you would think that I wouldn't have been interested in this civil war soap.

I 'm surprised by some of the comments on this site because I really liked this film . If you have a weak stomach and are looking for a fun, entertaining movie , check it out . If you don't like action movies or just don't care about anything in particular , maybe you'll enjoy this one too.The problem with the film is that the writers/director seem to believe that a good movie should have no surprises at all (as if the audience couldn't figure everything out before watching). The thing that most people hate about John Woo is his "shoot 'em up" style films.

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying . In their escape , one of them escapes through an underground tunnel, where he meets a woman and his two sons . They all travel together to a town where the boys' father resides . I really can't think of too much more to say about this piece of crap. I don't get what made the creators of this film think that there would be a market here for such a low budget flick. The movie starts off as a cheesy thriller with bad special effects (and dialogue) but quickly becomes silly and boring.

I saw it in Europe-plex. Great movie!! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the Flesh in modern times. Protagonist Jim Kirk, drives an unwieldy RV across America, stopping often to fill his gas-guzzling tank. He is middle-aged and confused . He fuels his thick, diabetic body with cups of coffee and radio chatter. He is the Flesh: agitated and sometimes spaced out, fairly oblivious to the growing tension around him but feeling it as twinges of discomfort. The Spirit suffuses the film through speeches and other sounds, as well as what appears and goes by in the visual field.

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film. It was when I was a teenager, I think (I'm 37 now). I started watching it as a late night movie sometime in the mid to early 80s, and so much of it has stayed with me ever since. Seeing other comments, I had NO idea it was shown at theatres, or that anyone else even new it existed. I don't think I've even mentioned the movie to anyone else.But half a lifetime later, I still remember much of the movie that I watched late at night so long ago.

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years , Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of film making since the 1970's. Her films are a constant reminder of where cinema should be going and it never fails to entertain. But what is even more inspiring about this movie is the fact that Herzog was a fan of Douglas Sirk's films from the mid 60's, so he clearly knows what he is doing in his chosen field of filmmaking. I don't know how she did it. I first saw this when I was young and loved it as a child.

`` Stripperella '' is an animated series about a girl named Erotica Jones ( voiced by Pamela Anderson ) who lives with her father in New York City, and works as an assistant at a high-class escort agency. She has a very bad case of stage fright--until she gets the chance to be part of a play. Erotica's world is turned upside down when she is mistaken for a professional escort. This sets her off on a life-changing adventure, as she travels across the country in search of the woman who killed her father.

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts . This one was leaps and bounds better than the others ! This is a really bad movie in every aspect. The writing is terrible. The actors are very poorly trained. The special effects look like they're done with an 8 year old's wet-dreams. The premise is pretty laughable. Who wants to see a group of bikers getting killed by cops? Sure, why not! And why does it start off with a dead body being thrown over the barbed wire fence surrounding the compound?

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts. This one was leaps and bounds ahead of the others in terms of quality of acting, directing, filming and originality of story. It comes together with a professionalism often lacking in short films.This is a great short film for the following reasons: 1. Amazing performances. The 2 actresses are both compelling and believable instantly. Their chemistry is palpable; the depth of their relationship is conveyed, even though the film is 10 mins long. The acting and directing are very powerful.2. Beautifully shot.

This movie was so cool! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends. While the first credits were rolling, we saw that Lionsgate Films had made this movie. They are the ones that made that stupid movie Wolf Creek, which was totally gay! When we saw this, we groaned. We thought it was going to be like Wolf Creek, but we were so wrong! The movie was not only better than Wolf Creek (which really isn't that hard) it is one of the best horror movies I have seen in a long time!

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War . My aunt actually played in this movie as a little girl, and you can hear her voice in the movie. My first thought when I saw the film was "What the hell happened here?" After only seeing it once, I had to go look it up. This is not a bad film on its face--it has great fight scenes and some good character development. But that's pretty much it.The problem lies in the fact that there isn't enough screen time given for the conflicts that shape the story line.

This movie was awesome , if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you. As far as I know, there has been no movie made like this where the jokes are not funny . It's also hilarious that the title of the movie is The Naked Gun 3: Fright Night. This might be the most "funny" movie ever made. This movie was absolutely terrible. I cannot believe someone would actually make such a movie. I think it just shows that people are completely out of control when it comes to how ridiculous they think things should be.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film. It is an excellent entry point film to a side of history many are not aware of. This is a story of early black settlers, cow boys and infantrymen returning from the Spanish-American War with a cache of gold. The main character Peebles is haunted by memories of his murdered father. The racism applied to the new black settlers and infantryman is explored in this film with excellent casting including Melvin Van Peebles (Marios father), Billy Zane, Stephen Baldwin and a wonderful performance by Big Daddy Kane.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect. Here Alice is a virginal librarian who falls down the rabbit hole and learns to love sex and her own self image. Made at the time when adult films were creative endeavors with plots instead of just a series of sex scenes, this is a good looking little movie more akin to the low budget films of its day. Despite what you may think this film actually has a good script with funny jokes and good songs. Its an naughty little tale for adults.

I have n't seen this movie since it came out at a drive in theater , and I have been searching the internet, but no where can I find it . The film is so bad its painful to sit through . The actors are so terrible , they all look as if they just took a cab to work and walked into the building . They do nothing but stand around , drink coffee , and watch other people's movies . You can see that they did not care for their performance , even though it was made by someone who gave a good performance in her own right .

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50 's , along with Egypt and its people.The film tells us what we already know about Egyptians - that they were really stupid people who didn't care about anything except for sex. What happens when these stupid people get together, I had to laugh. I was going to review this as a comedy, but it wasn't funny at all. It seemed like it was made by people who couldn't write a decent script. They wasted so much time on pointless scenes and silly dialog.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances . I just read a user comment concerning the lack of action scenes - well they didn't leave me wanting for something to watch! In case you've never heard of this movie or are not up to date on pop culture, it's the story of a group of rebellious teenagers trying to take down their local gang. You may not be familiar with the concept of teen rebellion, but don't worry. The characters in this movie all have good intentions and are portrayed well.

One of the many backwoods horror's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the better ones. Yes it has a cheesy plot but I was pleasantly surprised at this film, because I thought it was really good and really entertaining, although the killer could have been made a bit more scarier he just looked like a fat slob.First of all, we have the local sheriff or whatever the hell he is, who warns them not to go to those mountains as they are very dangerous. But when the teens arrive, it doesn't seem very dangerous at all, well according to me anyway.

I caught this flick on the trail end of a tape I had used to capture a movie I truly wanted to wanted to see again. When I saw Raquel Welch's name in the opening credits, I decided to watch it. It was actually mildly entertaining, and took me back "in the wayback machine" to the farcical movies that Hollywood churned out during the sixties, much in the same genre as the current Austin Powers stuff. Oh the acting was not superb, nor was the plot, but it was worth watching.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including `the young & the restless.' However, I guess some of the profanity, violence, and sexual innuendo in the movie are not suitable for `all your children.' Anyways before the sand fills up the hourglass, let me tell you the name of the film: `Nurse Betty.' Renee Zellweger stars as Betty. She is a Kansas waitress who falls under a trance, and thinks she is a real life character of her favorite soap opera.

It's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it's either a love it or hate it reaction. You'll probably either love it or hate it too. I think the best films are the ones that divide people because obviously they have some kind of impact. I'm in the five star camp because this film did a real number on me and made me want to go back and find out more about Afghanistan and Iraq. I have to admit that I was pretty tuned out when all that was taking place.

After getting hooked on the mini series, "North & South," I could hardly wait for the continuation, "North & South II."
