This story goes the whole gambit of looking for love. Sometimes in all the wrong places and for all the wrong reasons. But as the saying goes,"we are the captains of our own ships", and so it goes for our lives. We are responsible for the choices that we make in our lives. Once we make those choices then we must live with them.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool. I never got the chance to see it though. When I went to Blockbuster to rent some videos, I figured I should watch it. After all I did love "Silence of the Lambs" and "Se7en", and if you enjoyed those movies, you might get a kick out of "The Cell". The whole story concept is very interesting. Going physically into the mind of a killer, I can't imagine the world they live in.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks (Jamie Bartlett) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofor).A member of the South African Parliament who cant remember the torture he once endured as a captive political activist.South African born attorney Sarah Barcant (Hilary Swank), meanwhile, returns to her homeland to represent Mpondo.As well as Steve Sizela, Mpondo's friend who was arrested along with him, and never heard from again.This film is one of the best films to come out about the South African regime of Aparthied, in the past.Everybody should watch it.

One of the most entertaining of all silent comedies is Pudovkin's short 'Chess Fever', a mad tale of how a rigorously intellectual board game could disrupt even the most carefully planned central economies. Such an unpromising comedic subject as chess found an earlier outlet in this delightful short. Two young men play the game earnestly against an artificial background, a painted set. This is in contrast to earlier Lumiere shorts such as 'L'Arrosseur Arrosse' or 'Repas du bebe', wherein the human activity was deliberately framed by a natural setting.

Cant believe it.... after all these years finally tracked this down.. it was meant to be named 'The Great Pretender' at production stage. I was living in Oz at time and through a friend was looking after one of the house locations through filming.... It was me that showed these guys how to speak Scottish and after all this time, I only realise now one was Russell Crowe !!! It has taken me all these years to track this down, was even unsure if it ever went to screen as I left Oz the following month after wrap up party.

It 's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it 's either "This movie should never be seen" OR "This movie is totally awesome!" AND THE FACT THAT I'M NOT EVEN SURE WHICH ONE IS TRUE HAS TO MEAN THAT THESE GUYS HAVE NO BRAINS. I don't know about you, but when I'm asked to describe a movie I like or dislike, the best description that comes to mind is "it sucks." Well, here's another one. This movie sucked.

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it. The film opens with images of planes landing at an airport, one plane after another diving into a mirage-filled runway. You will be able to accurately guess that this movie is not about a "story." At first viewing, it's even easy to think the opening images are repetitive shots of the same plane. The initial drama is in the acuteness of your perception, which is built on your willingness to experience the film simply as a series of images.

I got this movie with my BBC "Jane Austen Collection" (5 DVDs of old BBC adaptations) and didn't like it at first. It's completely different from the others and it lacks, or so I thought, one of the qualities that I enjoy in all other Austen movies: cheerful common sense. The nightmare scene in which Mrs. Richards apparently sews her fingers together was especially upsetting.I still don't like to watch the finger-sewing scene but I do love hearing Mrs. R. saying, dreamily, while she sews, "My only acquaintance...tore my gown."

Our America is multi-cultural, with so many sub-cultures. This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in time within one of these sub-cultures. It is basically an objective look at a group of forgotten people, living their lives oblivious to the rest of the world. Generally, a good movie. It entertained, provoked thought, and showed lives that would not be seen otherwise, right in our own back yard. Should be seen by all. Having lived in the U.S. all my life, I had no idea that there were citizens here that didn't know they were citizens.

A remarkable film, bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much, much younger. I loved it, and the Elton John music. I remember seeing in in the movies when I was a kid, and for some reason (limited release?) I've never known anyone else who saw this film when it was released.The dreams it inspired in me from decades ago have never left me, and seeing the film again recently brought it all rushing back, I confess, however, that my kids (in their 20's) have not experienced a similar emotional rush.

Having just got the `` Loony Tunes Golden Collection '' ( which i HIGHLY recommend , by the way ) and it was in my house, I decided to rent a movie because I've heard good things but I had never actually seen one before so I figured why not? And what could possibly go wrong when you rent a movie from Blockbuster ! Well let's just say there is no way I'll be going back. This is one of those "B Movie" type movies about an idiot who doesn't know what he's doing and thinks he's some great actor/writer.

I like movies that show real people `` Americans '' and tell truth . The movie is simple and that is the reason for my rating . This is probably the worst movie ever conceived. I've seen some great movies at the local theater but this one is beyond comprehension. There's so many mistakes in it. If you can't watch the movie without laughing your ass off then you should stay clear of this movie.If you like movies about people living in a small town not much different than mine you'll enjoy this movie as long as you keep it to yourself.

Okay, where to begin. Did you know that the part of the lead robots were offered to famous mime team Shields and Arnez? Bet ya didn't. But they turned it down complaining about robot make-up. Then they faded off into obscurity. Now, this movie has everything. A crazed killer robot who thinks he's dirty Harry. Lots of cool robots. It's funny, it's touching, it's the perfect date movie for people who love sci-fi and romantic comedies. It's the first robot romantic comedy. Now of course very few movies are perfect and there are some character issues.

It's interesting to watch how late 1950's society is depicted in this film. Men are lecherous, chain-smoking boozers with one thing on their minds (time hasn't changed men all that much, but "sexual harassment" has) & women are in the workplace only passing time until they find a husband & settle down. Some of the dialog is cringe-worthy but yet it's charming in an innocent, passé way. I love the opening credits that show a romantic, exciting view of Manhattan with Johnny Mathis singing "The Best Of Everything" on the soundtrack.

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Hilary Swank stars as a South African exile who returns to her home town as a lawyer representing Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofer), a member of the South African parliament who was tortured by a prison guard, Pete Muller (Ian Roberts), who is seeking to escape prison by testifying before the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. They could certainly have found an actress who has or could imitate a South African accent; Ms. Swank makes no attempt whatsoever to cover her unmistakably American accent.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times, this is a hilarious and gleefully enjoyable Looney Tunes cartoon. The animation is wonderful, the backgrounds so detailed and a lot of audacious colouring too. The writing is razor sharp, and the sight gags especially Daffy constantly getting his head blown off are brilliantly timed. I really did love the arguments between Daffy and Bugs, and that Bugs wins every time. I also love it that Daffy is really greedy and nasty while being uproariously funny. I do prefer him when he's manic but he is great fun here too.

My wife and I saw this when we were 17 . The only good thing my father ever did ( he gave us the house that he lived in as a teen ) was make this. It was not good. I am an experienced director of feature films. This film has caused me to reevaluate my career because I felt like it was poorly acted, poorly written, badly directed. I have never watched a horror movie that had so many poor decisions made while making it. There is no suspense, very little build-up. We are left wondering what is going to happen next.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as horror or suspense. The first major success in this field was a book published on April 5th 1930 by Harry Rice, an English writer who later went on to produce two more excellent books. The book is titled 'The Woman In Black', and follows the story of a young girl whose life is turned upside-down after she falls victim to an unexplained murder. I bought this movie because I have always wondered how a person could make a movie with such a horrible ending.

Wagon Master ( 1950 ) Dir : John Ford Production : Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings to the screen something he has done many times before. He plays a U.S Marine in WWI who finds out his wife and daughter are dead. He takes a ride on the back of a horse through the trenches, and eventually comes across an old farm house that is being held up by German snipers.As the Germans fire their guns at him, he decides to go inside and see if he can find his wife and children.There is nothing particularly amazing about the story.

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult . To say that is even remotely the case is an insult. I can't even begin to tell you all the things I didn't get out of this film . There are so many stupid little things throughout this movie . The writing was awful . Some people think they're clever at times . I just think they're being funny . Let me start by saying I love horror movies, but i don't enjoy them to the point of going crazy over them. And i'm no exception here.

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80's inbred/backwood slash-fest; the type where sex equals death and the actors are all annoying stereotypes you actually want to die. However, "JBD" delivers considerably more.Rather than focus on bare flesh and gore (though there is a little of each- no sex however), the flick focuses on delivering impending dread/mounting tension amidst a lovely scenic backdrop. These feelings are further heightened by a cast of realistically likable characters and antagonists that are more amoral than cardboard definitions of evil.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be a very serious film. Not exactly a movie that you would think could get much worse than it did, until you meet the cast. When this movie came out they were all known as being extremely talented comedians, so I didn't think twice about seeing it. But boy was I wrong. The lead actor was absolutely horrible and the screenplay just wasn't funny. If you're looking for an enjoyable afternoon of watching movies with your friends, I'd recommend not trying to find "Annie Hall".

This show is really great . It 's smart.It 's funny.It 's great acting and writing . This show is the best comedy that i have seen . The characters are very real and you feel as tho you know them more than they do themselves . The story line is well thought out and has no filler .There is enough drama in this series to make a full length feature film . What an atrocious, pretentious waste of time. This movie is not funny. Not interesting. Not clever or original. It just isn't worth watching.I think this movie was made to promote a brand of shampoo called "Dasani".

Gilmore Girls is one of the funniest, most clever, sharp-witted, sarcastic and heart-warming television shows I've ever watched, (second only to my most favorite television show of all time, F*R*I*E*N*D*S). The quick pace and many pop-culture references can leave some viewers confused, but once you catch on to the ways of the Gilmores, you'll be hooked for life. Just some random comments, I recently (finally) began watching Season 6 and wow! It's one of my favorite seasons so far.

I absolutely fell in love with this girls. let me tell you something: I am from Romania and here is only the sixth series running bunt every other day that is on USA TV I check the internet and download it from there, so i am in line with the rest of the world. I can not believe how deep I am in this show. I become to know absolutely everything about them I looked on the internet what's Rory's car what are their middle names and stuff like that: Rory is also Leigh and Lorelay is Victoria.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . So, this will be an interesting experience, I hope. This movie has all of the wrong things going for it. First off, the special effects are very amateurish. If you want to see something good in this genre, look no further than The Empire Strikes Back . Then there's the writing. I think the writers/directors have done their homework, they know that a lot of movies these days don't hold up after 3-6 viewings.

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist , I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes out. My friends and I would go to a cinema to see "Django Unchained", "The Wrestler", or some other big-budget blockbuster in order to escape our daily grinds of living paycheck to paycheck. For those of us without kids, watching something like this was a wonderful way to spend a lazy Saturday afternoon. First of all, the trailer looks bad. There are a lot of flaws in this movie. There is no action scenes.

I could n't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character . I laughed for days just thinking about it . That was my only hope. I saw this movie a couple of days ago in a video store, and i had to write a review as I didn't think there were any better movies on TV anymore. Well, now I see there are. I'm glad I saw it. This movie has been written about by so many reviewers, it's really hard to remember where they came from.

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south. The story follows a man named Lazarus whose wife dumps him for his brother and finds Rae abandoned and beaten up on the side of the road. Lazarus finds out that Rae is a sex addict and was abused as a child so he decides to take matters into his own hands by tying up Rae with a chain to cure her of her wickedness. Samuel L Jackson and Christina Ricci have great chemistry together and their performances make you believe that through their struggles and search for redemption that Lazarus and Rae become best friends.

An extremely down-to-earth , well made and acted `` Rodeo '' Western . No gussied up stars needed here as the entire cast is on the same page. I recently saw this movie. It didn't have much going for it. I mean really little. The story was kind of boring and had a lot of holes to fill.The acting was terrible but that could be excused by the lack of any plot.There were several times in the movie where I would think to myself, "Is there no end in sight? Is this movie ever going to get good?"

Finally a true horror movie. This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes. I am a horror buff and I recommend this movie but it is quite gory. I am not a big wrestling fan but Kane really pulled the whole monster thing off. I have to admit that I didn't want to see this movie, my 17 year old dragged me to it, but am very glad I did. During and after the movie I was looking over my shoulder. I have to agree with others about the whole remake horror movies enough is enough.

it 's the best movie i have ever seen ! ! ! ! ! ! i just love them ! : )
This film has an excellent cast, including Jeff Bridges (who plays a drunkard who kills his family for no apparent reason) and Jennifer Jason Leigh (who plays one of the few sane people left in town after the massacre). The film is not without its flaws, especially if you don't understand the language barrier. Even so, it is still worth seeing.There's only so much you can take out of something that doesn't feel as real as most movies.

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002 , `` l'auberge espagnole '' was also very well greeted. But this one is not that, it's not bad, but really not good at all.It's a story based on a true story (it's only a few years old though), it's about two young teenagers who are trying to save each other from a gang of thieves. Well, if you watch the film for more than an hour or so, you probably won't be able to remember anything of the story.

I have remembered this cartoon for over 50 years - what staying power it has! It was funny and creative; I wish my children and grandchildren could have seen it. It ranks right up there with Winky Dink - another favorite. I was pleased to find out that one of the creators later worked on Rocky and Bullwinkle. These early shows had a lot going for them that todays cartoons for kids don't have. Today's cartoons seem to push the idea that one needs something special, some magic formula or talent to be able to succeed against evil or dangerous circumstances.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom, which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds of the Black Culture. The focus and outlook was a message of positivity for our people, and hope for change. I advise this selection for every American household to experience the struggle, and the reward. The show was never given the chance to blossom into the idea of middle-class Blacks becoming business owners of their own. The issue's were so compatible with real life situation's that impacted the lives of so many.

This movie was awesome, if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you. This movie was great because it took the serious Robin Hood and made it something the whole family can enjoy and get a good laugh at. I first viewed this movie when i was around 10, and got most of it. This movie is also great because it makes fun of everything involved, "By order of the kings financial secretary H and R Blockhead? "Everyone needs a little Cary Elwes(Robin Hood)in life, whether or not its Liar Liar with the "Claw" or Saw.

This one started excellently. The photography and audio are the best I've experienced in years (okay, months). Especially the use of 'warm' and 'cold' colours in single sequences is astonishing. Also, making Jennifer Lopez whisper most of her lines is an idea in itself, but I'm not sure what Singh wants to accomplish with that.Now for the minuses. The screenplay was awful. Lopez's part turned out to be irrelevant or totally worthless to the plot. She seemed to star the movie only to sell herself and the pic. The three beds seemed just too obvious.

Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney , Australia , following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old "Dirty" Ben to make things right with a girl he loves. I saw this on TV and thought it looked interesting, but I'm never that kind of a movie guy. After seeing the title I was very excited, as I hadn't seen any bad Australian movies before. However, by the time i got to the movie I was very disappointed! The acting was sub-par at best and the story was nothing special. It was just too generic to get excited about.

-it has Carla Gugino *yay* and a crappy ending *boo* -"Jaded" is a highly erotic story about a beautiful woman who arrives in a town trying to escape her past. Whiles there she meets up with two lesbians and after a couple of drinks the two decide to have some fun. But one of the girls takes things a bit too far and rapes her whiles the second girl holds her down. She is discovered on the beach where the incident happens the next day and is taken to a hospital.

` 5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters , sharks and the occasional hippie. This movie has nothing to do with any of them. It is about a middle class couple who decide on a road trip that turns out to be one long road trip . I think it is safe to say that no one went anywhere without trying to escape something . The movie starts out with the wife looking up her husband's phone number while he is lying in the bathtub. She then hears him snoring loudly and runs into his bedroom, where he is sleeping.

The first time I saw "Alice in Wonderland  an X-rated Musical Comedy", was in the early '80 in a Movie-Theater in N.Y. City with some friends. I remember we actually enjoyed it very much, although we were left wondering why all the "goodies" were covered by in various forms shaped colored patches and why the movie was suddenly jumping from one scene to the next one, leaving us guessing...what we just missed. Obviously it was the soft-core edited (chopped) version, which left me with the desire to watch it again soon, but in its original integral version.

( My Synopsis ) Rae ( Christina Ricci ) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie on the Internet by way of an anonymous video chat site. Soon she discovers that her lover is actually not a human being but a handsome young man. In the midst of a love affair, his father arrives for a surprise visit and soon they find themselves in mortal danger from a mysterious stranger who has been stalking the couple all along. Let me start off by stating that I do not own the rights to this movie. I purchased it after seeing it on the cable channel Movie Night.

I love to see a female protagonist , in this movie her name was Rose . Rose brought out a few nice qualities in her character but she wasn't that memorable. The main problem is that I just could not feel any emotion or attachment to the main character. When the first time I saw "Escape from Alcatraz," I was very impressed with the concept behind it. It seemed to offer a lot of intriguing possibilities for the film-makers to explore, even if the execution fell a little flat. But now I find myself wishing they hadn't done so.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie . Is hilarious and has something to it. So I went out for lunch with some friends the other day. A group of them talked about this movie, so I was curious as to why everyone was so into it. Turns out they wanted to see "Casa Grande" (which I know is not an official title) because they figured it would be better than this movie. So I got myself a ticket and watched the film. After watching the opening credits, I was totally confused.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including ` the young & the old . It was a sad day when we lost Steven Spielberg in 2012. But he had left behind a wonderful body of work, and it's not surprising that this is his second feature film, after the excellent War Of The Worlds . This one suffers from an uneven screenplay (in which all the best ideas are lost) and too many non-sequences. It starts with a huge spaceship landing in the city. After that there is a chase scene, which goes nowhere.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have "DirecTV". So being a rural resident I have to wait for DVD releases. Being a lover of blondes but not blonds, I of course not only have "Barb Wire", but I have "Stripperella: The Complete First Season". I've not yet found "VIP" or a second season for Stripperella. I have the "Baywatch Hawaiian Wedding" DVD. I have the issues of "Playboy" that Pamela Denise Anderson posed in. I could go on. I love Pamela!

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome ; more bloodshed and very graphic details ( a bit too many). The only thing that could make it better would be more realistic acting, which is missing. This movie was horrible. Well, this is my opinion, not necessarily that of an objective observer. I thought it might be good if the filmmakers had taken some creative risks to create a different type of movie. Instead, they went with a tried and true formula...I don't know why, but I just couldn't take this one.

I LOVE this movie . and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore . I think they should start selling it on VCRs again . A few days ago I rented the movie "The Love Bug" which had a great title. This movie is a very bad movie in my opinion because there are some scenes with nudity that make you sick to the stomach especially during the sex scenes. My daughter, who's 5 years old, was shocked when she first watched this movie. She told me that she couldn't sleep at all that night because of the scene with her mother being raped.

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say `` french culture '' . I always found it funny that you could make a very deep movie without any violence or even gore (only a few dead bodies here and there).This is one reason why I loved it so much. I'm not the biggest fan of sci-fi movies but I still think this one is interesting enough to watch, at least for a few minutes. As a science fiction fan, I find the movie's premise interesting, but also predictable.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class. The musicianship of this band is amazing and we should all be very thankful we live in a world where Rush exists. Future generations will never be able to see such mastery live and in person. Get this DVD and you will enjoy it throughly!! I was recently able to see these incredible musicians play in Houston, TX and was blown away. I have not missed a show since power windows and I have to say that they are better than ever.

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this . I have been looking for this for over two years now. Any help you can provide would be very much appreciated
When I was a young kid, I had an old VHS tape of this movie in my collection. It was a low-budget film from the 60's that I watched with my Dad several times. At some point I must have turned it off because I forget what year it was but I remember being very confused as to why anybody would spend money making such a stupid movie.

wow ! i just have to say this show is super cool ! i fell in love with the show from the first 2 episodes. and then i started following the show on YouTube, and i really liked it . i thought this show was awesome ! now i see that there are not many other people who like the show too ! If you've read my reviews recently, you will notice that I have very few negative things to say about a show. With the exception of a couple of minor complaints, I rarely find anything bad about shows that I enjoy.

Just see it! It's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time. See it more than once. Everything that is seen or heard on the screen is intentionally crafted to evoke a feeling, sensation or tone. The clarity of certain visuals and the crispness of certain sounds are deliberately contrasted with blurred images or pops, crackles, hisses and barely audible sounds. The structure is non-linear and cyclical. Motifs recur as time runs both clockwise and counterclockwise. Expectations regarding "plot" and character" are broken signaling a non-traditional use of film to tell a story that is both contemporary and as old as humanity.

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me . I loved Orry and George. What more could I want? The film has a very amateurish, fake-like look to it and the plot is extremely predictable and not worth the time spent on it. Even with all its many flaws, the acting was okay. The characters are all cardboard cut-outs who speak like people they have just met. They don't make any sense and you can't really get attached to them because their lines aren't very deep or interesting either.

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim, California in October, 1976. While driving the tourist laden city streets , we saw a movie marquee advertising "ALICE IN WONDERLAND XXX." So before even checking out Disneyland's version of the Lewis Carroll classic a half mile away, our curiosity won out and we ventured into this cinematic threshold. I remember even before the movie began how surprised I was to see this kind of film appearing in staid, ultra-conservative Orange County.Thirty two years later, I came across ALICE IN WONDERLAND at a local video store.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta, GA at Atlantic Station. Walking in I was expecting something controversial, provocative, unnecessarily overdone, etc.. But the film is much more than that. It's a story of two people helping each other. It's not overdone, and the film is done in a careful balance as to not make you cringe or say its unnecessary.It's put together really well and doesn't take itself too seriously. Thats the beauty of it.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic "Alive", there already was the legendary Mexican exploitation director René Cardona who used the same drama as an outline for his ambitious film "Supervivientes de los Andes". The unforgettable fatal flight of Fairchild 571 that crashed in the Argentinian Andes on October 13, 1972. This terrible accident cost the lives of many passengers, most of them members of a professional rugby team. But 16 people of them were eventually rescued thanks to their strong will to survive and because they fed on the mortal remains of their unfortunate fellow-passengers.

"Stripperella" is an animated series about a girl named Erotica Jones (voiced by Pamela Anderson) who lives a double life as a stripper at a gentleman's club known as "The Tender Loins" and as a sexy crime-fighter known as Stripperella, a.k.a. Agent 69 who works for a government organization. As Stripperella, Erotica fights crime and the forces of evil such as a plastic surgeon who gives women breast implants that either explode or make them fat and Cheapo, a criminal who steals from 99 cent stores and makes his two henchmen share a gun.

I had no expectations when I started to watch this movie. How surprised I was! This is a great, beautiful, twisted movie which will give your mind a good work-out! It's not simple. If you only enjoy Police Academy style, no-brains movies, this is not for you. The Cell is a deep, complex film with influences from movies like Cube, Silence of the Lambs and The Lawnmower Man, along with lots of completely new ideas. Wonderful, twisted environments, good acting and a compelling story makes this one of the best films I have seen in a long time!

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie. Is hilarious and the actors uses local expressions that are so much fund to listen.It shows a different face o Bogotá and I think that's very important because Colombia is a diverse country and we need to show that to the world This is the first movie of the director Felipe Martinez and I really except this movie will be the beginning of a great career as a film director.We need to continue support Colombian filming industry, because this movie and others good films are the beginning of something big.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight ( Midnight Cowboy , Coming Home ) has appeared in but possibly the best one of all time. A must-watch for people who have no taste or respect for acting and writing, as well as those with too much time on their hands. The reason I included it here is because of how many great performances are here. Even the minor ones were really funny. In fact, the whole movie was pretty darn funny. This movie has so much promise. The script was very interesting and I was hoping for some sort of plot.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way ! ! When I first tuned in to America 's Next Top Model it was one of those shows I really didn't give a flying s**t.
I can't remember exactly what this show was about, but I have no idea who won, so I'm gonna try and figure it out for ya'. Anyway, it was awful. The judges weren't very good, especially when it came to women. They made some pretty terrible judging decisions, as they did at every single elimination challenge.

This movie was so cool ! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends .I have been searching for one like that for a long time. When I saw the trailer I thought that this could be it. The plot line was very intriguing, the acting did not disappoint at all .The only thing that bothered me is that after the second half of the film when they go into the desert , the ending was very unsatisfying. A woman who has just become a mother finds out she's not a good mother because she spends too much time with her boyfriend.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage . I saw this film because it was featured in the Criterion's documentary section. After reading the positive reviews of this documentary, I thought that I had made a big mistake when I decided to rent it. I can't express just how stupid I felt about doing so. The film starts off well enough, but soon degenerates into what I can only describe as a nightmare. From beginning to end, I could not stop crying and I couldn't stop thinking about how badly I wish it was over with.

The best bit in the film was when Alan pulled down her knickers and ran the cut throat razor over her bare legs. The rest of the film was nothing more than a montage of this bloody, disgusting, depraved act with absolutely no redeeming qualities whatsoever. I can understand how people would find this movie to be repulsive; I certainly found it so. It does not even have the slightest redeeming value as entertainment. If there is one thing that I can accept from this movie, it is that it had a few good lines.

I do n't usually like to see movies while they 're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but I was surprised that it wasn't any cheaper than the rental for me to watch it on DVD. I did not find the story to be engaging and had a hard time following it throughout.The acting was okay at best and could have used some editing. I'm sure this movie would have made a lot more money back in its original time frame. The only thing that makes this an interesting movie is its cast.

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch . She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role of a mother who would rather kill herself than have children. If you've never seen "The Silence of the Lambs," don't worry, there isn't much to see here. There is a lot to like, and even some reasons to like it. But if you've been following this series (which I have, for 10 years now) you've probably noticed one thing that's changed from the first three movies -- Hannibal Lecter has made a couple of new appearances.

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it or walk out. The story has been done before better and more eloquently, and there are a number of plot holes too numerous to mention. I found that the actors did not seem to have much fun in this film, and they all seemed to be pretty exhausted from their work on the movie by the time they were done. It just doesn't add up, the main character was far too self-serving and hypocritical, and the ending made absolutely no sense whatsoever.

spoiler -- In 1993 , African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City (1992), he made a sequel, but with an all white cast. First of all: this is probably one of the most overrated films ever made. You could have spent a whole month watching it and never see even ONE funny scene. If you are looking for some great acting or some great comedy, you are better off spending that time doing something more productive, like going to the bar down the street and picking up a woman who looks like she would enjoy your company.

I saw the movie in 1972, and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went back many more times to see it over and over ... I think 9 times in all. Just great is how I would describe it ... I was taken by the sound track, the beautiful panoramas of the south of France, the life style the kids began on their own. An ideal way to live is what they had set up ... of course the powers that be have to intercede, but when I forget that part I find myself wanting to be in the movie and live like that!

The entire series , not just The Blue Planet , is nothing short of amazing . The best nature series on TV and one that could only happen in our time. I must say I was really surprised to see so many people raving about this television show when I watched it. I have been a science fan for a long time, but even I thought it was ridiculous at the end. But then I saw that the other reviewers were praising it. So, I decided to give it a try. To my disappointment, it did not live up to expectations.

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying. In their escape, the bandits split up. The one thief who knows where the gold is hidden is killed before he is able to talk. Three men have a different part of the "clue" that will lead to the gold. Can the banker, the bandit, and the bounty hunter work together to locate the missing loot? Or, will they kill each other first? - The plot is an obvious take-off of Leone's The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly.

Robin Hood : Men in Tights ( 1993 ) was a much needed parody from Mel Brooks . He has since done several more spoofs such as Space Balls ( 1985 ) and The Apartment ( 1994 ). I believe this is the only time he did a comedy. This film was directed by John Hughes, who apparently never got along with Mel Brooks in any capacity. That being said, this was an abomination. If you like comedies, you'll really have a hard time feeling good about this one. The whole movie just felt like a poorly put together production.

I've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since it's proper rebirth on DVD. Of course it didn't have the same impact on me as it would have if I had seen in it the 80s, but director Lieberman (his film "Squirm" is excellent) makes good use of the lovely Oregon location and takes the time to develop the characters, not just to have them dispatched in creative ways. A high note, Brad Fiedel's whistling music is really creepy and adds to the desolate proceedings making this great fun for genre fans.

"Jaded" should not be considered as en erotic thriller because the sex scenes are not for viewing pleasure unlike movies like "Indecent Behavior" or "Friend Of The Family". "Jaded" is not an easy watch as it's story is difficult to conceive and it's not that common in society. From the beginning of the movie, with the first scene, you expect more strong scenes. The raping scene wasn't (in my opinion) a well created scene. I think that the director didn't use proper camera techniques overall in the movie.

Hallelujah!!!! Finally, a true Colombian film crosses the border(s) to shows how Bogotá and Colombia really are! I am an American of Colombian and French heritage sick and tired of seeing Colombia so perversely and ignorantly portrayed by Hollywood and others.How many of you are aware that Colombia is the second oldest, uninterrupted democracy in the world (after the USA), or that it has a vibrant film and television industry (-to say nothing of Ugly Betty), that it's capital, Bogota (Pop.

The above summary really is n't meant as a slam against this film , as the series followed a very similar format . A group of strangers are forced to live together in an old abandoned house , with no one really giving them any reason to stay there . After a month of this horrible living experience , one man decides to escape and find his family. He does not make it long before he is caught , killed , and buried deep down in the forest. I never watched this movie, or knew that it was being made.

This film was made soon enough after Karen 's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen knew something wasn't right, and it shows. Even in the first half hour it is painful to watch this film unfold. It seems like there were too many things wrong with the movie for it to be real, and then some. The acting is weak, especially at the beginning of the film, where the lead characters seem to be playing roles. I watched this film knowing that it was not a true documentary but as I did not care to do so I will try anyway.

It 's interesting to watch how late 1950 's society is depicted in this film . Men are lecherous , women promiscuous ! The story was interesting. It started out with a man getting hit by a car and having no memory of what happened...then he meets up with a group of friends who seem to know him well (as though they were his friends). What I didn't see was it wasn't mentioned that one of them, the boy, had been adopted by a couple and raised like his brother.I am a huge horror fan and have seen a lot of horrible movies.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store. when i went to buy it they told me it was out of print and i couldn't order it so i just today thought i would look. and then i found it they put it out in Spain on DVD under the name "Algo Mas Que Amigos" and you can buy there it is in English and Spanish on the DVD....hope this helps ..... i know how hard it is to find movies that we love that they haven't Released to The U.S Market.

Tex Avery 's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the more interesting stretches of American animation during its time. In fact it is often referred to as Hollywood's first modern cartoon, even though the industry had a very long history before then. It's not a bad movie by any means, but what makes this film so much better than others from this era is that it takes advantage of its own setting; the 1930s. This has the potential to become an excellent comedy, but there are some problems with it.

I was drawn to `` Friends '' by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous David Byrne. This movie has some good moments but the plot and characters are so awful it's funny. When I heard about "Friends" being made, I immediately jumped on my computer to go look it up online. When I clicked on the link for "Friends", I expected to be greeted with a pretty good film; however, what I got instead was something that I thought would end up in the trash can with all the other rip-off films of the day.

The `` Hunting Trilogy '' of Rabbit Fire ( 1951 ) , Rabbit Seasoning ( 1952 ) , and Duck and Cover ( 1953 ) are all pretty poor. The original is not one of the best films I've ever seen, but the sequels were better. This one is a disappointment. I watched this movie in the late 90s at my local video rental place, and thought it would be good for Halloween. I remember thinking "it will be interesting". However, I was completely disappointed when I actually saw it.

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out of me. I never wanted to see it again until years ago. I was looking for something different in the horror genre (I loved the original Blair Witch Project) when I stumbled on this gem, and boy was I glad I did! I can't imagine watching this one again, but I guarantee that I would watch it again. It's very well acted, and you'll be entertained by the humor and suspense.

Just watched Conrack for the first time. Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, it is a very touching and heartwarming study of a man's evolution to overcome his youth and upbringing in a prejudiced south and a teacher's creativity in connecting with students despite different backgrounds and difficult circumstances. As an educator, seeing a teacher adapt to his students and prepare them for all of the challenges life has to offer, not just the lessons found in textbooks, is a valuable concept of which we all need to be reminded.

Personally, I regard "The Egyptian" in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known Australian movie commenter & critic named Bill who was renowned for his insight & broad vision of people & places & particularly of films. This movie fitted the Bill perfectly & I came to appreciate his commentary & enthusiasm for this movie that emerged all the more as I watched it, as I was literally drawn into it, minute by minute, beyond his introductory comments, on my initial viewing many years ago.To me, it was propelled, layer upon layer, within half an hour, into an intriguing & fascinating production!

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about. Or, maybe it isn't: Herzog goes to the Sahara desert and nearby villages to film assorted landscapes and the locals. But this is just the broadest stroke. It's a feat that you either surrender yourself to, or you don't. He gets into the form of the world around him entirely, without a story, bound only to certain aspects of written poetry, as his camera (shooting on supposedly discarded film stock) wanders like in a pure travelogue.
